loans.name: Las 7 Calles Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las 7 calles” esta representada por la señora teresa y conformado por 10 miembros 3 varones y 7 mujeres, todos comerciantes del mercado de las 7 calles de ahí el nombre del grupo, todos son muy dinámicos y trabajadores como lo han demostrado en estos dos ciclos que van pasando juntos en la institución. La señora Teresa se dedica al alquiler de su garaje que es amplio y lo usa como estacionamiento durante el día y durante la noche lo alquila como deposito de la mercadería de las señoras que venden en la zona, ella es dueña de una casa en el mercado de las 7 calle y se encuentra bien ubicada, ella es madre de tres hijos que ya son mayores y se encuentran estudiando en la universidad, su mayores anhelo es poder verlos profesionales, ella requiere de préstamo para ampliar su negocio dándole un mayor espacio y construyendo depósitos para darles a sus clientas un servicio con mayor seguridad. El resto de las socias se dedican a la venta de salteñas, empanadas, venta de productos de belleza, venta de chinelas bordadas, venta de ropa nueva , venta de edredones, venta de dulces y sodas y al servicio de transporte en moto- taxis. En cuanto al entorno competitivo las socias afirma que es alta pero que ellas saben como cambiar sus productos a artículos de mayor demanda o cambian de lugar de venta para terminar con sus productos el resto de los socios que prestan servicios tiene clientela. El crédito será utilizado para la comprar mercadería como ropa, dulces, harina para la elaboración de empanadas, comprar  productos de belleza y la comprar repuestos de moto, en resumen capitalizar más su actividad comercial para poder crecer, por ejemplo el señor Juan Carlos desea este crédito para la adquisición de otra moto y así rentarla para `poder obtener un mejor ingreso para el sustento de su familia y para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The “Las 7 Calles” group is represented by Teresa and made up of 10 members, 3 men and 7 women. All of them are merchants in the 7 Calles market, and that is how they got their name. All of them are very dynamic and hardworking, as they have shown during these two cycles with the institution. Teresa rents out her garage. It is large and used as a parking lot during the day, and at night is used as a warehouse for merchandise for the women who sell in the area. She is owner of a house in a good location in the 7 Calles market. She is a mother of three grown children who are studying at the university. Her greatest wish is to see them become professionals. She needs the loan to enlarge her business, giving it more space and building storage areas to give her clients a service with more security. The rest of the members sell salteñas, empanadas, beauty products, embroidered slippers, new clothing, candies and sodas and a motorcyle taxi service. In regards to the competitive ambience, the members affirm that it is strong but that they know how to change their products to items in high demand, or they change the place they sell to sell all their products. The rest of the members, who offer services, have their regular clients. The loan will be used to buy merchandise such as clothes, candies, and flour to make empanadas, to buy beauty products and to buy motorcycle parts. In short, to capitalize their business activity more in order to grow. For example, Juan Carlos wants the loan to adquire another motorcycle and rent it out in order to have more income to support his family and be able to give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Abdullokhon

texts.ru: Бурхонов Абдуллохон проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Более 7 лет занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник, где разводит скот для перепродажи их на рынке. В этом ему помогает его семья. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Abdullokhon B. lives in Kulyab. He is 36, married, and has 3 children. For more than 7 years, Mr. B. has been raising cattle. Mr. B. has a small cattle farm where he raises cattle for sale at the market. Mr. B.'s family helps him to run the farm. This loan Mr. B. will use to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Mrs. Sophal P., a 23-year-old married mother of two children who are yet too young to attend school, lives in Chrouy Slaeng village, Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhon Chhen, shown in the photo with her, are plate and pot sellers, each earning a small income to support their family living. Since this business is going well, Mrs. Sophal P. wishes to expand and so is requesting a loan to buy more plates and pots to sell. With this business she hopes to increase their income to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more plates and pots

loans.name: Sainte Bernadette Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité Sainte Bernadette est créé depuis trois ans. Il est composé de 09 femmes toutes de l'Association des femmes Catholiques de la Paroisse de Louga. Elle participent pleinement aux diverses activité de ladite Paroisse. Elles sont toutes issues de la même communauté ecclésiale de Base.

Madame AWA S., debout à l'extrême gauche de la photo est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 39ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. 

Elle est membre du Banc Villageois des femmes Catholiques de Louga depuis trois. Elle a 6 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle n'a jamais eu de problème de recouvrement.

Elle est détentrice d'un kiosque  chez elle où elle vend divers produits tels; des cigarettes, du sucre, des biscuits, du savon en poudre et en morceaux, du thé etc. Elle pratique cette activité depuis 06 ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son kiosque en marchandises et ainsi étendre son petit commerce.

Elle assiste son mari pour la prise en charge de la santé, la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Solidarité Sainte Bernadette group has been created three years ago. Its members are nine women belonging to the Catholic Women’s Association of the Louga parish. They full participate in various parish activities. They are all from the same church community of Base. Mrs. Awa S., standing on the far left on the photo is the group’s leader. She is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children in her care.She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Catholic Women for three [years]. She obtained loans six times, and never had any problems repaying them. She keeps a kiosk by her house where she sells miscellaneous products such as cigarettes, sugar, cookies, soap (powdered and in bars), and tea. She has been in this business for six years. Her new loan will permit her to expand her stock and grow her small business. She helps her husband to meet the expenses related to the healthcare, food, and schooling for her children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cigarettes, cookies, powdered soap, bars of soap, sugar etc

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is married and has six dependents. She has no educational background.

Mary sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) at Takoradi and makes use of her profits by supporting her husband in taking care of the home.

Mary will use the loan to purchase more maize to use for kenkey production. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to use for kenkey production

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco esta situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Maria;  La socia tiene 42 años de edad, ella es viuda  tiene 1 hijo y  se dedica a  la elaboración de velas al por mayor, la socia es profesora jubilada, ella después de cesar como docente, abrió su negocio de velas para que tenga una distracción en la vida como ella misma manifiesta, el préstamo que ella requiere es para su negocio de velas; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en  la compra de insumos para la elaboración de velas.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luz Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Unidos Para El Triunfo” (United for Victory), which is located in the district of Huanchac in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 42 years old, widowed, and has one child. Sra. Luz Maria earns her living by making candles in large quantities. She is a retired schoolteacher who opened her candle business after leaving her career in education. Luz Maria says this business helps to provide a distraction in her life. She needs a loan for her candle business. The proceeds will be invested in the purchase of supplies for making candles.

Luz Maria appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making candles

loans.name: Jemlyn

texts.en:
Sto. Niño, a town in South Cotabato, is known for its farming businesses. 45-year-old Jemlyn D. is no different. He hails from this place and farming has been his way of generating income for his family. He is married with two daughters aged 18 and 16.

Jemlyn requested a loan so that he can buy his farming needs like seed and fertilizer. Business profitability is his main goal so he can support his children’s schooling. Any additional income will go to his family’s daily needs, to future savings and as a church donation.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma G. a hardworking 41 year old mother who hopes to send all her 8 children to school for a better education. As a mother, she understand that the only way she can improve the quality of life of her children is by sending them to school to earn a degree. She believes that education is the only treasure that her children can inherit from her. That is why she joined Ahon sa HIrap, inc., a microfinance institution and partner of KIVA here in the Philippines. She believes that with access to capital she can improve her business and earn more for the school expenses of her children.
  
In the years of her membership she has performed well as a member and as a mother in order to benefit all the program of the institution. Today she is applying for another loan of Php 20,000.00 pesos to buy raw materials such as textile and rags for the production of their pot handlesr, place-mats, and doormat weaving business. The business is run by the couple and with the help of their children during their free time and weekends. The demand of these products is high because of durability and the product quality which the couple maintain. 

Her hope for the business is to increase the production. She also prays that she can profit more so that they can keep up the schooling of their children and daily needs. She is confident that GOD sent people from ASHI and KIVA to help and support her dreams for her family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as textile and rags to use for weaving pot handlers, doormats and placemats

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 48 years old with 6 children between the ages of 8 and 20. He is married to a farmer. All of his children go to school.

He sells cow meat and he has spent 3 years in this business.  With the loan he will buy more meat to sell. With the profit he will save money. His business is known because most of his customers like meat.

He dreams of doubling his business to the extent of getting a big return from one cow that he has slaughtered.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem S. is a village woman and a widow- her husband died of senility a few years ago. She is a local farmer in Kompong Chhnang Province. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $5 per day. She has three teen-aged children, two of whom are single and a third that is employed in a public organization. Kong S. is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. The coming rainfall is good, however, Hem S. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So, Hem S. is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers and a pump machine.

loans.use: To use towards purchasing fertilizers and a pump machine.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en: Monika N. is currently in the business of selling rice, beans and sugar at a small shop. She is requesting a loan to stock more current goods to sell.  Monika is 49 years old and she is widowed. She has one child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her shop.

loans.use: To stock more current goods to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester M. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. She is 32 years old. Ester is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ester owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  vegetables like camote tops & other leafy vegetables. Ester has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ester joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Ester is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ester from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Nelly Mireya

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas. 

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Nelly, ella tiene 40 años de edad,  está soltera  pero de una relación que tuvo hace mucho  tuvo  cuatro hijos de 20 – 17  - 13 y 7 años los mismos que estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela.

Se dedica a la venta productos por catálogos, productos de Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorio para damas). Además de ropa tanto nacional como también colombiana, entre lo que más vende están la ropa intima de mujer que son muy solicitadas por las damas, trabaja todos los días unas cinco horas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, cobra semanalmente y dice que le encanta vender.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería, como camisas, blusas, pantalones, ropa intima y productos Yanbal. Está en el Banco hace tres ciclos y le encanta por la ayuda que le dan. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the 'Las Américas' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees.

Here we meet Nelly.  She is 40 years old, single, and has four children aged 20, 17, 13 and 7 from a relationship she had a long time ago.  Her children are studying at university, high school and elementary school.

Nelly sells products through catalogs and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  As well as national and Colombian clothing, what she sells most of is women's underwear which is very much in demand.  She works for five hours every day.  She sells her products door to door and to order.  She collects her payments every week and she says that she loves to sell.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as shirts, blouses, pants, underwear and Yanbal products.  Nelly has been a member of her community bank for three loan cycles and she likes it for the help that it has given her.  Her dream is to own her own home since the one in which she is currently living is rented.

loans.use: To buy shirts, pants, blouses, underwear and Yanbal products

loans.name: Agossi Donatienne

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Dangbo dans le département de l'Ouémé, Agossi Donatienne est mariée à Grégoire, un revendeur. Agossi Donatienne a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Il y a un an que Agossi Donatienne s'est installée seule au quartier Tchanhounkpamè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Agossi Donatienne n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la coiffure, une activité qu'elle mène depuis six ans. A côté de cette activité, Agossi Donatienne vend des produits de beauté dans son atelier à Tanto. Agossi Donatienne  s'approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Agossi Donatienne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant obtenu quatre prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d'agrandir son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle surtout en période de fête de fin d'année, Agossi Donatienne sollicite à nouveau un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Donatienne Agossi was born in 1980 in Ouémé Department, and is married to Grégoire, a retail merchant.  She has three children, some of whom are in school.  A year ago, she began living on her own in the Tchanhounkpamè neighborhood of Cotonou, Bénin's economic capital.  She did not go to school, but learned hairdressing, which she has worked at for six years.  Besides that, she sells beauty products in her shop in Tanto.  She buys the products in Nigeria, the country next to Bénin.  She has had four previous loans from ALIDé, all repaid in full and on time.  To grow her business and better meet her clients' needs during the holidays, she is asking for another loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Buy beauty products.

loans.name: Rudy Victoria

texts.es:
Rudy es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que se caracteriza por producir principalmente frutas como el mango, la maracuyá y el limón, pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes. Adicionalmente trabaja vendiendo prendas de vestir por pedidos, con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar.

Rudy desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.
texts.en:
Rudy is a 49 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an area with a semi-tropical climate which mainly produces fruit such as mangoes, passion fruit and lemons.  It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Rudy sells beauty products and cosmetics through catalogs.  She has a group of customers who buy her products frequently.  The more orders they make, the more points she earns with the company that provides her products and, therefore, the more profit she makes.  For this reason, she is always working hard to attract more customers.  Rudy also sells clothes to order.  Through these activities, she helps her husband to financially support their household.

Rudy would like to have stable capital so that she can acquire more products and have a permanent stock of cosmetics which will allow her customers to acquire the products they need quickly, without having to wait until the end of the month which is when the orders are delivered.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire more products and to have a permanent stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam D. C. is from the village of Camarag San Isidro. She is 41 years old. Miriam is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Miriam owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Miriam has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Miriam joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miriam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Miriam is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Miriam from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Born in 1965, Veronica N. is married to Solomon and is the mother of five children. The loss of her children is what she most hates to think about. 

As an ambitious woman, she decided to put all the effort she can to see her remaining children established in good vocations in life. Because of the ill health of her husband, she was not able to pay school fees for her children, so they all exceeded the primary school age. Therefore, the only option for them was to drop out of school and stay in the house for a few years before continuing with their education.

Veronica has sought help from GHAPE to operate a business and to pay her children's school fees. Given this loan, she plans to cultivate crops like yams and to sell some foodstuff. She will use the profits to pay school fees and buy medications for her husband.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To clear and till the soil and plant yams to sell

loans.name: Majeedan's Group

texts.en:
Majeedan resides in Faisalabad, Pakistan’s third largest city and famous for its textile industry. She has lived there in a two-room brick house with her husband for the past 18 years.

Majeedan is 40 years old and married to A. M., who has a marble floor-grinding business. Working daily on contracts from various people for the past 10 years, he has built a good reputation based on the quality of his work.

Majeedan herself is a housewife, staying at home and dischargings her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah on behalf of her husband to enable him to buy a new grinding machine because his current machine needs immediate replacement. Majeedan is hopeful that a new grinding machine will help her husband better complete his work and make more profits.

A regular loan user of Asasah, this is Majeedan's fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended all meetings.

loans.use: To buy a new grinding machine for marble floor grinding business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 44-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing/fish vending business and a rice retailing business.  She lives in the municipality of Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing/fish vending and rice retailing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,500. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 18,000 to fund her business operations.  This will be her ninth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elizabeth aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Rham

texts.en:
Rham is from the village of P-3 Malikay, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 30 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children and 2 infant children. To make a living, Rham runs a business venture in the retail sector selling fruit in the local community.

Rham has been engaged in his business for 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. Rham joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Rham is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase fruit to sell . This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rham from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for his retail business

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Timotea; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de vacas, la socia cría las vacas las hace engordar y luego los lleva a lugares como Combata para poder venderlos, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de vacas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para las vacas como pasto al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the “LAS TRIUNFADORAS” communal bank.  The bank is located in the Andahuaylillas district, which belongs to the province of Quispicanchis and department of Cusco.

The associate is Señora Timotea.  She is 33 years of age, lives in a shared home and has 4 children.  The associate alternates her daily activities with the business of buying and selling cattle.  The associate raises the cattle, fattens them, and later takes them to places such as Combata to be able to sell them. By means of this business the associate helps her children get ahead.  The associate wants to expand the cattle sale business.  The associate requests the loan to buy food for the cows such as grass wholesale.  

The associate is happy for the loan and she promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle such as grass wholesale.

loans.name: Ma Eusebia

texts.es: Doña Mari como le gusta que le digan tiene 31 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de zapato por catalogo de varias marcas, hace 8 años empezó con este tipo de negocio, comenta que empezó a vender zapato porque le ayudaba a una de sus cuñadas y ella le daba una comisión por los zapatos que vendiera. Después la señora Mari decidió independizarse y hacer su propio negocio para poder tener buenas ganancias, comenta que al principio fue muy difícil ya que los zapatos los vendía en abonos y ella tenía que invertir mucho dinero. Ahorita comenta que más o menos tiene una buena cartera de clientas dice que aproximadamente tiene 300 clientas, y que gracias a Dios son muy pagadoras. Sus zapatos los vende con sus amistades y personas que tienen más que nada un trabajo fijo para que no le queden mal. A ella le agrada su trabajo, le gusta mucho porque tiene tiempo para cuidar a sus hijas y estar al pendiente de la educación de ellas. La señora Mari está casada con el señor Miguel Ángel quien trabaja en los Estados Unidos de obrero. Ellos tienen de casados 10 años, y procrearon dos hijas de nombres Karla de 10 años y Aylin de 8 años las dos estudian la primaria, y comenta que sus sueños seria que su esposo regresara y entre los dos poner una zapatería, otro de sus sueños seria que sus hijas tuvieran una carrera porque dice que es la mejor herencia que un padre puede dejar a sus hijos, comenta que con las ganancias que saque de la venta de los zapatos comprara los útiles escolares y los uniformes para el nuevo ciclo escolar.
texts.en:
Mari, like she likes to be called, is 31 years old.  She sells various brands of shoes by catalogue.  She started this type of business 8 years ago.  She comments that she started selling shoes because she helped one of her sisters-in-law and she’d give her a commission on the shoes she’d sell.  Later on, Mari decided to branch out independently and start her own business in order to have good profits.  She comments that it was very difficult in the beginning because she sells the shoes in installments and she had to invest a lot of money.  She comments that currently she has a more or less good customer base; she has approximately 300 customers that, thanks be to God, are good payers.

She sells her shoes to acquaintances and people who have steady employment so that they won’t default on her.  She likes her work a lot because she has time to care for her daughters and be watchful of their schooling.

Mari is married to Miguel Ángel who works in the United States as a laborer.  They’ve been married 10 years and have two daughters: Karla, 10 and Aylin, 8; both go to elementary school.  

She mentions that her dream would be to have her husband return and to set up a shoe store together.  Another one of her dreams is that her daughters have careers because she says that’s the best inheritance parents can leave their children.

She comments that she’ll use profits from the shoe sales to buy school supplies and uniforms for the new school term.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
For the last one year, Margaret has been keeping poultry and also offers outside catering services. She is 38 years old and married to David. They are blessed with three children.

She has never borrowed from any other MFI (microfinance institution). She is applying for her first loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy poultry feeds. The anticipated profit, she will use to improve her family's living standards.

In the future, she hopes to venture into greenhouse farming so as to ensure there is food security in the country.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las Estrellitas y se Ubica en la localidad de Tecpatan estado de Chiapas, la señora quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Matilde es madre soltera  y su responsabilidad tiene dos hijos: Erlin de veinte años, Yessenia Guadalupe de  quince años.

     Ella se dedica a la compra de hilos para  la elaboración de hamacas, para luego venderlo en la misma localidad y así también vender trastes de tupper, en donde lleva quince años, lo que comenta que le  va bien ya que con ello  ha logrado apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.

    Aprendió  esta actividad con su mama ya que ella también se dedicaba a lo mismo  y desde muy  joven aprendió  y  cuando se caso dejo de practicarlo, pero para apoyar a su esposo  comenzó de nuevo  así  los  dos sacar adelante a sus hijos que estaban creciendo  quien desafortunada mente la abandono hace unos años, pero aun así ella sigue trabajando.


     Su más grande deseo es que con esta actividad y  el préstamo pueda seguir trabajando para que con ello logre tener ahorros para apoyar  seguir apoyando a sus hijos que están estudiando.

     Los demás integrantes del grupo son: Irma quien se dedica a la compra  de maíz para la elaboración de tascalate, pinol, y también la venta de  refresco, la señora blanca luz: quien invierte el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, Jorge Antonio  se dedica  a la copra y venta de pollos de rancho para criarlo y luego venderlo, así también la señora Bertha que invierte el préstamo en la compra de pollos de granja  para luego venderlo  aliñado.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Estrellitas” (The Little Stars) and is located in Tecpatan, Chiapas.  The woman who gave the interview is Matilde.  She’s a single mother with two children in her care: Erlin, 20, and Yessenia Guadalupe, 15.

She buys cordage to make hammocks that she resells in her same location.  She also sells Tupperware.  She’s been in business 15 years and she comments that she does well because it’s allowed her to provide her children with schooling.

She learned this occupation with her mother since she was in the same line of work and she learned while still very young.  When she got married she stopped doing it but, in order to help out her husband, she started up again so that together they could raise their children who were growing.  Unfortunately, he left her a few years ago but even so she continues to work.

Her greatest wish is that with this activity and the loan she will be able to continue to work so that she can manage to have some savings to continue supporting her children who are still studying.

The other group members are:  Irma, who buys and sells corn to make tascalate and pinol (traditional corn-based beverages from Chiapas) and also sells soft drinks, Blanca Luz, who will use the loan to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store, Jorge Antonio who buys and sells free range chickens to raise and later sell and Bertha who will use the loan to buy free range chickens to later sell butchered.

loans.use: to pay for cordage to make hammocks.

loans.name: Paz Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Paz del Carmen es originaria del municipio de El Sauce donde tiene muchos años de vivir, es una señora luchadora que ha sacado adelante a sus tres hijos con esfuerzo propio ya que es viuda, actualmente cuenta con su propio negocio el cual consiste en una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación donde ofrece abarrotería en general, ropa y sandalias, también los fines de semana elabora comida como nacatamales y sopas.
Desde que inició su negocio se ha caracterizado por dar una buena atención a sus clientes y brindar un buen servicio, tiene muchos años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado 13 créditos consecutivos y gracias a ello ha podido mantener surtido su negocio, construir su propia vivienda. Una de las necesidades que tiene esta señora es contar con más capital para adquirir más mercadería y diversificar los productos con el objetivo de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por tal razón decidió solicitar su treceavo crédito en Ceprodel para llevar a cabo su objetivo.
texts.en:
Paz del Carmen is from the El Sauce municipality, and she has lived there for many years.  She is a tenacious woman who has gotten her three children ahead through her own efforts.  She is a widow, and she currently has her own business.  The business is a store, which is located in her home.  She sells general groceries, clothes, and sandals.  Also, on the week-ends she sells food like “nacatamales” (a traditional Central American dish similar to tamale) and soups.

Ever since she started her business she has been known for taking good care of her customers and giving them good service.

She has worked with Ceprodel for many years.  They have given her 13 consecutive loans.  Thanks to the loans has been able to keep her business stocked and to build her own house.

One of the things that this woman needs is more capital to get more merchandise and to diversify her products.  Her objective is to satisfy her customers’ demand.  That is why she decided to request her 13th loan with Ceprodel in order to meet her objective.

loans.use: to buy sandals, sugar, rice, oil, pants and blouses.

loans.name: Unity Is The Power Group

texts.en:
Theodorah is 52 years, married, and does not have any children. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand.

She has been in business for 40 years selling live chickens and running a "spazza" shop (spazza shops are small convenient corner stores). She requested this loan throgh WDB and Kiva to buy live chickens and spazza shop stock. She says that extra income from this loan will help her put food on the table for her family and also buy good clothes. She faces a challenge of customers who buy food on credit and fail to pay on time. 

Theodorah would like in future  to see her business grow and buy a new car. She thanks WDB a lot for lending her this loan amount.

loans.use: To buy live chickens and "spazza" shop stock.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana tiene 37 años, convive con Manuel, de 39 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jomira, de 14 y Máyela, de 9 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Desde joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra; pues la actividad comercial de la zona es la agricultura. Desde entonces todas las mañanas, muy temprano se dedica al cuidado de sus cultivos. Los que cuida desde que tenia 18 años; ahí siembra papa, arveja y maíz; los que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado central de Tarma, pero según afirma en épocas de campaña agrícola, los mismos comerciantes visitan la localidad de Huasahuasi, para negociar su producción. Lo que más le gusta a Yovana, es fertilizar sus cultivos, para que le proporcionen buenos frutos, ya que en tiempos de lluvia necesitan mayores cuidados. Como tratar la tierra y brindar a los alimentos mayores nutrientes. Ahora ella desea invertir en la compra de más terrenos agrícolas, ya dio el primer paso, comprando un pequeño terreno paralelo a de su casa. Y a pesar de que hace poco salió del hospital, ya que se operó de una hernia, desea con muchas ansias seguir con sus objetivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de Cunutay” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para lograr sus objetivos. Además se compromete en no defraudar su confianza, pagando de manera puntual sus cuotas. Yovana de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de arveja y papa; para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Yovana is 37 years old and lives with 39 year-old Manuel.  The couple have two children: 14 year-old Jomira and 9 year-old Máyela.  They live together as a family in their own home which is located in the small village of Cumutay.

Yovana learned to work the land when she was young as the main business activity in her area is agriculture.  Very early every morning she goes out and cares for her crops.  She has been caring for her crops since she was 18 years old.  She grows potatoes, peas and corn.  After each harvest, she sells her produce in the central market in Tarma.  However, she says that during the farming seasons, sellers visit the town of Huasahuasi to sell their produce.

What Yovana most enjoys is fertilizing her crops so that they provide good fruit.  They need more care during rainy periods such as treating the land and providing more nutrients.  Yovana would like to invest in buying more farmland.  She already took her first step, buying a small plot of land parallel to her home.  In spite of the fact that she only recently got out of hospital where she had a hernia operation, she is very keen to continue achieving her goals.

Yovana belongs to the "Pioneros de Cumutay" (Cumutay Pioneeers) community bank and this is her first loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive a small loan to help her achieve her goals.  She pledges not to betray the trust that has been placed in her and will make her repayments on time.  With your support, Yovana will invest the money she has requested to buy pea and potato seeds for her next sowing season.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and potatoes

loans.name: Edilon

texts.en:
Edilon, 39 years old, is a mother of six children and is married to a farmer.  P20,000 is the average net income she gets from her farming every harvest season. Income generated from the business goes to school fees and sundry needs at home.

Edilon grows rice and has been doing it for 25 years now. She is asking for a loan to purchase hybrid seeds of rice, fertilizers, and insecticides to improve the production of her farm. 

In the future, Edilon hopes to educate all her children to assure them a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds of rice, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 36-year-old married man with two children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in him, and his desire is to see his children graduate from college. He has a number of businesses such as rental houses, transport and farming. His major challenge is tenants who take a long time to pay their rent, and his dream is to build apartments in town.

Patrick intends to use the loan to renovate his commercial house. His dream is to own commercial houses for business purposes.

loans.use: to renovate his commercial house.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
43-year-old James has spent 15 years in commercial farming in the district of Ibanda. The father of six grows beans, maize, bananas, and many other crops depending on the season.

James is not only hard working but also a very determined farmer who always aims higher. He sells charcoal as an additional source of income. Monthly he says his sales income totals to 400,000 Uganda shillings (UGX).

James has a plan of expanding his coffee and banana plantation in order to educate his children up to the University level. With this Kiva loan, he intends to purchase farming implements such as mulch, manure, and good seeds for his plantation.

loans.use: To buy farming implements such as manure, mulch, good seeds, and farm tools.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un regroupement quatre femmes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des familles nucléaires. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Massablacoura à BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de l’activité et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leur activité, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce de condiments, de céréales  et avec ROKIA  faire de la restauration, elle est la présidente du groupe et la deuxième à droite avec son foulard jaune. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de groupe et les tous prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt ROKIA, compte acheter 100kg de riz et des condiments alimentaires pour des fins de restauration. Elle s’approvisionne à BOUGOUNI et vend ses mets alimentaires  au placer de Kola et à Massabla Coura, à domicile en détail, au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans  les dépenses.
texts.en:
BENKADI is a group of four married women, who are on average 36 years old with four kids, and live in nuclear families. These women live in the Massablacoura neighborhood of Bougouni (in Mali's third administrative region). They got to know each other through business and neighborhood relations.
In order to satisfy their customers and to increase their activity level, they have decided to join micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso, with the objective to trade in condiments and cereals, and in Rokia's case, to offer prepared foods. She is the group's president and the second woman from the right, with a yellow scarf.
They are on their eighth group loan; all previous loans have been repaid without difficulty.
With this new loan, Rokia plans on purchasing 100 kilos of rice and some condiments for caterers. She gets her supplies in Bougouni and sells her food on the marketplace in Kola and in Massabla Coura; she also retails from home and accepts cash. Her clientele is composed of men and women.
With this loan, she is counting on a monthly benefit of 40,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to repay the loan, with the remainder to be reinvested in her expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Nukra

texts.ru: Нукра жительница района А. Джоми. Ей 66 лет. Она вдова. У нее трое детей. Ее сын занимается животноводством. Сама Нукра занимается разведением скота у себя дома. Она в основном откармливает и продает крупнорогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Nukra, a 66-year-old widow, lives with her three children in Tajikistan's Jomi region. Her son breeds cattle. Nukra breeds cattle in her household for sales. She has been in this business for ten years and is applying for a loan in order to buy a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 34 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive desde hace 10 años junto a Lidia, su esposa. Ambos tiene dos hijos: Lori y Nordi a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Punray. A pesar de su corta edad, logró muchas cosas. Pues su principal virtud es trabajar sin descanso. Hace 7 años que incursionó en la agricultura; sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arveja y habas. Los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación, pues logró obtener 5 hectáreas de terrenos productivos y aunque le falta capital para producir la extensión completa, no se desanima. Porque recibe la ayuda de su esposa, quien tiene una tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su zona, ahí obtiene un dinero extra. Además de la camioneta que pudo comprar; con ello traslada su cosecha a la ciudad para comercializarla y también hace servicio de carga a terceras personas.  Él pertenece al banco comunal “Punray avanzado” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde agradece por el apoyo recibido durante todo este tiempo. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Jorge de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en su próxima siembra de papa “única”.
texts.en: Jorge is 34 years old and he is a hardworking man. He has lived with Lidia, his wife, for the past 10 years. They have two children together: Lori and Nordi. They raise them in a house of their own, located in the community of Punray. Despite his young age he has achieved many things. His greatest virtue is working tirelessly. Seven years ago he started out in agriculture. His main plantations consist of potatoes, peas, and beans. He takes care of them with much dedication. He has managed to obtain 5 hectares of farmland and although he does not have enough capital to produce the entire area, he does not lose heart. He has his wife's support. She has a grocery store from where she sells basic consumer goods to the population in her region. They have an extra income from there. Additionally, he was able to purchase a pick-up truck. With it he is able to transport his harvest to the city to sell and he also provides transportation services to third parties. He is a member of the communal bank "Punray Avanzado" and it is his ninth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He is thankful for the support he received. He will invest the funds he requested in the purchase of natural fertilizers to disperse on his next "unica" potato cultivation, a Peruvian variety of potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Matalaoa

texts.en:
Matalaoa is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Matalaoa needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or $104 per week) to improve the business.

In 2011, Matalaoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Bayarsaikhan is 45 years old.  He is a taxi driver around Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He has been running his business since 2002. Bayarsaikhan lives with his 2 children and wife in a ger, a nomadic Mongolian traditional tent, which is located in the ger district of Ulaanbaatar.

Bayarsaikhan  wants to make adjustments to the walls of his ger, such as fixing the insulation, because his ger has been having heat-loss lately and has some breaks in it.  This is an essential problem for people who live in gers.  According his plan, Bayarsaikhan  will use less of the harmful fuel such as coal if he can make the repairs before this winter.   For this purpose, he needs some money support to buy the insulation materials ro make his ger warm.

loans.use: buy insulation

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica departamento de León, El señor Roger, trabaja como maestro de secundaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 4 años. Roger es felizmente casado y con un hijo que es el motivo por el que se esfuerza a diario en su labor educativa.

Ceprodel se ha preocupado por mejorar el nivel de vida de los maestros y por ello, el señor Roger ha llegado a Ceprodel para dar solicitud a un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra para realizar las mejora en la vivienda que tanto lo requiere.

Permanece confiando que dicho crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente para beneficio propio y de su hogar.
texts.en:
Roger is a teacher at a high school in Telica, a town in the Nicaraguan "departamento" of Leon.  He has been a teacher at the school for 4 years.  He and his wife have one child.  

Ceprodel makes a point of helping teachers improve their lives.  Roger is applying for a loan from the bank to pay for construction materials--cement, bricks, iron bar--and labor to make some necessary improvements to his house.  

He trusts that the loan will be extended so that he can make the improvements and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to his house.

loans.name: Rovic

texts.en:
Rovic is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Rovic has a shop that sells and rents DVDs and CDs to customers. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of DVDs to rent out.
Rovic has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of DVDs to rent out.

loans.name: Momar

texts.fr: Monsieur Momar est âgé de 35 ans. Il vit dans une des localités du Sénégal. Il est célibataire et s’adonne au maraichage et  au commerce de légumes et  de poulets de chair. Il a une expérience de 10 ans dans son activité de commerce qu’il  a choisi par opportunité.  Ce qui l’intéresse  surtout ce sont la rentabilité et les  flux financiers générés par son activité.Il est sociétaire de l'un des guichets de l'U-IMCEC depuis mai 2007. Il a déjà remboursé 4 crédits antérieurs.Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l'achat de moutons qu'il compte revendre afin de diversifier d'avantage son acticité de commerce. Son objectif est d’augmenter  ses bénéfices ce qui lui permet de régler ses problèmes sociaux sans demander le soutien de personne.
texts.en: Mr. Momar is 35 years old. He lives in a city of Sénégal. He is single, devotes himself to small-scale farming and a business of selling vegetables and chickens. He has 10 years experience in this business after realizing it was a good opportunity. He is most concerned with profitability and cash flows generated by the business. He has been a member of U-IMCEC since May 2007. He has properly reimbursed four previous loans. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 cfa francs to purchase sheep for resale in order to diversify his business. His goal is to increase his profits so that he can take care of his responsibilities without asking others for help.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for resale.

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer.

Ponciana has been in the business of raising pigs for seven years. She earns 6,000 PHP each month. 

Ponciana also helps grow rice crops when she can.

Ponciana plans to use her loan to purchase pig feed, vitamins and fertilizers. Ponciana works hard to support her family and help improve their living conditions.

This loan will help Ponciana and her husband with their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, vitamins and fertilizers.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is 45 years old, lives in Airport community. She is married, and has nine children between ages 19 and 30. Two are currently in school and live at home, while the older ones are working and living on their own. For the past twenty years she has been selling rice, oil, and pepper in the market. She enjoys the profit making in the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, and pepper for her business. Her plans are to build a house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and pepper for her business

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She is a woman with a good reputation. She works hard to help her husband in their living.
 
In 2002, Hanaa started a cosmetics & perfumes trading business in her house. It has improved since she started with the help of a loan she got from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. Her previous loan had a positive impact, and that's why she is applying for another one. 

She will invest in her business by buying new autumn-winter cosmetics & perfumes collections. She believes that the new collections will be sold quickly because of the Holy Christmas & New Year's season.

Hanaa is a hard worker. She hopes to open a big shop in the future, and to add clothes to her trade.

loans.use: To buy new autumn-winter cosmetics & perfumes.

loans.name: Elmer Jaime

texts.es: Elmer Jaime es una persona que desde muy joven se ha visto en la necesidad de trabajar. Su padre abandonó a su madre, hermanas y hermano cuando el tenía 13 años, y debido a que su madre no estaba en condiciones de trabajar, el se vio en la obligación con su hermano de hacerse cargo de las obligaciones de su familia. Desde entonces, Elmer Jaime trabaja en fincas cercanas de su vivienda y poco a poco fue trabajando en su finca en una cosecha de café, yuca y plátano. Gracias a su buena experiencia en la actividad de la cosecha, adquirida mientras trabajaba en fincas, Elmer Jaime logró que su cosecha diera unos productos de excelente calidad, por lo que hoy se dedica por completo a la actividad de la agricultura con su cosecha de café principalmente y la complementa con una cosecha de yuca y una de plátano. Elmer Jaime, actualmente con 50 años de edad, casado y con 2 hijas de 7 y 13 años, obtiene los ingresos con los que sostiene a su familia gracias a su trabajo en la agricultura, y sueña con que sus cosechas sigan creciendo para que en un futuro sus hijos puedan tener una estabilidad económica. Elmer Jaime busca que su cosecha de café, que es la que mayores ingresos le genera, pueda dar productos de excelente calidad para poder venderlos a un buen precio, sin embargo, la temporada invernal ha hecho que sus cosechas se deterioren un poco y se vea en la necesidad de comprar abono para las mismas. Sin embargo, Elmer Jaime no tiene el capital suficiente en la actualidad para comprar los sacos de abono que requiere, por lo que espera que un préstamo le permita acceder a comprar los sacos de abono que requiere, y poder así obtener grandes ingresos para cumplir el gran sueño de que sus hijos puedan acceder a la mejor educación posible, y tengan un bienestar mucho mejor que con el que cuentan actualmente.
texts.en:
Elmer Jaime is a person who has needed to work from a very young age.  His father abandoned his mother, sisters, and brother when he was 13, and since his mother was in no condition to work, he and his brother felt obliged to take charge of the family obligations.  Since then, Elmer Jaime has worked on farms near his home, and little by little he worked on growing coffee, yucca, and bananas on his own farm.

Thanks to his good experience he acquired working on the crops, Elmer Jaime managed for his harvest to produce some products of excellent quality, which is why today he devotes himself completely to farming, principally with his coffee crop, complemented by yucca and banana crops.

Elmer Jaime is currently 50 years old and married, with two daughters, ages 7 and 13.  He earns the income with which he supports his family thanks to his work in agriculture.  He dreams that his crops will continue growing so in the future his children can have financial stability.  Elmer Jaime is looking for his coffee crop, which is the one that generates the most income for him, to give excellent quality products to be able to sell them at a good price.  However, the winter season has caused his crops to deteriorate a bit, and made it necessary for him to buy fertilizer for them.

Nevertheless, Elmer Jaime currently does not have the necessary capital to buy the bags of fertilizer he needs.  He hopes that a loan will enable him to buy them so he will be able to have lots of income to realize his big dream, for his children to get the best education possible and have greater well-being than they currently have.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Agape Cb Group

texts.en: Violette is a group leader; aged 30.She is married with 1 child who has 8 years. The group is called AGAPE means “True love ” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. Violette owns a shop and has been running in a business for 1 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more Pens, sugar, plates and spoons for sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: To buy more Pens, sugar, plates and spoons for sell.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.en: I am the owner of a carpentry shop that builds beds, doors, wardrobes, dinning tables, chairs amongst others. I have lots of clients and most of my work is done by order.  I get paid 50% when we sign the contract and 50% when I hand them the final product, which makes it harder for me to sell furniture to other clients. This area has lots of demand for the elaboration of furniture and wood therefore I decided to work with PRISMA.

loans.use: Buying wood, nails, glue, varnish amongst others

loans.name: Victor Edgar

texts.en:
Victor is a public accountant, married and originally from Cuauhtemoc City, Chihuahua. He has lived for many years in Monterrey. He has 2 years of experience in his internet café business, which he began after losing his job with Mattel with the hope of becoming self-employed and owning his own business. The business has been growing steadily. In the beginning he only had three computers, and he currently has six.

He is now seeking a loan of $1,200 to purchase one additional computer and a higher-quality printer for his clients. This will allow an increase in the number of clients as well as in the quality of service he offers. Victor needs your generosity. Don’t hesitate any longer — he needs and sincerely appreciates your support.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Víctor es contador público, casado, originario de Ciudad Cuauhtemoc Chihuahua, tiene muchos años viviendo en Monterrey, tiene dos años de experiencia con su negocio, un caber café, iniciando después de quedar desempleado cuando trabajaba para MATTEL y con la finalidad de tener su propio empleo y su negocio inició este que ha ido creciendo poco a poco. En un comienzo sólo tenía tres computadoras y actualmente ya tiene seis.

Ahora solicita un crédito de $ 1200 DLLS para la compra de una máquina más y una impresora con mejor calidad para sus clientes, lo que traerá como beneficio un incremento en el número de clientes y también en la calidad del servicio que les esta brindando. Victor requiere de tu generosidad, no lo dudes más, el necesita de tu apoyo y te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase equipment

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: A 53 year woman, Dorcas A., a LAPO client of distinction. She cherishes talking about LAPO loan and the poor in Nigeria. She is married with three (3) children and she hopes to use this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more snacks and drinks

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Vasif was born in 1965 in Salyan region, Gardili village. He is marriedand has 3 children.
He has 15 years of experience in cattle breeding. He plans to buy a cow and to get more milk for selling and for providing  cheese and milk for his family. 
Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy a cow and grass.

loans.use: to buy a cow and grass

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Glady A. is 42 years old, and is happily married with 3 children. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for 2 years as a member of a union that sells wooden planks. She has been in this business for 2 years & she sells planks in her community. Gladys needs a loan to buy more wood for sale.

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used shoes for sale

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu C. is 40 years old and married with 2 children. With her previous loans, she managed to increase her grocery stock.   With assistance from her husband, she rented a small shop in Makeni town of Sierra Leone. Her vision is be a progressive business woman and be able to meet her family’s expenses. She plans to expand her business and become one of the suppliers of the town. She is therefore requesting $275 for the purpose.

loans.use: To increase her stock to become one of the main grocery suppliers for the town.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mr. Y. Aun, 28, and his wife, have been married since 2004. They have one little daughter. Aun and his wife are living with his parents on an island of Mekong River about twenty five kilometers from Phnom Penh. Aun has been a silk weaver since 2000. It’s a skill he learned from his wife who is also a silk weaver. He is also engaged in fishing.

Aun is requesting his fourth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $150. He will use this loan to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 29 years old. He has 3 children. Two of them are studying in school. One of his children has diabetes. He has an old taxi, and he applied to borrow $1000 to purchase new tires and some spare parts. He also wants to fix up the inside and paint it in order to increase his income and save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new tires and some spare parts

loans.name: Yuly

texts.en: Yuly, a twenty-eight year old woman, is an experienced and successful businesswoman of the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal. Yuly started a business selling pants and shoes to people of the community eight years ago, but she’s been immersed in business since her childhood. Yuly says that her activity helps her to provide food for her children and support her education. She also expressed her desire to buy a house where her family can live comfortably. “I’ll work hard to achieve my goal, and I’ll try to not spend my money on alcoholic drinks, as so many people waste their money”, she adds. Yuly will use her loan to buy more merchandise so as to increase her income.

loans.use: Yuly would like to purchase shoes and pants to restock her small business.

loans.name: Johanny Felicia's Group

texts.en:
Johanny Felicia is twenty-nine years old and the coordinator of a group of five active women that carry on businesses in the Casabe community of Santo Domingo.  Johanny and her husband (a blacksmith) have four children, ranging from four to thirteen years old, all of whom attend school.  She has a butcher shop which she started about thirteen months ago.  The entrepreneur says that her shop is well established in the community and she’s not afraid of the competition.  Johanny doesn’t raise livestock, so she has to constantly purchase animals in order to keep operating her business.  She hopes her business will allow her and her husband to improve their family’s lifestyle.
The other members of the group are:
Violeta J. La Fler, who spend her loan to buy various products to prepare natural juices and other goods.
Ana Josefa C. will buy livestock for her butcher shop. 
María Nelly M. K. and Cristina Caleises S. will buy metals and aluminum sheets to resell.

loans.use: To purchase animals for a butcher's shop.  Also to buy various products for the other members of the group.

loans.name: Cruz Adilia

texts.es:
Cruz Adilia is a woman of 36 years of age that lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the city of Managua.  She is married and has 4 children, all of them school aged.   Her husband is a merchant that specializes in the sale of clothing. 

Cruz Adilia has a small grocery store in her house which she started with the help of her husband.  She has had this business for 6 years and with time it has grown despite the daily problems that she confronts, like the lack of electricity  and the delinquency in her neighborhood. 

She requests the loan in order to invest in supplying her business and generate greater earnings because she wants her store to someday become a wholesaler.   Her other wish is to be able to give her 4 children an education so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

Cruz Adilia es una mujer de 36 años de edad, que habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, de la ciudad de Managua, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, todos ellos aún en edad escolar. Su esposo es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa. 

Cruz Adilia tiene una pulpería en su casa da habitación, la cual inició con la ayuda económica de su esposo, tiene 6 años de tener este negocio, con el tiempo ha venido creciendo a pesar de los problemas que a diario se enfrenta como es la falta de energía, y la delincuencia en su barrio. 

Solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio para así surtirlo y generar más ganancias porque quiere que su pulpería algún día llegue a convertirse en una distribuidora. Su otro anhelo es poder darles educación a sus 4 hijos para que lleguen a convertirse en unos buenos profesionales.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to invest in her business

loans.name: Alyunus

texts.en:
Alyunus F. is a 48-year-old man who has been selling milk and yogurt to the local people in a small village of the Sabirabad region since 1988. He is married and he has three children. In addition to his dairy business, he works as a driver to supplement his family's income, though he is quick to point out that dairy sales represent his primary source of income.

Living in his village has been getting harder and harder in recent months, especially since food prices have increased five-fold. Consequently, Alyunus is seeking to improve his financial status by purchasing one dairy cow for $800.

loans.use: To improve his family's standard of living by purchasing a dairy cow

loans.name: Meav

texts.en: Meav R., 58, is married and works together with her husband and two of her children in the Kampong Cham province. They have a small mill at their home that generates about $1.50 each day for the family. They work very hard at the mill and need to purchase a small machine to shape the mill. Meav R. is asking for $400 to purchase that machine, which will aid in the work of the mill and increase production. They see this as a profitable venture that will not only increase their income, but also raise their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a small machine for the mill

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.ru:
Shoyeva Dilafruz lives in Yavan. She is 26 years old. She is married and has two children. She works in sales. She sells vegetables and fruit. She wants to take out a loan to increase turnover and the assortment of goods in her inventory. It will help her to increase sales volume and to increase her profit. She plans to pay off the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Шоева Дилафруз жительница города Яван. Возраст 26 лет. Замужем и имеет двоих детей.Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Продает овощи и фрукты. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарообороти ассортимент товара. Это поможет увеличить объем продаж и увеличить прибыльность дела. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is an entrepreneur from Primorsk, where she runs a small business selling linen sheets, terrycloth towels and robes. Ludmila regularly re-stocks her inventory and offers customer-friendly service which makes her vending facility an attractive spot for many potential customers. Currently, Ludmila has about $7000 in turnover capital.

Ludmila is very thorough with all her suppliers and merchandise. She is in charge of all quality checks to make sure all inventory is flawless and durable, too. Ludmila is seeking a loan for 2500 Grivnas to increase her inventory and eventually open one more vending facility in her home town.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Las Tres Estrellas Group

texts.en:
The Las Tres Estrellas ("The Three Stars") group is maD. up of thirteen women who live in the Villa Ingenio neighborhood of El Alto, Bolivia. The group is currently in its second loan cycle. The group members are involved in a variety of businesses: selling prepared meals, bags, toast, meat, and laundry detergent, doing upholstery, running an Internet café and neighborhood stores, and working for a local mining company. The group has a wiD. range of experience: some, like Constancia, Sabina, and Gladys have just one year of experience, while others, like Bertha, Cecilia, and Janethe have more than fifteen. Segundina has been working in butcher shops for almost fifty years!

Juana is the group's president. She has two children, and works from home in her upholstery shop along with her husband, Teofilo. The treasurer, Rosalia, has two children and runs an Internet café with phone services. Janethe sells laundry detergent in the 16 D. Julio zone (the largest market in Bolivia). She has two children, and her husband, Octavio, works as a driver. The couple works hard to get ahead.

Most of the group members plan to use their Kiva loan to purchase more bulk merchandise to sell.

The group has a good dynamic. The women have worked together before with other microfinance institutions, so they all know one another very well. In their first cycle, the women repaid all of their installments without any problems, and were always responsible and punctual.

loans.use: Buy bulk merchandise to resell

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch S. is a villager in Pour Dos Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer but she now faces a problem in farming because she does not have cows to plow the field for growing rice. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Thon thorn, is a motorbike taxi driver who makes a small income to support his family. Mrs. Touch S. is 32 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is also presented in the right of the photo.

loans.use: Touch would like to buy two cows to plow the field to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Rhema Group

texts.en:
Georgine M. is a 52 year old widow with seven children who are between the ages of 16 and 32. She sells fabric and sewing accessories at the central market in Kinshasa. She has been active in her business since 1996.

Since her husband passed away in 2000, Georgine has been dedicated to her business. It is the only source of income she has to support her family. She joined a Hope DRC group called Rhema in January and has already received and successfully repaid two loans. The group consists of 29 members and thanks to Hope’s loans, the group members’ businesses have prospered. 

Georgine plans to use this loan to generate more profit by purchasing items of good quality that are needed by her clients. Other Rhema members would use this loan to meet their clients’ needs and improve their business facilities in order to generate more profit to support their families.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionicia tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, tuvo dos hijos que están estudiando el colegio. Desde muy niña se ha dedicado al comercio, siempre le agradó vender abarrotes y otros productos, cuando tuvo 18 años empezó a vender solo en las ferias sabatinas, así estuvo por muchos años, luego se casó, entonces con ayuda de su esposo hicieron su casa y pusieron su propio negocio en su domicilio, lo bueno es que a su esposo también le gusta el comercio. Decidieron que su esposo atendería la bodega y ella vendería en el mercado verduras y demás productos. Para esta pareja, la actividad que realizan le es muy rentable, el reto es la competencia. Es el segundo préstamo de Dionicia con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con todo el  dinero solicitado van incrementar la cantidad de verduras y mercadería para la bodega.
texts.en:
Dionicia is 47 years old and married with two children who are still in school. She has worked in sales since she was a girl and she always enjoyed selling groceries and other products. When she turned 18, she started to sell at the Saturday fairs and she continued that pattern for many years. After she married, with the help of her husband, they built a home and put a small grocery store in the house. What's great is that her husband also enjoys working in sales. They decided that her husband would tend the store in their home and she would sell vegetables and other products in the market. Business is very profitable for this couple, but the challenge is the competition. This is Dionicia's second loan from Prisma Microfinance and she will use the money to increase the amount of vegetables and merchandise in their store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of supplies and merchandise she sells

loans.name: Pochita

texts.es: Pochita tiene 32 años de edad, vive con sus cuatro hijos y su conviviente quienes la ayudan mucho.
