Ella se dedica  al vender comida ambulatoriamente por los diferentes lugares de su zona, esto lo viene haciendo desde hace ya 2 años atrás, ganándose la confianza de todos sus clientes, quienes degustan de su buena sazón. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar a sus comensales lo mejor para que se sientan satisfechos, también le gusta preparar gran variedad de platos. Su negocio le es rentable, ya que su comida se vende como pan caliente. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser una persona puntual y responsable. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a construir un kiosco para vender su comida con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Pochita is 32 years old and lives with her four children and her partner, who all help her quite a bit. For the past two years she has worked selling food by traveling to different locales in her area. She has built a satisfied clientele who enjoy her good cooking. She enjoys providing the best for her customers' satisfaction and preparing a great variety of dishes. Her business is profitable as her food sells like hotcakes. This is her seventh MFP loan and she has proven to be punctual and responsible. With the requested funds she will have a kiosk built to sell her food with greater ease.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk for her business

loans.name: Munisuishola

texts.en: Y. Munisuishola is 56 years old and married with four children. She lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. Y. sells frozen foods and plastics. She hopes to expand his business. She needs a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase additional frozen foods to increase output. She says thank you to everyone that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is engaged in the vending business.  She sells frozen food such as fish, meat and sausage wherein she earns PHP 600 a week. Due to increasing demand from her customers, she wantsto increase volume of products she sells.  This is the reason why she is asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 that she will invest in her business.  The amount will be of great help to Jessica in expanding her business.  

Patience and self confidence are some of the important things that she always keeps in mind in managing her business to succeed in life.

Jessica is married to Samuel, a welder in their village.  They have two children: Jimuel and Justin who are both in their elementary level.  The family lives in the village of Rizal, Santiago City, a rural area located four kilometers from the city proper.

loans.use: Invest in the vending business

loans.name: Ustawi Group

texts.en:
Astelia I., age 30, is married with three children ages 13, 9 and 9. She has tailoring business. She started this business ten years ago and works daily from 6am until 8pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $187.

This will be Astelia’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to improve her tailoring business and buy more materials to grow her business.

Astelia will share this loan with her loan group, Ustawi, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Astelia is in the front row in the middle in a green dress.

loans.use: Buy more materials

loans.name: Mohammad Abrahim

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is Mohammad Abrahim, the son of A. W.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 45 years old and is married with four children. He lives with his family of 8, including his father and mother, because he is the oldest member of his family and the responsibility of taking care of his old father and mother is on him.

He needs to build two more rooms in his house because the house is very small and by building two new rooms he can have enough space. He wants to receive an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 10 months. Consequently, he appreciates this process of loan-making in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Delfina es soltera, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Delfina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes y de las ferias compra cereales, queso, productos que vende de casa en casa.
Delfina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, queso.
Delfina sueña con educar a sus hijos, mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Alborada community bank. Delfina, 50, is single and has 3 children. Delfina travels to the different regional fairs where they sell groceries. She buys cereal and cheese, and she sells them door to door. Delfina needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy rice and cheese. Delfina’s dream is to educate her children and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and cheese

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha S. is forty-two years old. She is married and has five children, four sons and one daughter. Some of her children attend the senior high school while others go to junior high or primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works to help her husband provide financially for the family. Her husband is a teacher by profession. Martha trades in smoked fish. She buys smoked fish from markets in nearby communities and sells from a tabletop at the local market. She has been in business for ten years and is asking for a loan to buy fish in bulk. Martha hopes to provide her children with the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is already 30 years old and a resident of Calamagui 1st Ilagan, Isabela. He is married to Juliet F., 33 years old, who is currently working as a domestic helper abroad. They have a son; his name is Christian James, already 9 years old and attending primary school.

Christopher is engaged in the transportation business. He operates a passenger tricycle and he is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 6,000. He needs money to pay the monthly amortization of his motorbike. He is only earning an income of PHP 200 every day. He lets his wife work in another country because they really have a problem when it comes to financial matters. They also want to save for the future schooling of their son. Christopher and his wife have lots of dreams, that is why they are doing everything to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: Financial Assistance

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en: Pablita G. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 63 years old, widowed, and has six adult children. Pablita owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Pablita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Pablita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn C. is from the town of Bonifacio, Calamba Misamis Ocidental. She is 46 years old. Marilyn is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a business planting & harvesting corn for sale. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 3500 PHP to be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Alanni

texts.en:
Alanni C. is from the town of Canituan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 26 years old. Alanni is single. To make a living, Alanni owns & operates a business selling a variety of products "a la carte" (grilled meat, parts of chicken and beef) to the local community. Alanni has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alanni joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Alanni has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional business capital. Alanni is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alanni from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to save for future emergencies. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
In the photo, Señora Gloria appears in her kitchen, where she prepares a lunch menu daily for her customers. Gloria is 61 years old and is married with three adult children. She runs her home-based restaurant independently. Her husband is a carpentry teacher at a high school in Yarinacocha, the small suburb of Pucallpa where the family lives. In addition to running her restaurant, Gloria also keeps pigs, ducks and chickens at a family-owned farm nine kilometers from her home. This farm is named "Natalia".

Gloria has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about six years and is a member of the communal bank "Los Manguitos" (“The Little Mangoes”). Gloria used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to invest in ceramic decorations for sale. With this loan of 2,100 soles, Gloria plans to purchase staple foods for her restaurant business as well as medicines and feed for the animals she keeps on her farm.

Gloria's goal is to produce more at her family farm, which she has had for about seven years. Gloria is grateful for the financial assistance and business education she receives from Manuela Ramos (loan officers from the organization give an educational session at every monthly meeting of each communal bank).

loans.use: To buy staple foods for her restaurant/catering business and feed and medicines for her farm animals

loans.name: Sonia Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora SONIA DEL PILAR B. E. , tiene 28 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco CIELO II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, tiene 4 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
La señora Sonia se dedica a la fabricación de calzado en el taller instalado en su casa, los mismos que lleva a vender en el centro de Trujillo.
Es socia nueva, y desea un primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como : cuero, terocal, plantillas, etc para la fabricación de su calzado.
Sonia sueña con alquilar un stand en un centro comercial donde pueda vender el calzado que fabrica y así obtener mejores ingresos.

loans.use: compra de materiales: cuero, terocal, plantillas, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw material and merchandise and change the décor of the shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una mujer muy trabajadora D. 34 años, vive con su hija DomitiL. D. 8 años, en su casa propia. DesD. hace 5 años se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza, ofreciendo sus productos a sus vecinas, amigas y familiares a través D. los catálogos y revistas D. diferentes compañías D. cosméticos con las cuales trabaja. A María le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que además D. vender los productos también ofrece consejos D. maquillaje, enseñando L. combinación D. tonos en el rostro. Sin embargo, muchas veces algunas clientes no le pagan en su momento, teniendo que realizar varias visitas para cobrar, lo que le resulta muy incómodo. A pesar D. ello, se encuentra contenta con su trabajo porque le permite tener mucha libertad en cuanto a horarios y pueD. salir a las horas que elL. vea por conveniente y organizarse mejor con los quehaceres del hogar. En el futuro desea tener un bazar donD. ofrezca sus productos D. belleza, así como adornos y otros artículos. Este el sétimo préstamo D. María con MFP, elL. es muy puntual en todas sus cuotas, ya que su grupo acostumbran ser muy estricto con los pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita será para L. compra D. más cosméticos para tener mercadería en stock, en especial con L. llegada D. L. temporada D. primavera, cuando hay mayor demanda.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida H. manages a barbeque business in Danao, Panglao. Through this kind of business, she has been able to sustain her family and pay her debts. She’s 34 years old and the eldest of her 5 children is 12 years old.

She’s requesting a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to have additional capital for her business. She will be able to buy materials for her business.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Carmen Flores

texts.en:
Carmen is not married and is 59 years old. She has 6 children, the youngest of whom still lives with her. She sells soft drinks, fruit, soaps, shampoo, and beauty accessories.

A short time ago, some burglars tried to rob her business because the store’s door isn’t very strong and can’t protect well against thieves. She tends to her store from 6:30am until 10:30pm, so she is very afraid of being assaulted. With the new loan, she plans to make the doors of her business and house more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen es una señora soltera de 59 años, tienes 6 hijos, el menor de sus hijos aun vive con ella. Su actividad principal es la venta de Colas, frutas, jabones, shampoo y acceserios de belleza.

Hace poco tiempo los ladrones quisieron robarle en su negocio porque la puerta de la tienda no es muy fuerte y no la protege mucho de los ladrones. Ella atiende de 6:30 a.m. hasta las 22h30 y por su horario siente mucho temor de ser asaltada. Con el rendimiento del nuevo prestamo planea asegurar las puertas de su negocio y su casa.

loans.use: To protect her house and improve security at her business

loans.name: Sherill Jane

texts.en:
Sherill Jane A. is a bona fide resident of Barangay Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She was born on March 02, 1982 and finished secondary education. Due to financial difficulties she did not pursue her college education. She looked for a job and helped her parents to earn a living.

After two years, Sherill Jane married Darwin A. and they are blessed with two children. Being parents, they want their children to have a bright future by giving them the best education they can. Despite the economic crisis, they are doing all their best to earn a living for their survival and to finance the schooling of their children.

As a way of gaining income, Sherill’s husband works in construction while Sherill is engaged in selling frozen foods in their village. She borrowed additional capital from one of the microfinance organizations which she used to acquire the frozen foods at Solano public market. She sells them through house to house delivery.

Being an industrious mother, Sherill is able to earn a net income of Php 700 a week which she adds to her husband’s income to acquire their basic needs and to finance the schooling of their children.

Due to the high cost of commodities and school expenditures, they need to earn more to meet their daily needs. Thus, Sherill is again requesting a loan amounting to Php 8,000 to be used in acquiring more frozen foods for her to sell in their village. She believes that she can improve her small business through this financial assistance, given her patience and sacrifices.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Genevive

texts.en:
Genevive T. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old. Genevive is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Genevive owns and operates a business venture running a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and peddling pork meat in the local community. Genevive has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Genevive joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Genevive has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Genevive is requesting the same loan amount of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Genevive from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
At age 67, Rosario D. still wants to maximize her potential and strength in managing a business. She was born poor and even now, she is used to working hard to earn money to support her own needs and those of her husband. Both are living alone now and are helping each other to survive despite their poverty.

Since a year ago, Rosario has been raising ducks in their wide backyard for a business. Once the ducks grow up, she sells them in the market. Sometimes people also come to her house to buy eggs and ducks. Aside from the profit Rosario earns from raising the ducks, she also feels happy to raise them the way she raised her own children who are now having own families.

Despite her age, Rosario is still hoping that she can change the standard of living of her family through her business. Therefore, she is now requesting a much larger loan to be able to raise more ducks and sell them when they grow up.

loans.use: To purchase more duckling for backyard poultry-raising business.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is 36 years old, married, and the mother of three children. With hard work and determination, all her children are in school. She is very resourceful to her family in the provision of food and payment of bills. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey, with fried fish and pepper spice. She sells kenkey in the mornings and in the afternoon. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grain, cooked, and then eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers, since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper.

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education. She hopes to use part of her profits to improve her savings and business growth.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara 2” desde hace 5 años atrás (reingresante), del distrito de Chucuito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la artesanía.

Irma nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar bayeta y lana al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su negocio y seguir progresando. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Irma has been a member of Communal Bank "Santa Bárbara 2" for 5 years (re-joined), in the district of Chucuito, Province and State of Puno. She is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. She completed primary school and sells handicrafts. Irma tells us that with the first loan she requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement, for 300 soles, she increased her capital. She is requesting a loan for 500 soles which she will use to purchase baize and wool wholesale. Her dream for the future is to improve her business and continue progressing. What she likes best about her Communal Bank are the savings and the member meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baize and wool

loans.name: Gaby Martha

texts.es:
Gaby 51 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su menor hijo el cual tiene 5 años de 
edad. Ella se inicio en el negocio de venta de golosinas en el Balneario de Huacachina 
hace 13 años de manera informal, primero con un capital pequeño producto de ahorros 
obtenidos, en la actualidad es miembro de la Asociación de Vendedores del Balneario de 
Huacachina, habiendo incrementado el negocio con mucho esfuerzo. Ella atiende el 
negocio de manera muy calida y amable ya que la gran mayoría de sus clientes son 
turistas que acuden a nuestro Oasis de América, el sueño de Gaby es construir su 
vivienda y así poderle brindar bienestar y seguridad a su menor hijo, el cual ya se 
encuentra en edad escolar. Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de 
construcción.
texts.en:
Gaby is a 51 year old single mother. She lives with her youngest son who is five years old and enrolled in school. Gaby started selling candy thirteen years ago as a street vendor at the Balneario de Huacahina, using her savings as her first source of capital. She is currently a member of the Vendors Association of Balneario de Huacachina and has worked hard to grow her business.

Gaby attends to her business in a warm and friendly manner. The vast majority of her customers are tourists who come to visit the Oasis of America. Her dream is to build a house and provide for her son’s security and well-being. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov N. is 30 years old, married, and the mother of two school-aged children. She lives in Chhaom Povpisey village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Tol Mark, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow crops to earn a living. Although they work hard, they still earn insufficient income to support their family. Therefore, Mrs. Pov N. wants to begin a new business breeding pigs. In order to support it, Mrs. Pov N. is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR from Kiva partner, AMK, to purchase piglets for breeding. With the rest of the loan, she will purchase pigs for resale. This loan will allow her to improve living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and pigs for resale

loans.name: Alida

texts.en: Alida is applying for her second loan. She has improved her business and now she needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to expand the size of her shop.

loans.use: to expand the area

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
“I’m happy with my business because it helps provide my family’s needs especially my children’s education,” Francisca shares about her rice farm. She is 46 years old and is married with six children. Her children’s education is the top priority of her and her husband.

To fund her farm, Francisca used to borrow from individuals who charge high interest on their loans. It was hard for her because she barely had money left for her family. When she learned of CEVI, she immediately settled her obligations and joined the MFI (micro-finance institute). She is now requesting to loan Php14, 000 to fund her farm. She will buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs she needs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, 33 years old, is a mother of two children. Her eldest child is only five and currently excited to go to pre-school. She is a farmer and is tilling a small rice field. The income she makes from the farm really helped her family buy food, clothing and other basic needs.

She would like to apply for a loan of 5,000 PHP at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Ariunselenge

texts.en:
Ariunselenge is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. All of her three children attend a local secondary school. 

Ariunselenge operates a traditional Mongolian dress (Deel) manufacturing business in her town. She produces custom-made deels to sell to her many customers. Ariunselenge has been succesfully operating her business since 2008. She has been planning to expand her business in order to pay the university fees of her children and to improve her family's quality of life. Besides manufacturing deels, Ariunselenge also employs a salesperson who sells fabric and materials at the local Ihbuyan market. Ariunselenge is a very hardworking person and is focused on the future. She says, “My dream is that one day I will create my own tailoring center.” 

She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~ 360 USD) loan to purchase fabric and other materials necessary for her business.

loans.use: To purchase material.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 56 years old, married with three children who are 24, 26, and 35 years old.  Marie is widely known as a self-employed businesswoman selling a variety of goods in her shop mainly tomatoes, juice, soda, biscuits, etc.   She has been working hard at this business for about 5 years and the hours of her business are from 6 am to 6 pm every day.

After realizing that a large number of her customers were suggesting to her to sell foodstuffs, mainly rice, Irish potatoes, and beans, Marie decided to request a Kiva loan so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers through selling the above-mentioned goods.  With this additional business, Marie will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business as well as taking care of her family.

loans.use: The purchase of foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Leticia Monica

texts.es:
Leticia de 58 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su esposo es albañil, y ella vende pollos en un puesto afuera de su casa. Leticia empezó a vender pollos con el fin de ayudar a los gastos familiares, como no tenia un local y un puesto en un mercado, compro una mesa y pollos y se puso a vender afuera de su casa. 

Ahora ella vende desde las 07h00 hasta las 12h00 todos los días, cada pollo según su peso lo vende a $ 7.00. Uno de los problemas que tiene es no tener local y eso hace que el polvo de la calle ensucie los pollos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar pintura, bloques y cemento para su construir mejor su casa. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local y comprar una maquina peladora de pollos.
texts.en:
Leticia, 58, lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil near the Perimetral road (highway that encircles the city.) Her husband is a bricklayer and she sells chicken from a post outside her house. Leticia started selling chickens with the goal of helping her family, and as she did not have a place to sell or a stall in the market, she bought a table and chickens and started to sell outside her house. Now she sells from 7am until noon every day. She sells each chicken, according to its weight, for $7.00. One of the problems she has is that she lacks a place to sell, and so the dust from the streets makes her chickens dirty. With the loan she wants to buy paint, cement blocks and cement to make improvements to her house. In the future, she wants to have a store and wants to buy a machine to process the chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy paint, blocks and cement

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con el socio Wilfredo, tiene 41  años,  es conviviente,   vive en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco, él trabaja en su restaurante atendiendo a sus clientes que vienen a de gustar sus comidas tradicionales que prepara, él y su esposa acomodaron una habitación de su domicilio donde funciona el restaurante, el restaurante está ubicado en la calle Garcilaso de la ciudad de chichero. Ya son 8 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el ser socio de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito requiere ampliar el negocio y desea comprar sillas y mesas.
texts.en:
While visiting the Mateo Pumacahua Communal Bank, the staff of Asociación Arariwa had the opportunity to speak with Wilfredo. He is 41 years old, in a common law marriage, and lives in the city of Chinchero in the Department of Cusco. Wilfredo works in his restaurant and attends to his customers who come to enjoy the traditional food that he prepares. He and his wife set aside a room in their house to function as a restaurant. Their business is located on Garcilaso Street in the city of Chinchero. They have already been in operation for eight years and have done very well thanks to the effort they put into their work. Being a member of Asociación Arariwa has been a great help in improving and making the business grow.

With this new loan, Wilfredo wants to expand his business by purchasing chairs and tables.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chairs & tables

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is the wife of M. R. and lives in Riwind with her family. Her husband works as a gardener. She is the mother of five sons. Three of her children are attending school while the other two do their jobs to financially support the family.  

Bushra is a very talented lady who operates her embroidery business to supplement the income of her family. She receives orders from her neighborhood clients and fulfills them on time. She started this business by receiving a loan from Asasah last years.

 Now she has applied for a loan for the second time from Asasah to invest in her new dairy business. Since a young age she helped her father in his dairy business and take care of his buffalos. Her experience inspired her to start this work independently because she has an interest in it. She is hopeful that this will help her to increase more income for her family. She will buy a buffalo with the loan amount in order to change her current business into the dairy business.

Bushra is showing her current business in this photo.

loans.use: Purchase a buffalo to start a dairy business

loans.name: Itojo Twimukye Women's Group- Ntungamo

texts.en: 15 years is the time 45-year-old M. Bibian has spent overseeing her soft drinks depot business in Itojo, Ntungamo after dropping her former profession of teaching. Not that she held it in low value, but she just wanted new challenges. She is quick to describe herself as trustworthy, sociable and a go-getter. At her operating place in Itojo trading center, she has quite a following. Her customers are mostly small scale traders .She has used monthly profits of 300,000 shillings to improve her family's welfare. She also makes a side profit from her banana plantation and farm. She is married with four children and with this loan, she wants to purchase more crates of soft drinks in addition to the tea that she will later resell.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks like sodas for her business

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
E. Gulnora is a widow and mother of four children. She owns a little place at the central market in Dushanbe town where she sells various types of clothing. Some of the advantages of her business are variety, consistency, and affordable prices. Gulnora has been working in this business for five years. She is always seeking to grow and develop the business and improve her entrepreneurial skills. Currently, Gulnora is requesting a loan of 4000 TJS to purchase more goods for the summer season. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s financial situation.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for the summer season

loans.name: Primicia Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra trabajando hace dos años en grupo, han tenido muchas experiencias juntas.
Todas trabajan juntas y también realizan actividades independientes para obtener ingresos para sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Zunilda  quien se dedica a la venta de ropas.
Ella ofrece sus productos saliendo hasta las casa y negocios de sus clientes, quienes constantemente solicitan las ropas que ella le ofrece por catalogos.
Sus clientes se encuentran muy satisfechos con las mercaderías que ella vende y tiene alto número de clientes.
Para cubrir con los pedidos que ella tiene ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas como camisas, pantalones, buzos, suéter y otros.
texts.en:
This committee has been in existence for two years. All of the members have plenty of experience working together. They also have independent business activities that help generate income for their families.

One of the members is Sra. Zunilda who is a clothing merchant. She sells her products by visiting the homes and businesses of her customers who are always ordering the clothes that she offers through catalogs. Zunilda has many customers and they are satisfied with the merchandise that she sells. In order to fulfill the orders that she has already received, Zunilda will use her loan to buy clothing such as shirts, trousers, sweatshirts, sweaters, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shirts, trousers, sweatshirts, sweaters, and other items

loans.name: Nilton

texts.es: Nilton, de 30 años, vive en compañía de su madre en casa de ella, juntos trabajan para conseguir todas sus metas. Cada día es nuevo en la vida de este luchador joven que trabaja con mucho esmero las tierras que son de propiedad de su madre. Cuando era joven le ayudaba, pero desde hace un tiempo él solo las trabaja. Dice que para la labor de campo se requiere mucha dedicación, pues al amanecer debe trabajar, arando y regando la tierra, para que se mantenga en buenas condiciones, además  le gusta mucho su trabajo pues lo desempeña bien. Lo que no le gusta es que durante la época de cosecha debe contratar la ayuda de peones, para cargar los pesados sacos de sus productos naturales, pero dice que la recompensa es buena, ya que obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten vivir en comodidad con la compañía de su madre. Como es muy emprendedor para mas adelante tiene planeado comprar algunas cabezas de carnero ya que quiere aumentar la cantidad de animales y empezar con la comercialización y venta de carne de carnero. Es el onceavo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que desea continuar trabajando, además dice que le gusta el trabajo con su grupo comunal pues esta conformado por personas bastante responsables y solidarias. Tiene planeado invertir el crédito dinero solicitado en la compra de guano y abono que necesita para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos y así obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Nilton, 30, lives with his mother in her home. They work together to meet all of their goals. Every day is new in the life of this tenacious youth, who works his mother's lands with a lot of care. When he was young he helped her, but for some time he has done the work on his own. He says that working in the fields requires a lot of dedication, as each day he must get up very early to plow and irrigate the land to keep it in good condition. He loves his work, and he does it very well. What he doesn't like is having to hire workers during the harvest season to carry the heavy sacks of his produce, but he says that he pays them well, since the earnings that he obtains allow him to live comfortably with his mother. As he is very enterprising, he has plans for the future to buy some sheep, since he wants to increase his quantity of animals and start selling their meat. This is the 11th loan that he has taken with MF, and he pledges to make his payments on time since he wants to continue working with the organization. In addition, he says that he enjoys working with his communal bank, since it is made up of people who are very responsible and cooperative. He plans to use the money requested to invest in the purchase of fertilizers that he needs to improve the productivity of his cultivations; in this way he can obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve the productivity of his lands

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva Agreda of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, has had a farming business since 2000. She has eight adult children with the youngest aged 23 years-old.   At the age of 65 years-old, she is still a hard working woman and she realizes that she needs to work hard especially since she is already a widow and her children have families of their own. 

The money from the loan will be used to buy fertilizers, seedlings and other farm materials. Her additional income will go to her savings for future needs especially health maintenance and to financially help her grandchildren.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seedlings and other farm materials.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Шарипов Абдусалом проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 42 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Абдусалом имеет высшее не оконченное образование. Сейчас он занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 4 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Abdusalom S. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. His wife is a homemaker. Abdusalom has an incomplete higher education. Currently, he is involved in retail sales. He has a store, where he sells food products. Abdusalom has been involved in this business for 4 years. He is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora tiene 58 años ella se dedica a brindar los servicios de taller de costura. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ha sido de gran ayuda para mejorar su negocio e invertir en lo necesario. Por lo que este negocio lo aprendió por su Mama que anteriormente tenía un taller, con el paso del tiempo fue que decide entregárselo a Maria Auxiliadora y así fue que ella  se hace cargo. Ella tiene varios clientes que le solicitan diferentes estilos de prendas de vestir  pues siempre ofrece muy buena calidad.el motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como hilos, tijeras, agujas, tela entre otras cosas necesarias.
texts.en: María Auxiliadora is 58 years old, and she makes clothing. Because this isn’t her first loan, she knows what a big help this is in improving her business and in investing in the necessary items. This is a business that she learned from her mother, who used to have a workshop. As time went on, her mother decided to hand over the workshop to María Auxiliadora. She has various clients who request different styles of clothing, and she always offers very good quality. This loan will be used to buy raw materials, such as thread, scissors, needles, and fabric, among other items.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with two children who attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over eight years, she has been a telephone service operator and she operates a phone accessories shop selling to the market dwellers. Lydia faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of phone accessories in the market. She hopes to be self reliant in her business in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to get a loan to boost her business. With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase telephone credit cards and phone accessories.

loans.use: To purchase telephone credit cards and phone accessories.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna C. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Lorna owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for breeding. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Lorna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase breeding livestock. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Lorna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy B. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Nancy is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Nancy owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling Filipino delicacy viands like "afritada" and pork "adobo" in the local community. She is also engaging in butchering pigs once a month. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nancy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Nancy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Yesenia Vitalina

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Las Increíbles.

La señora Jessenia  tiene 27 años de edad, está casada hace 1 año y 10 meses y está en su cuarto mes de embarazo. Su marido trabaja de agente vendedor de artefactos en la ciudad de Bahía de Caraquez. Ellos son de Portoviejo pero por trabajo se vinieron a esta preciosa ciudad. 

Se dedica al comercio,  vende  productos de Oriflame (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería, bisutería y accesorios para damas) lo cual realiza todos los días en las tardes ofreciendo sus productos que se los hace por pedidos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días lo cual aprovecha para ofrecer otra vez sus productos.

Esta es la razón por lo que solicito este crédito ya que quiere compra más de sus productos como: cremas, perfumes, cosméticos, entre otros.  Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio, es socia fundadora y siempre le ha gustado por las charlas que le ayudan mucho en su vida diaria, es la tesorera del Banco.  Su meta es  tener una casa propia ya que en la que vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Increíbles (The Unbelievable Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Jessenia, 27, has been married for a year and 10 months and is four months pregnant.  Her husband is a Home Appliance Sales Agent in the city of Bahía De Caraquez.  They are originally from Portoviejo but came to this beautiful city for work.

She is a merchant.  She sells Oriflame products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, costume jewelry and women’s accessories) every day during the afternoon.  Her sales are conducted on order.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks taking advantage of this opportunity to sell still more.

This is the reason behind the loan request.  She wants to buy more of her products like: creams, perfumes and cosmetics among others.  She has been in the communal bank since the beginning, she is a founding member.  She has always liked it because of the talks that are very helpful in her everyday life.  She is the bank’s Treasurer.  Her goal is to own her own house because she is currently living in a rented one.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Mme Akoua est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée. Elle a en charge un enfant.  Elle exerce une activité génératrice de revenus, la vente de boullie et gâteau.   Elle fait cette  activité, il y a de cela 7 ans et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter 8 sacs de mais, 3 sacs de sucre et 2 sacs de farine de blé pour satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: She is 52 years old and married.  She takes care of one child.   She has a business of selling porridge and cakes.  She has been doing this work for seven years.  She gets her supplies at the main market in Lomé.  She is requesting a loan to buy eight sacks of corn, three sacks of sugar, and two sacks of wheat flour to meet the demands of more clients.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar and flour

loans.name: Peter Njunge

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 61 years old and is married to Eunice Wangari.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his first loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for planting.

In the future, Peter hopes to start a dairy farm.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for planting.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela B. is from the town of Panglao. She is 46 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. 

Adela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Adela is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nangah

texts.en:
Center;   CO 6              	

Nangah M. was born in 25/8/1971 and is blessed with five children. She shares four rooms with her four children in Nstualam, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

M. has faced difficulties in her life ranging from the inability to meet up with her daily needs and the increasing demands of her children. Among other challenges, she also has had difficulties of inadequate capital to expand her business. With this loan, she plans to buy food stuff like beans, rice, tomato, onion, garlic, maggi, corn, groundnuts, sugar and cassava flakes commonly known as garri. She thinks her business will succeed because her business site is close to the road and she is friendly with many clients. She has minimized risk by diversifying her business. Her activity will help her business in reducing cost of transportation.

She will use a fraction of her profit to assist my husband provide for the children’s school needs, meet up with my personal needs and feed my family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up and moral support given her by the GHAPE office and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy beans, corn and groundnuts

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Milena B. Martínez de 27 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos de 5 y 7 años, en el municipio de Soledad a 15 minutos  de la ciudad de Barranquilla; allí se dedica a la venta de carnes frías, de res,  vísceras , y por otro lado también  vende mercancía  como calzado y pantalones.
Para Milena  la necesidad de salir adelante con su familia y las dificultades que ella tuvo para ingresar a la vida laborar formal, impulsaron la iniciativa de  su negocio, con el que ha logrado un  trabajo  independiente y sostenible.   Ella ha recibido dos financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, desde hace dos años y su credikiva es su tercer crédito con el cual comprará una parte en carnes frías y carne de res y la otra parte en calzado, inversión que pronostica ser exitosa pues estaría cumpliendo con pedidos de sus clientes, porque conoce su mercado y ya ha hecho su preventa, la cual le indicó hacia donde dirigir su inversión.
Milena se siente muy contenta   porque con su negocio y los financiamientos, ha logrado tener una estabilidad en sus ingresos que repercuten positivamente en su bienestar familiar. Su sueño ahora es tener una casa propia y con ella un local bien dotado, para  ubicar un  punto de comercialización de sus productos y este es justamente su gran desafío,  porque para ello requiere un capital adicional y por eso esta trabajando y haciendo esfuerzos por impactar el mercado y aumentar su venta  que en la actualidad le genera un veinte por ciento de rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Milena B. Martínez, 27, lives with her spouse and two children who are 5 and 7 years of age in the city of Soledad 15 minutes from Barranquilla.  She sells cold cuts, beef and innards and also sells merchandise like shoes and pants.

For Milena the need to get ahead with her family and the difficulties she faced in trying to enter formal employment pushed her into starting a business that has made it possible for her to work at a job that’s independent and sustainable.

She has gotten two loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in the last two years and this Kiva loan is her third loan.  She will use part of it for cold cuts and beef and the other part for shoes.  She foresees the investment will be successful because she would be filling pending customer orders and she knows her market and has made presales which showed her the way to channel her investment.

Milena is very happy because with her business and the loans she has reached stability in her income that has positive repercussions on her family’s wellbeing.  Her dream now is to have a house of her own and with it a well stocked locale to find a spot to sell her products; this is her great challenge because for it she would need additional capital and this is why she’s working and making the effort to impact the market and increase sales which currently garner a 20% profit margin.

loans.use: Part for cold cuts and beef and part for shoes.

loans.name: Lucy Nyambura

texts.en:
Lucy has practised farming in Nduyu Njeru town for the last 16 years.  She is 60 years old, married to David M., and they have six children. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She repaid her previous loan of Kshs 15,000 well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Lucy hopes to become a leading milk producer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es: Maria Josefa L. A.:es de 43 años tiene 4 hijos,ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera nececidad, ella vende todos los dias para que pueda aumentar su ganacia y asi darle juntamente con su esposo estudio a sus hijos ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas productos comestibles y utiles escolares ya  que donde vive los niños ya empesaron a estudiar y le preguntan si vende cuadernos y aun no tiene para ello solicita el credito su sueño es tener otra tienda mas para poder trabajar y asi poder ayudar a su familia economicamente.
texts.en: Maria Josefa L. Amirales is 43 years old. She sells basic food items. She opens for business every day with the goal of increasing her earnings and, together with her husband, provides their children with an education. The kids have gone back to school and her clients request notebooks but she doesn't have them in stock, which is the reason for the loan. Her dream is to have another store and to be able to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, etc., for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Saf Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAF est créé le 27 août 2009. Il est composé de 07 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Leurs activité sont diverses: la vente de tissus, la vente de produits cosmétiques, la vente de parfums etc. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de MAMADOU LAMINE G. 

Madame FATOU F. N. debout à droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle est aussi responsable de sa jeune fille.

Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus

Avec son premier crédit avec CAURIE-MF elle va mieux développer son petit commerce de tissus afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices 

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge de la scolarité et la santé des enfants. Elle compte également renforcer ses épargnes dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en:
The solidarity group SAF was created on August 27, 2009. The group is composed of seven women who are all from the same neighborhood. Their businesses are diverse: selling cloth, selling cosmetics, selling perfume, etc. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of MAMADOU LAMINE G.. 

Ms. FATOU F. N. (standing at the right in the photo) is the group’s leader. She is 24 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She also has a young girl in her care. Her business involves commerce in cloth. With her first loan from CAURIE-MF, she is going to develop her business further, so as to grow her profits. 

Her goal is to support her family and her husband in covering the costs of schooling and health care for the children. She also plans on bolstering her savings account at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy cloth for resale

loans.name: Amelia Sebastiana

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

La señora Amelia es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos ya que no piden tantos requisitos. Tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.

Tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa, en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja de lunes a sabados desde las 06h00 hasta las  tres de la tarde. Trabaja sola.  Nos cuenta que tiene su restaurante 12 años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón de su comida. Además ella ya cuenta con clientes fijos a quienes les entrega de lunes a viernes almuerzos, son los trabajadores del sindicato de choferes de Portoviejo.
 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos.
 
Su sueño es tener casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
In the San Pablo parish of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the "Unión y Solidaridad" ["Union and Solidarity"] communal bank meet every fifteen days.

Amelia is a founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it because of the provisions for obtaining loans, since they do not require so many conditions. She is 48 years old and married, and from this relationship she has two children who are already grown and independent. Her husband is a merchant. 

She has a small restaurant in her home, where she prepares delicious dishes. She works from Monday through Saturday, from 6 a.m. until 3 p.m. She works alone. She reports that she has had her restaurant for 12 years, and it has always gone very well for her, since her customers prefer her food because of its seasoning. In addition, she has steady customers to whom she delivers lunches from Monday through Friday: the workers of the drivers' union of Portoviejo.
 
She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients for the preparation of her foods. 
 
Her dream is to have her own house, since the house where she lives is rented.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La señora Ana trabaja como secretaria en un estudio jurídico. El crédito lo requiere para comprar una computadora portátil esto para que sus hijos realicen sus trabajos de colegio con mayor rapidez. Vive en alquiler en la casa de sus abuelos  la misma esta ubicada en la zona de Los Pinos de la ciudad de La Paz;  es casada  y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito con IMPRO.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana works as a secretary at a law firm. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase a laptop computer so that her children can complete their schoolwork more quickly. Ana lives with her grandparents in a rented house located in the District of Los Pinos in the city of La Paz. She is married and has two children.

This is the first time she has obtained a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop computer so that her children can complete their schoolwork.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.en: Rosa Argentina is a married mother of one child who owns a small business offering perfumes, cosmetics, and clothes among other items.  She started this business with her own capital six years ago when she saw an opportunity in the market for such goods.  With the funds from this loan, Rosa Argentina plans to buy more merchandise to grow her business.

loans.use: buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mirna Carolina

texts.es: Mirna Carolina de 24 años de edad, habita con su esposo Alexis de 25 años y su pequeña hija de un año en su casa. Mirna es una mujer increíble que a pesar de su corta edad ha logrado establecer un negocio en el cual se dedica a la venta de comida y pupusas. Tiene tres años de dedicarse al negocio y  con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado afianzar  una buena cantidad de clientes que cada día la prefieren ya que se encuentra ubicada en una  zona de fácil acceso y  su comida es deliciosa, higiénica y además los precios son accesibles. Lo más importante es la amabilidad con la que  Mirna atiende a sus clientes esto ha hecho que la demanda aumente y cada día la prefieran mas. Esto la ha llevado a tomar una decisión bien importante la cual consiste en aumentar el menú que ofrece a sus clientes,  quiere tener a la disposición mayor variedad de platillos para que los clientes siempre encuentra la comida que buscan. Para esto necesita cierta cantidad de dinero con la cual no dispone pero confía que por ser una mujer responsable y trabajadora puede solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar la materia prima necesaria como: arroz, frijoles, maíz, carnes, huevos, etc. Para seguir con el negocio que le da los principales ingresos para mantener a su familia.  Así espera lograr obtener un buen aumento en sus ventas y por ende mejorar sus ingresos que le permitas aspirar a una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Mirna Carolina is 24 years old.  She lives with her husband, 25 year-old Alexis, and her one year-old daughter.

Mirna is an incredible woman who, in spite of her young age, has managed to set up a business selling meals and pupusas.  She has been in her business for three years and, with a lot of effort, she has managed to gain a good number of loyal customers who come to her business every day.  They come to her business because it is located in an easily accessible area, her food is delicious and hygienically prepared, and her prices are affordable.

The most important thing is the kindness with which Mirna serves her customers.  This has increased her demand and every day her customers become more loyal to her business.  As a result, she has taken a very important decision.  Mirna has decided to increase the menu that she offers her customers.  She would like to have available a larger variety of dishes so that her customers always find the food that they are looking for.  To achieve this, she needs a certain amount of money that she does not have but, as she is a responsible and hard-working woman, she is able to request a loan from INTEGRAL with which to buy the raw materials she needs such as rice, beans, corn, meat, eggs, etc.  This will allow her to continue in this business which is the main source of income she has for supporting her family.  She hopes to achieve a good increase in her sales and, consequently, improve her income which will allow her to aspire to a better life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials that she needs such as rice, beans, corn, meat, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 51 years of age, married, and blessed with three children. She is engaged in the direct selling business. She sells cosmetics and apparel products in their village. She also sells native delicacies for additional income. Her net income is 6,000 PHP monthly in her selling businesses. Lolita is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase perfumes, lotions, powder, lipstick and clothes to sell. She would like to continue receiving loans of larger quantities in her next loan cycles to further assist in the growth and development of her business.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, lotions, powder, lipstick and clothes to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, es una exitosa mujer joven y trabajadora de 24 años, que vive en casa de sus padres; junto a su esposo Jaime, de 27 años y su hijo menor Yosmel, de 4 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. La actividad principal de Maribel es la agricultura, donde obtiene los ingresos económicos necesarios para el sustento de su familia. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arvejas, y demás productos oriundos de la sierra peruana. Los cuales siembra hace ya 4 años, y según afirma con el esfuerzo diario, y los constantes cuidados que le brinda en compañía de su esposo, podrá obtener muchas ganancias, y con ello invertir en la compra de más terrenos agrícolas.  Ya está dando el primer paso, con la adquisición de un espacio en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde hace poco comenzó y está obteniendo buenas ganancias, ya que está en un lugar estable. Pero no solo a eso se dedica Maribel, pues en sus tiempos libres, ella prepara biscochuelos y panes. Lo que más le gusta a ella es “estar activa y lograr sus objetivos”. Ahora se está preparando para su próxima cosecha de papa, donde está segura, obtendrá buenos resultados. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de Cumutay” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además se compromete en pagar puntualmente con sus cuotas. Maribel de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja para comenzar con la próxima siembra.
texts.en: Maribel is a successful and hard-working young woman, age 24. She lives in her parents' home with her husband, Jaime, age 27, and their young child Yosmel, age 4. They live together as a family in their own home, located in the hamlet of Cumutay. Maribel's main job is in agriculture, from which she obtains the necessary income for her family's upkeep. Her main crops are potato, peas, and other products native to the Peruvian mountains. She has done this for four years, working hard every day. The constant care that she and her husband provide means that they are able to make high earnings, and with this invest in the purchase of more agricultural land. She is now taking the first step, with the acquisition of a space in the wholesale market in Tarma city, where she recently started selling. She is making a good income from this, since it is a stable location. However, this is not Maribel's only work. In her free time, she prepares angel food cake and bread. She most enjoys "being active and achieving her goals". She is currently getting ready for her next potato harvest, and she is sure that she will have good results. She belongs to the "Pioneros de Cumutay" community bank, and this is her third loan with MFP. With this small loan, she hopes to achieve her goals. Furthermore, she promises to pay her quotas punctually. With this support, Maribel will invest the requested loan in the purchase of a bag of pea seeds to start sowing the next crop.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of pea seeds.

loans.name: Maluay De Curiquinga (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Maluay de Curiquinga está formado por 12 mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy alegres, nuestras socias  trabajan día a día para sacar adelante a sus familias y para mejorar la económica de sus hogares. Viven por la comunidad de Maluay que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es reconocida por la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y mucha de su población labora en diferentes áreas en la ciudad de Cuenca.

Una de las socias es la Señora María Eugenia vive por la comunidad de Maluay, tiene 24 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijas de 3 y 1 año de edad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. María Eugenia pasa al cuidado de sus hijos que aun son muy pequeños pero hay veces que le llaman para qué lave ropa ajena, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años. 

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su suegra, con este crédito va a comprar pollos para iniciar con este negocio.
 
Sus sueños son que le vaya muy bien en sus proyectos, crecer en la cría de pollos y sacar  adelante a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The "Maluay de Curiquinga" community bank is made up of 12 hard-working, tenacious and very cheerful women.  Our members work daily to get their families ahead in life and improve the financial situation of their households.  They live in the community of Maluay which is located in El Valle parish.  This parish is well known for the beauty of its landscape.  The local people work in commerce, animal raising and farming.  Many also work in different parts of the city of Cuenca.

One of the members of this group is María Eugenia who lives in Maluay community.  She is 24 years old, married, and has two daughters aged 3 and 1 from her marriage.  Her husband works as a builder and they own the house in which they live.

María Eugenia looks after her children who are still very young.  However, there are occasions when people call on her to wash clothes for them.  She has been doing this for four years.

This is María Eugenia's first loan as a member of her community bank, which she was invited to join by her mother-in-law.  She will use this loan to buy chickens to start out in this business.  Her dreams are to be successful in her projects, to grow in her chicken-raising business and to get her daughters ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia tiene la edad de 52 años, estudio solo la secundaria y es madre soltera de 3 hijos de los cuales uno ya esta casado, otro trabaja y el mas pequeño asiste a la secundaria.

Ella nos platica que desde hace mas de 20 años vende antojitos mexicanos (empanadas, gorditas, papas, huevos, tostadas, chiles rellenos, garnachas y platanitos fritos) en el corredor de su casaque da a la carretera  los fines de semana (Viernes, sabado y domingo),  ella nos platica que sus clientes son sus vecinos y algunos viajeros que trancitan la carretera (Laguna chica/las josefinas). tambien nos dice que algunas veces realiza ventas entre semana de chiles reyenos o tamales los cuales primero ofrece con sus vecinos y posteriormente cuando ya estan listos sale a repartirlos. ella nos dice que decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que es madre soltera y tenia que sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles un poco de estudios.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de variedad de chiles, carne, huevos, aceite, arina, maiz, tortillas, mole, platanos, lechuga, tomate, cebolla, gas y refrescos para realizar sus ventas. Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospera ya que desea dar mas estudios y una mejor calidad de vida su hijo mas pequeño.
texts.en:
Silvia, 52, only completed secondary school.  She’s a single mother of three children.  One is married already, another is working and the youngest attends secondary school.

She tells us that for over 20 years she’s been selling Mexican fast food (turnovers, gorditas, potatoes, eggs, tostadas, chiles rellenos, garnachas and fried bananas) on weekends (Friday, Saturday and Sunday) in her house’s porch which faces the highway.  She tells us that her customers are her neighbors and some travelers that travel along the highway (Laguna Chica to Las Josefinas).  She also tells us that sometimes during the week she sells chiles rellenos or tamales which she offers to her neighbors and then, when they are ready, she goes out to sell them.  She tells us that she decided to start working in her own business because she’s a single mother and she had to raise her children and provide them with a bit of schooling.

She needs the loan to buy a variety of chilies, meat, eggs, oil, flour, corn, tortillas, mole, bananas, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, gas and soft-drinks to carry out her sales.  She hopes that this investment will lead to progress for her business because she wants to provide more schooling and a better quality of life for her youngest son.

loans.use: to make Mexican fast food items.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Geraldine has a retail shop business, selling canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits & snacks.

Geraldine is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits & snacks.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a businessman aged 45 years old. He is married and blessed with seven children. He recycles scrap metal to make jikos (energy-saving cookers), water cans and pans. He expanded his business premise with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya and consequently generated more income.  Through Faulu Kenya, he also managed to start dairy farming, which generates extra income for his family. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy scrap metal.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal

loans.name: 13 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiếu, a 38-year-old married mother of two, is the group leader of the 13 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members.

Hiếu lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province, where she has operated a food stall selling fruit for four years. One of the critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital, so she is now requesting her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women to purchase fruit to resell.

In the future, Hiếu hopes for her business to do well, to earn enough money to provide for her children, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Sope Ababacar Sy Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé depuis environ six mois. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui habitent toutes dans le même village et elles ont comme activité dominante le commerce de détails et l'embouche ovine.

Madame Soda positionnée à l’extrême droite de la photo est la responsable du groupe. Mère de 6 enfants; elle est âgée de 41 ans et a à sa charge des parents et beaux fils.

Elle fait du commerce de tissus au marché ou  elle a une cantine.Elle fait comme activité secondaire l'embouche ovine et caprine.

Avec son crédit elle compte acheter des tissus pour renforcer sa boutique afin d'augmenter son épargne pour aider son mari dans les charges familiales et assurer un bon épanouissement à ses enfants.
texts.en:
This solidarity group has been in existence for about six months. It is composed of 10 women who all live in the same village and whose primary activity is selling retail and raising goats and sheep. 

Madame Soda, who is on the far right of the photo, is the one responsible for the group. She is a mother of six children, aged 41, and is caring for her parents and her step-children.  

She sells cloth in the marketplace where she has a little shop. Her secondary activity is raising sheep and goats. 

With her loan, she intends to buy fabric to add to the stock in her shop so as to grow her savings to help her husband support the family and ensure that her children do well.

loans.use: to buy cloth destined for resale.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
