Cristina, who lives in the mountainous village of Rizaluna, is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She and her husband work hard to provide for the needs of the family. Cristina's husband has been operating their motorcycle transport for almost ten years, while Cristina owns a sari-sari (variety) store in the area.

Cristina is now requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy stocks of groceries for the store and sprockets for the motorcycle, unable to purchase these goods from savings that have been eroded due to the high cost of basic commodities and an abrupt increase in their household expenses. The resulting additional profits will enable her to save for future needs.

loans.use: to buy sprockets for the motorcycle and groceries  for her store.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 28-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school.  She has a business selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for four years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more clothes for sale.  She will use her profits from this loan to open a very big shop for her business extension in the future.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: José De La Concepción

texts.es:
Don José  tiene su negocio de venta de juguetes y electrodomésticos en el mercado ivan Montenegro, el tiene veinte y un  años de vender en el mercado, el vende de lunes a domingos de las seis de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.
El es casado y  padre de dos hijos  pero estos ya no dependen de el. El ha trabajado diecisiete préstamos con ceprodel y estos han sido para compra de mercadería para su negocio.
El esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertir en compra de juguetes y electrodomésticos para su negocio, ya que para estos meses las ventas son buenas.
texts.en:
Jose has a store that sells toys and domestic electric appliances in the Ivan Montenegro market. He has been selling there for 21 years. He works Monday through Sunday, from 7:00 am until 5:00 pm.

Jose is married and the father of 2 children who are no longer dependents. He has had 17 loans through Ceprodel, all of them for purchasing merchandise for his business.

Jose is requesting a new loan to purchase toys and domestic electric appliances to sell, since sales are good during these months.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Adella

texts.en:
Adella, a resident of Kampala, Uganda, is the married mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She takes care of one additional family member, her mother. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

For the last 10 years Adella has been operating a retail shop seven days a week. She also has a motorcycle that helps her generate income on a daily basis. Facing the major business challenges of transportation and seasonality, Adella is requesting a loan of 2000000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of sugar, rice, flour, cooking oil and boxes of soap. Her goals are to build rental houses and to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt , boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en:
Rezo is from the village Oshora, in the southern part of the country. He is 51 years old, married, and lives with his wife, Zhuzhuna, three sons (26, 24 and 22 years old), a daughter-in-law and a one year-old grandson. All three sons of Rezo serve in the country’s army. Rezo is leading the agricultural business of the family. They own a dairy farm with 5 milk cows. He produces various dairy products (cheese, yogurt, cottage cheese) and sells them in Batumi (nearby town). His total average monthly profit from the farm is 300 Laris. 

Rezo requested credit for purchasing an additional milk cow. He will produce and sell more dairy products and increase the profit. The family will use increased income for further development of the family dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Teresa María

texts.es:
Teresa es una persona sociable, tranquila, le gusta demostrar una sonrisa para mejorar su atención al cliente y así mejorar sus ventas. Teresa tiene 10 hijos, vive con su esposo en la ciudad de Ibarra que se encuentra al Norte de Ecuador.

Teresa trabaja con un hijo en la compra venta de juegos de sábanas, negocio que le ayuda a cubrir las necesidades diarias de su familia, al momento quiere incrementar sus productos ya que se viene la temporada navideña y en esta temporada podrá incrementar sus ventas considerablemente, proceso que ayudará a mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos. Es el primer crédito que realiza a Fodemi el mismo que invertirá en la compra de juegos de sábanas para posteriormente venderlos.

Su sueño es poder comprar un carro para distribuir junto con otro hijo.
texts.en:
Teresa is a sociable and easygoing person. She likes to greet customers with a smile in order to provide better service and therefore increase her sales. Teresa has ten children and lives with her husband in the town of Ibarra, northern Ecuador.
Teresa works with one of her sons in buying sheets sets for selling. This business helps her pay for her family's daily needs. At the moment she wishes to stock up on merchandise, since the holiday season is coming and during this time she will be able to considerably increase her sales. This will help improve the living conditions of her loved ones. This is her first loan with Fodemi and she will use it to purchase sheets sets for selling later.
Her dream is to purchase a car to distribute merchandise along with another one of her sons.

loans.use: to purchase sheets sets in order to increase business and profit from the holiday season.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en: Theresia is 57 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of 19 and 37. To earn a living, she runs a retail shop.  She has been in the business for over 10 years.  She also owns rental houses which earn her extra income.  Theresia believes that through Faulu Kenya, she will grow her business because she can easily access business loans. She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, soda and eggs.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soda and eggs.

loans.name: Sojida

texts.ru: Сочида 19 летняя молодая девушка. Она жительница района Бохтар. Сочида живет вместе папой и мамой. Ее родители занимается земледелием. Они выращивают помидоры и огурцы. Сочида шустрая и активная девушка. Она уже 2 года занимается шитьем женской одежды у себя дома. Сочида хорошо справляет со своей работой. У нее мечта стать хорошим портнихой в районе. Ее родители решили, построить дом во дворе, но для купли стройматериалов у них не хватает денег. Сочида решила взять кредит, и помочь родителям построить дом. За счет кредита Сочида хочет приобрести стройматериалы. Она  верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Sojida is 19 years old and lives in the region of Bohtar with her parents. Sojida's parents are farmers. They grow tomatoes and cucumbers. Sojida is an agile and active woman. She has been working for two years sewing women's clothing. Sojida enjoys her work and dreams of becoming a top seamstress in her region. Her parents have decided to build a house on the farm, but they don't have enough money for the building materials. They have decided to apply for a loan to cover the costs. Sojida is relying on your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 58 years old and has two children are still in school.

Marilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is married with 5 dependants. She takes care of the whole family, the husband has a poor paying job.

Nelly sells used clothes and her stock is USD 100.She does not have a permanent stall as it is expensive to own one for the time being. Her business is not enough to cater for her family basic needs and education.

loans.use: As a result of increased clientele, she is to increase her stock and rent a stall for her business. Given a loan of USD.300 she will be in position of increasing her stock and serve her clients well. This will improve her sales as well as her income.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.en:
Mr. Kodjo N. is a dedicated young man. He is married and the father of four children. He was forced to end his studies in secondary school when he ran out of money. He completed a computer training course however, and thanks to his own efforts, has managed to purchase a used computer which allowed him to open a small word processing and computing shop. His good sense of work well done leads to high customer satisfaction among those who come to the shop. Currently he’s very much in demand but has only a single computer that no longer even works properly. He would like to equip his shop with more effective technology in order to meet demand. To do this, he is seeking an $850 loan to buy modern computers for more efficient data analysis. Mr. N. will then be able to earn enough money to take care of his family and to lead a more fulfilling professional life.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur N. Kodjo est un jeune homme très dévoué. Il est marié et père de quatre (4) enfants. Il arrêta ses études au cours secondaire parce qu’il n’avait plus de soutien. Il va faire une formation en informatique et grâce à ses efforts personnels, il arrive à acquérir un ordinateur d’occasion, ce qui lui a permis d’ouvrir un petit centre de traitement de texte. Ayant le sens du travail bien fait, il satisfait pleinement tous les clients qui passent dans le centre. Il est aujourd’hui très sollicité mais il n’a qu’un seul ordinateur qui ne fonctionne même plus correctement. Il souhaite doter son centre de matériel informatique plus performant afin de pouvoir être à la hauteur de la demande. Pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de $850 pour s’acheter des postes ordinateurs modernes pour un traitement plus efficace des données. De cette activité sortira un revenu qui permettra à Monsieur N. de s’épanouir et de prendre soin de sa famille.

loans.use: purchase of computers and accessories

loans.name: Pashton

texts.en: Pashton is a mother of eight children and lives in Kabul City. She has a small retail shop in her alley and sells gas, fuel, Pepsi, baskets, powders, and other popular items. She works part-time with her son who is student in school. She was able to study up to the 6th grade before she left school, and this enables her to work outside the home. She is requesting a loan so she can enlarge her shop and purchase more goods to sell. This will enable her to better provide for her family.

loans.use: To enlarge her shop and purchase more goods

loans.name: Desiderio

texts.es:
Desiderio and his family are producers of cow’s milk which they market to Pil Andina (which is an industrialization milk plant). He also works as a caretaker at a private home located in the city of La Paz. Desiderio has two sons of 21 and 16 years of age. The oldest is in the Military (to do military service is very important to the Aymara-Andean community since they regard this as an honorable service to the entire community). The youngest son is in his last year of college. They live in the Achacachi-Tipampa Community (which is about 2 hours from the city of El Alto).

The loan will be used to purchase a medium-grade dairy cow which will help increase milk production.

This is their first loan with IMPRO. Their background check shows that they are prime candidates for a loan!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Desiderio y su familia son productores de leche de vaca que comercializan a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), también trabaja como portero de una casa particular en la Ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 2 hijos de 21 y 16 años de edad, el mayor esta prestando el Servicio Militar (servicio muy importante para la comunidad aymará - andina y de trascendencia para la comunidad dada la importancia que se le otorga a este servicio) el hijo menor esta en el ultimo año de Colegio. Vive en la Comunidad de Achacachi - Tipampa (A dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito será para invertir en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy a milking cow

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata B. started her business on a small scale in 2001.  The business has developed so much that Fatmata transferred her business to Kabala town of Sierra Leone from Fadugu village.  A forty-year old mother of four children, she is hard working and has a strong business mind.  She proudly said, “I have built a small house from the profit I got from my business.” Fatmata would like to diversify her grocery business and is requesting a loan of $1200.  Her plan is to generate more profit for building small houses in Kabala town for rent. She said this will be a source of income when she gets too old to run a business.

loans.use: Diversify her grocery business

loans.name: Marcelina Ana

texts.es:
Marcelina is an elderly woman who has suffered greatly in life due to the death of her husband who left her a widow with 6 children. She had to care for and educate them, which she did with great strength thanks to a knowledge of planting and harvesting acquired alongsiD. her husband. Today her children have their own families and now Marcelina lives in a humble aboD. in the company of her oldest daughter who decided to move home with Marcelina due to the physical and psychological violence that she was suffering from in her former home. Marcelina did not hesitate to support her daughter so that she could distance herself from a merciless husband. In spite of all of the difficulties that Marcelina has had to face, she has always been able to count on the support of her oldest son who helped her get ahead with the only job that she was able to do and could dedicate herself to efficiently. In short order Marcelina has reinitiated activity on her small farm, but because she no longer has the strength of her youth and requires assistance for the work, this time it is her daughter who will help her continue her labor. She also needs fertilizer and manure in order to improve her products. She is asking for a sum of $175 in order to acquire those items. We believe that you could help her continue to plant seeds of hope in the heart of her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcelina es una mujer D. avanzada edad que ha sufrido mucho en L. vida a raíz D. L. muerte D. su esposo quién L. dejó viuda y con 6 hijos a los cuales tuvo que cuidar y educar con mucho esfuerzo gracias al conocimiento D. siembra y cosecha que había adquirido junto a su esposo.Hoy sus hijos tienen sus propias familias y ahora habita su humilD. morada en compañía D. su hija mayor que decidió mudarse con elL. a raíz D. L. violencia física y psicológica que sufría en su antiguo hogar, motivo por el cual Marcelina no dudo en apoyar a su hija para que se alejara D. su despiadado esposo. Pese a todos los apuros que tuvieron que pasar siempre contó con el apoyo D. su hijo mayor quién lo ayudó a seguir adelante con el único oficio que pueD. hacer y al que pueD. dedicarse eficientemente. En poco tiempo reinició su actividad en L. chacra pero como ya no tiene L. fuerza D. su juventud y requiere ayuda para trabajar y esta vez es su hija quién L. ayudará a continuar con su labor. También requiere fertilizantes y abono para mejorar sus productos y solicita L. suma D. 175 dólares para adquirirlos. Tenemos L. convicción D. que usted podrá ayudarL. para que siga sembrando esperanzas en el corazón D. su hija.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and manure

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es:
For the last seventeen years, this woman has possessed a small but well stocked fruit stand. In her own words, she has had to work hard to grow her business, and has dedicated herself to it since she was very young. Before she had this location, she worked in the Diriamba market. She began by walking through the city, selling out of a hamper, with initial capital of $500, her husband’s savings.

Thanks to her sacrifice and perseverance, she has succeeded in making adequate use of her own resources and those from the credits she has received; she is earning better profits at her stand, while at the same time stretching herself to increase the stock in her business to have just a little bit of everything. Mrs. L. is married, and her partner supports her with the household expenses, though not 100% due to her low salary that supports eight school-age children being raised alongside her partner.

With CEPRODEL she has had 14 credit loans in two years, and says she is pleased with the work alliance she has with the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Esta señora posee, desde hace poco más de 17 años, un pequeño, pero bien surtido puesto de ventas de frutas. Según manifiesta ella misma, ha tenido que luchar duramente para hacer crecer su negocio, ya que desde muy joven se ha dedicado al comercio. Antes de tener este local, trabajaba en el mercado de Diriamba. Empezó vendiendo en un canasto de manera ambulante con un capital de US$500.00 los cuales eran ahorros de su esposo.

Gracias a su sacrificio y perseverancia ha logrado hacer uso adecuado de sus propios recursos y de los recursos provenientes de los créditos que ha recibido, realizando mejoras en el puesto que posee y a su vez esforzándose por aumentar el surtido de su negocio, es decir, tiene de todo un poco, aunque en menores cantidades. La señora L. esta casada, su pareja le apoya con los gastos del hogar, aunque no en un 100%, debido a su bajo salario q, tiene ocho hijos, todos ellos en edad escolar los cuales está formando junto a su pareja.

Con CEPRODEL lleva 14 creditos en 2 años y dice sentirse satisfecha de esta alianza de trabajo con esta Institucion.

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Stella S.. She is a seamstress by trade and in 2000 opened her own business sewing and mending dresses for clients in Ubungo, a suburb of Dar es Salaam. Most clients bring their own cloth to Stella and tell her the style of dress they would like sewn. However, Stella has realised that there is also a market for pre-made designs and is requesting a loan of $450 to purchase the materials necessary to sew a new range for sale. She has already repaid one loan from SELFINA and is determined to do so again. Stella is married to husband Emmanuel and has two children, Charles, aged 11, and Jack, aged 9.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase materials to sew a new range of clothes for sale

loans.name: Katooke Iii 2039(D) Group

texts.en:
With the extra business profits, Teo wants improve the health standards of his children and also pay their school fees. Rose sells cold drinks and wants to use the loan to buy a new fridge. Sarah offers secretarial services, while Winfred sells scrap.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add more stock in her hardware shop

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Qurbanova Akif is a 44-year-old trader who sells fruits and vegetables in the local bazaar in his small village Sarijalar in the Saatli region. He has six years of experience in this field.  Now he needs 1100 USD to improve  the conditions in which to keep fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To improve the conditions for keeping fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Saak Guiss Group

texts.fr:
We are group of women who live in the ecovillage of Palmarin. We would like to begin producing and selling processed food products (peanut butter, couscous, beans and salt). We are available to work and would like to be able to supply the entire village with food products. The fishermen who go out to sea need to be nourished with food that can sustain them for days in a humid climate. That is why we would like to be their supplier. To do so, we would like to build a storage house, upgrade our salt extraction equipment and have capital to be able to purchase raw materials. 

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Nous sommes un groupe de femmes qui habite l'écovillage de Palmarin. Nous  voulons nous activer sur la production et la vente de denrée alimentaire transformée( pâte d'arachide, couscous, haricot, et sel.) Nous sommes très disponible et souhaitons que nous puissions fournir tout le village en denrée alimentaire. Les pêcheurs qui vont en mer ont besoins d'être ravitaillé en nourriture qui puisse tenir des jour en milieu humide. C'est pour cela que nous souhaitons être leur fournisseur. C'est ainsi que nous voulons construire un magasin de stockage, renouveler notre matériel d'extraction de sel et avoir un fond qui nous permet d'acheter de la matière première.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for food production: peanuts, black-eyed peas and millet

loans.name: Mirna Enith

texts.es:
Senora Mirna is a member of the communal bank La Familia, located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali, Peru. She is 50 years old and has 3 children. With the first loan she received, she invested in a business buying and selling wood. She continues to run this business, getting up at 5 in the morning to make breakfast for her children, and then proceeding to oversee the sales of the wood until 1 in the afternoon. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in different types of wood to offer her customers.

Mirna is content and grateful. Thanks to the help she has received, her business is growing more every day and she is able to better support her children and pay for their education. She feels proud of what she is accomplishing

La señora Mirna pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en el Psj Nuevo Mundo Mz C Lt 11, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años y es madre de 3 hijos, Mirna con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de compra y venta de madera. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de madera, para lo cual se levanta a las 5 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de allí se dirige al aserradero para controlar la venta de su madera hasta las 1 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará maderas de las especies shihuahuaco, estoraque, etc. Mirna esta muy contenta y agradecida, gracias al apoyo de manuela ramos su negocio crece cada día mas, sus ingresos están aumentando y así puede apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, se siente realizada como mujer.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER BUSINESS BUYING AND SELLING WOOD.  WITH THE LOAN, SHE WILL  BUY DIFFERENT TYPES OF WOOD TO MEET THE DEMANDS OF HER CUSTOMERS AND CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in raw materials to produce her delicious arepas and mabí.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheng L. is a vegetable seller in Phsa Leu Village in Kampong Chhnang province. Her husband, Mr. Buthoeurn Top, is a construction worker. They have 4 children, 2 of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are enrolled in school. Although the family members have different business activities, they are currently living in poor conditions. Therefore, Mrs. Sokheng L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a motor-taxi business in order to improve their living standards. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to start a motor-taxi business in order to improve their living standards

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru:
Dilshod D. is a resident of Fayzabad district. He is 30 years old, married, and has two children. He teaches in a middle school. He also sells muskmelons and watermelons. He has a stand from which he sells them on the main street of Fayzabad. He would like to take out a loan in the amount of 1500 somoni to increase his turnover. He plans to pay it back within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Давлатов Дильшод житель района Файзабад. 30 лет , женат и имеет двоих детей. Работает учителем в средней школе.Кроме того занимается торговлей дынь и арбузов. Имеет торговую точку ц главной дороге Файзабада.Хочет получить кредит в размере 1500 сомони для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Goods delivery

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia is a member of the Community Bank Atinchik which means "We can" in Quechua.

Virginia is married, 40 years old, and has one daughter. Virginia has her own stand in the Magdalena market where she sells different types of clothing such as sweaters, stockings, and shirts. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. Virginia also sells clothing wholesale to stores located in Huanta and Ayacucho. She travels monthly to buy her products.

Virginia needs a loan of 2000 Soles which will be used for the purchase of stockings and undergarments.

Virginia's dreams are to have her own capital, to expand her business, and to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal Atinchik que significa Podemos en quechua.

Virginia es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 1 hija, Virginia tiene un puesto propio en el mercado de la Magdalena donde vende ropa variada como chompas, medias, polos, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Virginia vende la ropa al por mayor a tiendas, puestos en la ciudad de Huanta y Ayacucho, Virginia viaja mensualmente a comprar sus productos.

Virginia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medias y ropas interiores. Los sueños de Virginia son tener un capital propio, ampliar sus negocios y tener casa propia.

loans.use:
Virginia needs a loan of 2000 Soles which will be used for the purchase of stockings and undergarments.

Virginia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medias y ropas interiores.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma cumplió 26 años de edad, estudio quinto de secundaria, es casada y tiene 01 hijo de 04 años de edad, vive en el barrio Pilcuyo.

Hace un año es socia del Banco Comunal Ciudad Nueva, Distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia del Collao – Puno, con su primer préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles compró 10 arrobas de quinua. Desde que era soltera empezó a vender ropa (mandiles, casacas) en la plaza de Ilave, desde que formó su hogar se dedica a la compra y venta de: papa, chuño, quinua compra de las ferias de Ccachi, Accasa, Pilcuyo y vende en Ilave los domingos.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles que pagará en 04 cuotas comprará: 10 arrobas de quinua, 05 arrobas de chuño, 10 arrobas de papa que serán comercializados en la plaza de Ilave.

Su sueño es construir su casa acceso a la pista e instalar un taller de mecánica automotriz juntamente con su esposo y seguir con el negocio para generar mayores ingresos para educar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Norma is 26 years old, has a high school education and is married with one 4-year-old son. She lives in the neighborhood of Pilcuyo. A year ago, she became a member of the New City Community Bank, and with her first loan she purchased 10 units of quinoa (a grain). When she was single she started selling clothing (aprons, jackets) in a local square, but now that she has formed her home she makes a living buying and selling potatoes, flour and quinoa, which she purchases at the fair markets in Ccachi, Accasa and Pilcuyo and sells in the square on Sundays. With the $425 loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within four months, she will purchase: 10 units of quinoa, 5 units of flour and 10 units of potatoes to sell. Her dream is to build a walkway to her home and install an automotive mechanic shop together with her husband, and continue with her business to generate more income for her son's education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes, flour and quinoa (grain)

loans.name: Mara

texts.en:
Mrs. Mara E., 28, and her husband, Mr. Thoeun Thorn, 41, who live along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1998 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Their daughter studies in a local school.

Mara has been a cotton scarf weaver for six years, a skill she learned from her mother. She takes her products to sell at Olympic Market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a policeman and a motor taxi driver as well. Mara is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase cotton materials for weaving cotton scarves.

loans.use: To purchase cotton materials for weaving cotton scarves

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana A. is married and has 4 dependants. She received schooling through senior high. Christiana has been selling clothing and fabric since 2000 at the new market in Elmina, Ghana. Her husband works as a photographer.

Christiana uses her income to help her husband with the family expenses. Christiana will use the loan to buy more fabric for resale and to purchase plastic products to include in her trade. With the new profits from her expanded business, Christiana plans to complete the family house she started with her husband.

loans.use: Buy more fabric and add plastic products to her trade

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan L. es una persona muy trabajadora, labora para una empresa constructora desde hace 20 años, el poco a poco le ha ido haciendo mejoras a su vivienda y ahora esta solicitando este crédito para colocar la losa de concreto para su casa en un cuarto que termino de construir y así brindarle a su familia una mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Juan L. is a very hardworking person. He has worked for a construction company for 20 years. He has gradually been making improvements to his house. He is now requesting this loan so he can pour the concrete slab for a room that he has finished building and therbey provide his family with a more comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pour a concrete slab

loans.name: Obelisco Group

texts.en:
The Obelisco Village Bank is maD. up of mostly women, and all of the members are from Quinua, a town located about an hour from the city of Ayacucho. 

Faustina, Nelva and Juana are three members of the Obelisco Village Bank. 

Faustina is 36 years old and is married with four children. She has a store in a rented space, where she sells handicrafts like ceramic dishes and figures, alabaster sculptures (which are traditional of the Ayacucho region) and “retablos” (small, brightly painted scenes of traditional Ayacuchan life maD. from clay). Faustina runs the business with her family, who are all artisans. The family has been in this business for about ten years. They make some of their own crafts, and buy the rest from other local artisans. Faustina is requesting a loan of 300 soles to buy more handbags and key chains. Her goal for the future is to open her own restaurant. 

Nelva is 62 years old and married with four children. She owns a general store in Quinua, where she sells basic cooking ingredients like flour, sugar and oil as well as drinks, fruits and vegetables. She has had her business for eight years, and works with her daughter. They open the store from 5am to 10pm each day. Nelva is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy more rice, sugar and oil for her store. 

Juana is 41 years old and is married with six children. Like Faustina, she sells handicrafts in Quinua. Most of the work she sells is maD. from alabaster and clay. She makes some of it herself, and buys the rest from other local artisans. Juana has had this business for some time now, though she does not remember how many years it has been. She works at her store from 11am to 6pm, seven days a week. She is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy more handicrafts and more materials to do her own work. Juana says that FINCA has been a big help in paying for her children’s education. Most of her children are now adults with professional degrees, while others are currently enrolled in a local university.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, handicrafts

loans.name: Jimoh

texts.en: Jimoh A. is 42 years old and married with four children. Jimoh sells building materials. He is a hardworking man and hopes to pull his family out of poverty. He needs a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. He is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Sakhay Dad

texts.en:
Sakhay Dad K.  lives in Kabul Afghanistan. He is  43 years old and is married with four children. Sakhay is a carpenter and needs money to enlarge his business. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 11 months. He will use the loan to  buy necessary materials for his shop to complete his stock.
Sakhay is very happy with the loan process in Afghanistan that helps poor people in the country and he thanks they all lenders to AFSG, especially Kiva.

loans.use: To complete his stock and buy necessary materials for his shop

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma M. is a 64-year-old mother of 10 whose husband is a farmer.  One of her children is still in college, and eight are university graduates.  Norma plans to use this loan to buy inventory such as soft drinks, beer, liquor, and cigarettes for her 'sari sari' store.  'Sari sari' stores are small variety shops found across the Philippines, usually operated out of the proprietor's house.  Besides the shop, Norma also makes money by selling vegetables from time to time.  Norma hopes that one day she will be able to expand her store.

loans.use: To buy inventory such as soft drinks and cigarettes for a small general store.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan E. is currently in the business of selling beans at the market and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Juan is 39 years old and is married to a businessman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Toàn Nguyễn is a 51-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has two adult children. To making a living, Toàn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. Toàn has been engaged in this business for more than 30 years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Toàn joined Kiva's partner TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Toàn has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Toàn is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Toàn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente  du quartier d’avédji telessou,  elle a pour activité l’exploitation d’un débit de boisson local appelé « Tchouc », elle a commencé cette exploitation depuis 1998, elle prépare elle-même cette boisson à partir du mil, pour préparer efficacement cette boisson elle utilise le charbon de bois. Son stock de mil étant épuisé, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 03 sacs de mil, 10 bol de maïs, 01 sac de charbon de bois et divers. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants, avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce elle aide son époux dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This woman is a resident of the Avédji Telessou district. Her business is a sales outlet for a local drink called “Tchouc”. She began this business in 1998. She herself makes this beverage from millet. To produce it effectively, she uses charcoal. Her stock of millet being exhausted, she’s requesting an initial loan from WAGES to buy three sacks of millet, ten bowls of corn, one sack of charcoal, and various items. She is married and the mother of five children. With what she earned from her commerce, she helps her husband with household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy millet, corn, and charcoal

loans.name: Julio Manuel

texts.es: Julio Manuel D. C. de 23 años de edad, reside en San Vicente junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de dos años de edad. Julio se dedica a la reparación de sistemas eléctricos en vehículos. El solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder reponer algunos aparatos eléctricos de sus clientes, los cuales los perdió en un incendio en su taller, es así como espera poder obtener el dinero, ya que por sus propios medios le es imposible poder hacerlo ya que es el único que trabajo de su hogar y debe trabajar muy duro para proveer a su familia y su presupuesto no da a basta para solventar dichos aparatos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Julio Manuel D. C. is 23 years old, and lives with his partner in San Vicente. They have a 2 year old daughter. Julio works as a repairman for electronic systems in cars. He requests a loan in order to replace some electronic parts for his customers. He lost the parts in a fire at his workshop, which is why he is hoping for a loan. It is impossible for him to re-purchase the parts otherwise, as he provides the entire income for his household, and he cannot afford to purchase the equipment with his current financial means.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase electronic systems.

loans.name: Shahnaz Kosar Abdul Sattar Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz kosar baji has been a citizen of Yadgar in the city of Lahore, Pakistan, for the past seven years. Her husband runs a business selling construction supplies to building contractors. Shahnaz baji sews clothes for people and charges them $2 an item. She saves her money in a committee for rainy days. Shahnaz baji is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies to increase her husband's profit. 

Samina kosar baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

Farzana bano baji wants a loan to buy calling cards to sell. 

Salma begum baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. 

About group loans
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Mrs. Editha A. is 60 years old with one child. She is a widow now and resides at Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Being a widow, Mrs. A. decided to engage in food retailing to be of assistance in supplying finances, specifically for their daily basic needs and for her old age. In February 2008, she decided to be a member of Paglaum MPC. Since then, she demonstrates excellent performance in terms of loan repayments.

Now, she has obtained a loan of Php 8,000 intended for use as additional capital for her food retailing business. Her regular customers are their friends, neighbors, and relatives. She aspires to a comfortable living, and having enough income to sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom B. is a villager in Roeu Sey Srouk village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer and owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Lab Kaem Ra, is a construction worker. This couple has six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Mom B. is requesting a loan to add her savings to build a better house for her family. She is shown, in the photo, with her husband.

loans.use: To build a better house.

loans.name: Ana Yadira

texts.es: Ana Yadira R. tiene 40 años de edad. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar el servicio de costura. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella comienza este negocio desde muy joven, ya que tenia 2 hijos varones que necesitaban de estudio y alimentación, actualmente ellos no dependen de ella. A pesar de los desafíos que enfrenta es que tiene problemas de la vista, y esto se debe a que en muchas ocasiones ella labora de noche porque tiene muchos encargos y no le gusta quedar mal con sus clientes.  Por lo que solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de  telas, hilos, tijeras y agujas. Su mayor sueño es establecer una tienda en donde exhiba solamente diseños nicaragüenses.
texts.en:
Ana Yadira R. is 40 years old. She works as a seamstress and has been in this business for over 20 years. She started her business when she was very young because she had 2 sons who needed food and an education. At the moment, they do not depend on her. She faces many challenges due to problems with her vision caused by working many nights to fulfill her orders. She doesn't like to disappoint her customers. This is why she is requesting financing for working capital to buy fabrics, threads, scissors and needles. Her greatest dream is to create a store where she will exhibit only Nicaraguan designs.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Esperanza es soltera, tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, Esperanza viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales, queso, productos que comercializa en el mercado Nery. Además Esperanza teje chompas a pedido.
Esperanza necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebada, trigo.
Los sueños de Esperanza son ampliar sus negocios y que su hijo culmine sus estudios.

loans.use: Para la compra de cebada, trigo.

loans.name: Mother Blessings #3 Group

texts.en:
Mother Blessings #3 is a group of 5 borrowers led by Mbowolee K.. They live in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.  Mbowolee is 29 years old and married. She has 2 children, ages 3 and 6, and also cares for 2 children who were orphaned in the war. 

Mbowolee was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide and, therefore, school was considered unnecessary. She lives in remote Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Mbowolee’s business is retail dry goods, including slippers, children’s clothes, shirts, and pants, which she buys wholesale in nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall on the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for 3 years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers.

She’s taking a loan to increase her inventory so she can meet increased demand. Her dream is to expand her business so she can, one day, have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business, Mbowolee dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: Purchase clothes and slippers for inventory

loans.name: Din

texts.en: D., 35, is a local handicap maker such as cupboard, table, bed from the rattan and wood to the villages and communes. His partner life is Sdeng, 32, is a seller of local house window and door trader. They married had given birth three children all of whom are single and attend school. They all want to increase their business by raising the numbers of producing and more import of the materials from the local villagers. So D. decided to buy a loan of $ 300.00 from HKL to invest in his furniture making and his wife trade. D. was not available during the photograph so his wife is taken instead.

loans.use: to invest in his furniture making and his wife trade.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
58-year old Felicisima F. manages a sari-sari store in Banga, South Cotabato.  She owns 2 motorcycles and raised 2 pigs as additional sources of income.  She has 5 children, the eldest is already 36 years old.  The daily needs of her family are met because of her business.

Now she still needs an additional capital to help finance her existing business.  She would like to request a loan of Php 10000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc.  This will help her in financing her business.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita M. is from the village of Grace Village, Sto. Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 59 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Rosita owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth B. is from the village of Sto Nino, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 19 years old. Naneth is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Naneth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Naneth has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Naneth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Naneth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Naneth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mariza

texts.es:
Mariza tiene 30 años, creció con la convicción de trabajar para salir adelante. Vive con su esposo de 35 años y sus pequeños hijos: Saúl de 7 y Estrella de 2 años.

Desde hace algunos meses atrás se dedica a la preparación de pan, queques y picarones -postres peruanos- que comercializa en la esquina de su casa. Según cuenta, la necesidad misma de ayudar a su familia hizo que se decidiera a vender estos dulces, porque lo aprendió de su madre y solo basto con poner en práctica lo que había visto durante tantos años. 
Gracias a que este negocio le resultó rentable, está logrando comprarse conejos, pues piensa comercializar más adelante este animal, es un negocio que puede desarrollar desde su casa para no descuidar a sus hijos. Su madre la anima a comprar un par de conejos y luego otros 6 más; en la actualidad desea seguir comprando mayor cantidad, hasta tener su propia granja. 
Así pasan los días de esta luchadora mujer que no se detiene ante las dificultades y siempre tiene mente positiva sobretodo para emprender un negocio.

Y aunque este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, piensa cumplir honradamente como siempre lo ha hecho con cada una de sus responsabilidades, además está muy contenta con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque sabe que todos cumplirán como ella. Además Mariza tiene pensando invertir el dinero del préstamo en abono para la chacra de su padre, para empezar a sembrar entre los dos y obtener ganancias a medias para seguir adelante con todos sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mariza is 30 years old. She lives with her husband, who is 35, and their children: Saúl, 7, and Estrella, 2.

Mariza was raised with the conviction that you must work hard to succeed. For several months, she has worked preparing bread, cakes and picarones (Peruvian desserts) and selling them on the corner near her house. She started this business out of necessity, putting into practice a skill she learned from watching her mother for many years.

Thanks to the profits from this business, Mariza has been able to purchase some rabbits. Her mother encouraged her to buy two rabbits at first, then six more. She would like to continue buying more until she has her own farm. She wants to develop the rabbit business because she can do it at home and not have to leave her children. This is how the days are for this fighting woman who does not stop for difficulties, and has a positive attitude, especially for starting a business.

This is Mariza’s third loan from MFP and she plans to fulfill it honorably, as she has always done with each of her responsibilities. She is very happy with her communal bank because all the members are just as responsible as she is. She will use the loan money to buy fertilizer for her father’s farm, that they will plant together. This will bring earnings to continue pursuing her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Mrs. Choeun Thinh Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group is made up of 20 people who live in the village of S. in Takeo province. Mrs. Choeun T. has been chosen to lead the group, whose members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Choeun is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field on which she cultivates rice. Her main problem is low soil fertility, and she will use her portion of the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Doeuk Voeun, is a fisherman. Mrs. Choeun T. is 37 years old and has two children, one of whom is old enough to attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, age 47, lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is a client of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers at the market. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers, and she hopes someday to own a supermarket. She is married and has six children.

Martha is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN, which she will use to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora NIEVES, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es natural de la provincia de Calca exactamente de Taray – Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años de edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos, (15, 14) años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene un restaurante en el distrito de San Sebastián, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en el negocio, ella necesita comprar platos y algunos accesorios para el restaurante,
 
La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nieves belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas" ("United Women") Community Bank. She is a native of the province of Calca, more precisely the Taray-Cusco area. She is 36 years old, married and has two children, ages 15 and 14. Nieves divides her time between her household responsibilities and her job as retail merchant. She has a restaurant in the district of San Sebastián. She is requesting the loan to be able to reinvest in her business by purchasing plates and some other restaurant accessories. Nieves is grateful and expresses her satisfaction with being able to keep growing her own business, and she promises to fulfill her payments in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and reinvest in her restaurant.

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane C. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 34 years old. Maryjane is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Maryjane owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Maryjane has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maryjane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maryjane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. Maryjane is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Maryjane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
For the past 33 years of being poor, Nancy R. can hardly remember a time when she was happy and not bothered by her family's economic situation. She can always recall the many struggles she has been through just to have something for her children to eat and survive each day. Beginning in 1999, Nancy became thankful for ASHI, Kiva field partner in the Philippines, because it was through her membership that she accessed a loan which enabled her to start a small business.

She tried several ways to earn money until the amount of loan she could request had increased. With the support of her loving husband and children, Nancy ventured into a business of selling fish and slaughtering pigs. Both are sold from her rented stall at the Municipal market. Eventually, Nancy’s life has changed a bit together with her family. However, she is still financially insecure, especially the thought that her five children aged 1 to 14, are growing and their needs, especially in education, are also increasing. Nancy is scared that the present profit her business is making will not be enough for her to sustain the education of her children until they graduate from college. With that in mind, Nancy now is requesting a much larger amount of loan to expand her business. She and her husband agreed to purchase a mini-truck (multicab in Filipino) so that they can supply fish to their customers in other neighboring provinces and cities around Panay Island (small Island in the Philippines where Antique province is situated).

loans.use: To purchase a mini-truck for the delivery of large volumes of fish.

loans.name: Atyrkul's Group

texts.en:
Atyrkul K., the leader of the group, is a wonderful woman. She is self-confident, insistent and energetic: these features have really helped in her life, because now she has a lovely family and likes what she does. As with most women, she has dedicated her life to the benefit of her family. Now she is the mother of four children. Her elder daughter is a university student. Atyrkul wishes to help her daughter because she rents a flat and needs some money to live. The rest of her children are school students. 

Atyrkul has a marvelous husband who works as a driver in the local administration. This friendly family has a livestock business. They sell milk and cattle, so they have already bought a new house, changed all their domestic appliances and can pay their daughter’s tuition. It is the result of 25 years of labor and some money which they had at the beginning. Now they have impressive results, because their monthly revenue is 10,000 KGS ($227). They want to buy a sheep to raise by getting a loan.

Maksatbek K. is 62. He has a wife who is a pensioner and he also has children who live separately. Even though his wife is a pensioner, she sells goods in a pavilion near their house. They started their business with 25,000 KGS ($568) and now their profit is 7,000 KGS ($160) per month. He wants to get a loan to buy foodstuffs in order to trade wholesale.

Gulan K. is 40 and is divorced. She is a state clerk. She has livestock and has land on which she plans to build a house. Now she wants to get a loan to buy a cow to extend her livestock.

Gulzada A. is 43, is married and has five children. Three of her children go to the local school, the other two are at home. They plan to send her daughter to the capital for her education because they live in a village which is located far from Bishkek. They have already built a house, so they want to buy a new carpet with the loan. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a sheep to raise

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Thirty-five-year-old farmer Renato plows a rice field in Agusan del Sur. He strives hard, working on his farm, to support his three children. He wants them to finish their studies at school. He wants to improve his farming to have greater earnings.

He heard about Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner that offers financial assistance to entrepreneurs like him. He joined and requested a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos to support his business on the farm.

loans.use: Farm inputs

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.en:
Reinerio is a 39-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol, who catches fish to provide for the needs of his family. He is married to Ma. Chuchie and has four children. He has fifteen years experience in fishing. He wants to live a healthy life and be able to send his children to school. 

Reinerio joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in 2003 and finds it helpful for his business. He is currently asking for a loan of 15,000 Php to provide more supplies for fishing.

loans.use: To provide more supplies for fishing

loans.name: Gbodeman Group

texts.en: Edwin G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Gbodeman Group. He is 43 years old, married and has four children who range from 5 to 22 years old. He could not continue his education through 9th grade due to the Liberian civil crisis. For three years, Edwin has been selling provisions at the Pipelines Catholic Junction in Paynesville, Liberia. He sells goods that customers want to buy in order to encourage them to continue buying from him. Edwin started selling on a table with few goods but now sells in a shop with lots of goods. He sometimes faces problems with customers buying on credit without paying on time, which is not good for business. Edwin plans to use his 9,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 41,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more provisional goods. His goal is to grow his business to expand to other communities in Monrovia. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Edwin is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more provisional goods

loans.name: Nyamishamba Twetunjgure B, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
As they say that determination is the key to success, T. Ketty, happily married with five children, ventured into tea growing in Nyamishamba, Kihihi, six years ago.

It was after working in a tea factory that Ketty developed an interest in growing and selling tea leaves. Her main hindrance is having few seedlings. Therefore, with this loan, she looks at expanding her tea plantation through buying more seedlings and doing it on a large scale. This will improve her sales and enable her to take care of her family needs.

loans.use: to purchase more tea seedlings to expand her plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cassava and yams

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 54 años, comparte su vida con su esposa Antonia de 48 años y con 5 de sus 6 hijos, ya que el mayor trabaja de manera independiente, juntos viven en su casa propia. Este hombre trabajador, es conocido en su localidad como el “mil oficios”, ya que se dedica a varias actividades, como agricultor de café y plátano, albañil, sastre, panadero y carpintero en donde fabrica diversos muebles, que son vendidos en las ferias de su ciudad y entre sus vecinos, quienes le hacen pedidos especiales, es así que tiene 30 años practicando estas labores. Pablo, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos en la agricultura, que es el trabajo que más ganancias le genera, ya que le permite brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Hasta ahora ha logrado cubrir los gastos domiciliarios, la educación de sus hijos además de invertir materiales para fabricar muebles. Lo que más le gusta es darle un acabado especial y pintar sus muebles y por tal motivo desea implementar su carpintería, además de mejorar la productividad de café, puesto que tiene planes de ser acopiador de café en su sector. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y se muestra orgulloso de continuar laborado con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, quienes son personas honestas y responsables y siempre trabajan de manera activa. 
Con el crédito que solicita, comprará maquinarias monofásicas, motores para disco que le servirán para cortar madera.
texts.en:
Pablo is 54 years old and shares his life with his wife Antonia who is 48, and with 5 of his 6 children, now that the eldest works independently. They all live in his own house. This hard-working man is known in his locality as having “a thousand skills” because he dedicates himself to various activities, including coffee and plantain farmer, brick layer, tailor, baker and carpenter – he even constructs diverse furniture which he sells in the city markets and among neighbors who submit special orders. Pablo has done these jobs for 30 years. He can count on the help of his wife and children in agriculture, the work that generates most of his income and permits him to offer the best to his family. Until now, he has been able to cover household costs and the education of his children, plus invest in materials to make furniture. What he likes most is to finish and paint his furniture, and for that reason, he wants to advance his carpentry and, in addition, to improve the productivity of his coffee, since he plans to be the coffee wholesaler in his sector. This is the 2nd time he has requested a loan with MFP and he is very proud of continuing to collaborate with the members of his communal group, who are honest and responsible persons who always work in an active manner. With the requested loan he will purchase special tools and equipment for cutting wood.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MACHINES FOR CUTTING WOOD TO MAKE FURNITURE

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean N. is from the village of Gingoog City. She is 25 years old. Jean is single and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jean owns & operates a business venture providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members. Jean has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jean is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.en:
Tutiniso has built a profitable business selling kid’s clothing at the busy central market called “Panjshanbe” in Khujand. She has done well by concentrating on a product that she is interested in and where there is not a lot of competition. Tutiniso has been in business for 15 years. She is looking forward to developing it and making it successful. Tutiniso is married and has two children. She is doing all she can to ensure the best future for them. Anorkhol has requested a loan for $1500 USD to purchase additional inventory for the summer season. Previous loans from “IMON International” have been a great help to Tutiniso.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing clothing to expand inventory

loans.name: Mohamed Alie

texts.en:
Mohamed sells electronic appliances in the city center of Makeni. He is a cool and courageous businessman. He initially accessed funds from his elder brother and started selling cassette tapes ten years ago.

Mohamed is married to a trader and has one child and two dependents.

Mohamed has a good loan repayment history. He needs this loan to buy more electronic appliances. He hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to educate his children to university level and to construct a house.

loans.use: To buy additional electronic appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a variety of seafood

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es:
La señora Magdai Sánchez M., tiene cincuenta y cuatro años de edad, vive en Ángel Alvino Corzo Municipio de Copainala,  Estado de Chiapas México. Tuvo cinco hijos los cuales cada uno tiene su respectivo hogar, en su poder tiene dos de sus nietos Roxana Yassiri de ocho años y Axel  T. de seis años.

  Ella se dedica a su hogar y a su tienda de abarrotes (kendra) desde hace tres años el cual comenta que le ha ido bien desde que inicio con esta actividad en donde vende Frijol, azúcar, aceite entre otros productos más. Y es la que la ha ayudado a cubrir sus gastos de su hogar.  

  Lo que lo motivo a realizar esta actividad fueron sus hijos quienes le dieron el dinero para que pusiera este negocio en donde ella se pudiera ayudar y salir adelante ya que no tiene de quien depender y con este trabajo lo está logrando.

  Con las ganancias que obtiene de su tienda de abarrotes compra más mercancía para volver a surtirla  y este siempre en buena presentación  y su clientela se sienta bien atendida por ella ya que su tienda es  muy popular y la prefieren porque está en buen sitio de la comunidad.

    Comenta que su sueño es que su negocio se valla incrementado día con día para poder ahorrar y comenzar a construir un cuarto para su nieta y también como también apoyarlos en su educación y hasta que dios le preste vida seguirá dándoles les todo su apoyo. 

     Magdai formo parte del grupo por una invitación que le hizo su hija la señora rosa lidia,  quien es la  representante  del grupo, el grupo se llama girasol la razón del  nombre es porque en el patio de su casa hay matas de esa flor.

 Las personas que integra el grupo girasol son la siguiente: 
  Magdai Sánchez M.: se dedica a   su negocio de abarrotes y solicito el préstamo para comprar más mercancía.
  Yolanda E. Juárez: se dedica a la venta de tamales y solicito el préstamo para comprar ingredientes como son: la carne, masa, chile, pasas entre otro ingredientes mas.
  Rosa lidia Hernández Sánchez: compra pollos de rancho, para venderlo en la misma región.
 Ilse E. Juárez: se dedica a la venta de tamales y solicito el préstamo para comprar lo ingredientes como son: la hoja de guineo, carne, masa, chile ancho, pasas entre otros.
 Yareny T. S.: utilizara el préstamo para la compra de catálogos de avon y llafra.
texts.en:
Señora Magdai Sánchez M. is fifty-four years old and lives in Ángel Alvino Corzo in the municipality of Copainala, which is in the state of Chiapas, México. She had five children, each of whom now lives in their own home. She has custody of two of her grandchildren, Roxana Yassiri, who is eight years old, and Axel T., who is six years old. She is dedicated to her home and to her grocer's shop (Kendra), which she has had for three years, showing that the business has been successful since it opened. In her small grocery she sells beans, sugar and oil, among other products. Her grocery is what has helped her to cover her household expenses. Since she didn't have anyone else to support her, Magdai's children motivated her to open the business by giving her the start-up money. They wanted her to be able to support herself and to get ahead. With this work, she has been able to do just that. With the profits that she earns from her grocer's shop, she purchases additional merchandise to re-stock the store. Her store always has a professional presentation, and her customers feel well cared for by her. Her store is very popular and preferred because she has a good spot in the community. She says that her dream is for her business to continue to grow day by day so that she can save some money to start construction on a room for her granddaughter. She also wants to support her grandchildren in their education and, for as long as god grants her life, to keep giving them all her support. Magdai became a member of the group through an invitation from her daughter, Señora Rosa Lidia, who is the group representative. The group is named "Girasol" (Sunflower) because on the patio of their house there are lots of sunflower plants. The people who make up the Girsol group are the following: Magdai Sánchez M.: she makes her living with a grocery business and requested the loan to purchase additional merchandise. Yolanda E. Juárez: she makes her living selling tamales (a local dish) and requested the loan to purchase ingredients such as meat, dough, chili peppers and raisins, among other items. Rosa Lidia Hernández Sánchez: she purchases chickens from ranches to re-sell in the same area. Ilse E. Juárez: she makes her living selling tamales (a local dish) and requested the loan to purchase ingredients such as guineo leaves (from a local plant), meat, dough, ancho chilies and raisins, among other items. Yareny T. S.: she will use the loan to purchase Avon and Jafra beauty catalogs.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery, such as sugar, beans, oil, and soap, among other items.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar D. is a 36-year-old landlord and carpenter with a carpentry shop in Miritini, Mombasa. He is married to Mwajumbe, and they have two children. Abubakar has been in the carpentry business for the last two years, and he has been successful. His monthly income is enough to sustain him and his family’s needs.

This will be Abubakar’s second loan from KADET. He would like to add to his stock of timber in his carpentry shop and use the anticipated profit to boost his wife’s business.

In the future Abubakar would like to open up a bigger hardware shop in Mombasa.

loans.use: To add to his stock of timber

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru: Холов Умед проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 27 лет. Женат, детей не имеет. Образование среднее. Клиент занимается торговлей на рынке "Саховат". У него собственная торговая точка, где он продает мужскую одежду и обувь. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Umed H. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 27 years old, married and has no children. He has a secondary education. The client is involved in retail sales at the "Sahovat" market. Umed owns his retail outlet, where he sells men's clothing and shoes. He has a rich experience in this area. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
This is 55 year-old Musu. In 1990, Musu established her firewood and building materials business. She found it to be a sustainable livelihood, allowing her to survive and support her family. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 3,389,600 every month from her business.  

Having already successfully paid back a Kiva loan this month, Musu would like a new loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000 in order to buy firewood and building materials. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 1,016,880.
