As Musu currently resides near the water, flooding of her home and business is a very normal occurrence during the rainy season. In the future, Musu plans to leave her current environment, which is one of the poorest communities in Freetown, and build a home in another community. She thanks you for your support.

She is married and has five children, aged 18, 26, 32, 34, and 39. She currently supports six additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and building materials to offer for sale

loans.name: Berlita

texts.en:
Berlita A. is a married woman who lives in Purok Mauboy, Brgy. Nabulao, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two (2) business ventures:  buying and selling peanuts and farming. Her husband Julieto A., who is 47 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 4 and 25 years old. Berlita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Berlita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to buy more peanuts to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and home repairs. Berlita A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund the operations of buying and selling peanuts

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira U. is 41 years old and resides in Binangonan in the province of Rizal. She lives with her husband and their two dependent children. Elvira has a store in her house where she sells basic necessities and all types of products that people use in their homes. She is requesting a loan so that she can have the funds needed to buy more food products and basic household necessities. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales. 

Elvira’s business is very important because it enables her to provide better financial stability for her family to live in a decent manner. She hopes to provide them with everything necessary to move forward against poverty. 

Elvira dreams of the best for her family: to have an expanded business and a happy family and to provide better education for her two siblings until they find better employment. She has shown herself to be hard-working and strong-minded. She hopes that her business will continue to be more productive and that her family's overall quality of living will continue to improve.

loans.use: to buy more food products and basic household necessities

loans.name: Clemencio Raimundo

texts.pt:
Clemêncio Raimundo A. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique vive maritalmente é pai de um filho de apenas 2 anos. tem 35 anos de idade estudou ate a 10ª classe teve que parar devido ao trabalho que não lhe permitia mais frequentar a Escola, Responsabiliza se pela sua gêmea e seus sobrinhos comprando lhes uniforme e seu respectivo material escolar anualmente. 

Sai de casa dos seus pais quando a sua irmã mais velha é cedida uma casa e pede a ele para cuidar da mesma. No mesmo ano, sua irmã aranja um emprego  no Hotel Libombos pois esta é contabilista daquela reparticão, mas para isso ele tinha que ter no minimo a 10ª classe já concluida, e na altura só tinha a 8ª classe, Volta a estudar. Concluida a 10ª classe começa a trabalhar como recepcionista, cargo que exerce ate hoje. E funcionario permanente trabalha das 7h as 19h auferindo mensalmente um valor de 4.000.00MT, que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar por mês 500.00mt devido a sua obra que esta em acabamento.

Este é o quarto empréstimo de Clemêncio na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, blocos e outros). todos 4 foram no valor de 20.000.00mt para a mesma finalidade. Tem como objectivo ver a sua obra concluida e pedir um novo empréstimo para mobilar a mesma.pos esta ciente que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto pos conta com ajuda da sua esposa que e proprietária de um salão de beleza.
texts.en:
Clemêncio Raimundo A. was born in the Namaacha District, in the Maputo Province, South Mozambique. He is in a common law marriage and is the father of a 2 year old. He is 35 years old. He went to school until the 10th grade and had to drop out because his job no longer allowed him to go to school. He supports his twin sister and his nephews by buying their school uniform and supplies every year.

He left his parents home when his older sister was given a house and asked him to take care of it. That same year his sister found him a job a the Libombos Hotel since she was an accountant there. In order to get that job he needed to at least complete 10th grade and he only had completed 8th grade by then. He went back to school and after finishing 10th grade started working as a receptionist, a position he still holds. He is a permanent employee, works from 7am to 7pm and makes 4,000 meticais. He spends his salary in household expenses and saves 500 meticais due to his finishing construction. 

This loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticais, is Clemêncio's fourth with Hluvuku. He intends to buy construction material (cement, sand, bricks and others). All four loans were for 20,000 meticais and used for the same goal. His goal is to see his construction finished and to request a new loan to furnish his house. He believes he will repay the loan ahead of time since he can count on his wife's help. She owns a beauty salon.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, bricks and others)

loans.name: Magaly Margarita

texts.es:
Magaly de 40 años, es madre soltera con tres hijos ha trabajado desde que se quedo sola con sus hijos. Una de sus amigas le hablo de ser vendedora por catalogo de productos y cosméticos Ebel (compañía que ofrece oportunidades de venta por catalogo). 

Trabaja desde las 08h00am recorriendo las calles de su sector en el suburbio de Guayaquil ya que es una zona urbana ella la recorre ofreciendo los productos a los conocidos de sus vecinos y amigos para tener un ingreso estable y poder mantener a sus hijos. Ofrece perfumes, cosméticos, tratamientos a un valor económicos. Una de sus desventajas para vender los productos son las camitas que hace que le produzca cansancio y concurre a enfermarse rápidamente. 

Ella quiere seguir trabajando y que sus clientes tengan variedad al comprar los productos por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo perfumes, cremas, tratamientos faciales etc. En el  futuro quiere tener una cartera de clientes grande y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Magalay is 40 years old.  She is a single mother and has three children.  She has worked since she was left alone with her children.  One of her friends talked to her about selling Ebel products and cosmetics through catalogs (Ebel is a company that offers opportunities for people to make catalog sales).

Magaly works from 8 o'clock in the morning.  She works in the streets of her district of Guayaquil suburb, which is an urban area.  She offers her products to her neighbors' acquaintances and her friends.  This provides her with a stable income and allows her to support her children.  She offers perfumes, cosmetics and treatments at affordable prices.  One of the disadvantages of selling her products is that she gets tired which contributes to her getting sick quickly.

She would like to continue working and would like her customers to have a wide variety of products to buy.  For this reason, she would like to use her loan to buy perfumes, creams, facial treatments, etc.  In the future, she would like to have a larger customer base and for her children to successfully finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and creams

loans.name: Denis Danilo

texts.es: Denis Danilo se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo por lo que este es su principal fuente de ingresos para ayudar en los gastos de su familia. Este negocio surgió por la necesidad de trabajar, Por los gastos que tiene como Padre para su hijo. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante y en su vivienda ya que este es el único método que le da resultados pues tiene que levantarse todos los días muy temprano para preparar las cosas que ofrecerá a sus clientes. El solicita este financiamiento para comprar vestidos, trajes, camisas, pantalones entre otros y así ofrecer variedad en esta navidad.
texts.en:
Denis Danilo sells used clothing. He has a son in his care and this business is his main source of income to help with the family expenses. This business came about because of the need to work since he has expenses related to being a father to his child. The location of his business is out on the street and in his home. This sales method is the only one that gives him results so he has to wake up early every day to prepare the things he will offer to his customers.

He is requesting this loan to buy dresses, suits, shirts, pants, and other items so that he can offer variety for Christmas.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more clothes

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BENKADI est constitué de 8 femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans,  en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant majoritairement  dans des  familles monogames à  KABOILA I, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali).
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’habits, de pagnes et de chaussures à l’image de AWA K..
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 90 paires de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Sikasso et  de Bamako (capitale du Mali). 
Les chaussures s sont vendues au  grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The group name is Benkadi and it is made up of 8 women who are all married and are 36 years old on average. They have 2 children each and they majority of them live in monogamous families in Kaboila I, a quarter in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They seek their third loan cycle with the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) in order to meet client demand. This group of women is involved in the sale of garments, cloth wraps, and Awa K. brand shoes. 

With her loan they will purchase 90 pairs of shoes. She purchases her merchandise in the large market in Sikasso and in Bamako (capital city of Mali). 

The shoes are resold in the large market in Sikasso and to their families. The clientele is made up of both men and women and sales are completed in cash.

Her monthly earnings are forecasted to be 45 FCFA, a part of which will be used to support her husband in taking care of the family's daily expenses. A part will also be reinvested back into the business. 

Her ambition is to expand her business in order to better satisfy her clientele.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer P. is from the town of Panglao. She is 33 years old. Jennifer is married and has 4 children who are age 3, 5, 7, and 8. She is a dried fish dealer. Her husband helps her deliver fish using their tricycle. When they are done with all of the deliveries, her husband transports people around their community to earn an extra income.

Jennifer joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Orlanda

texts.es:
Orlanda pertenece al Banco comunal “Vida Nueva”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Longaví. Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa de todo tipo: vestidos, poleras y pantalones. Orlanda trabaja en el rubro desde hace 30 años.
En temporadas de colegio tiene 5 clientes frecuentes en los que destaca colegios y Jardines Infantiles, para los que  confecciona uniformes escolares. En Fiestas Patrias (Fiesta costumbrista de Chile), confecciona ropa de huaso y huasa, en la cual se destaca la confección de vestidos floreados, faldas, blusas, en la mujer y camisa, pantalón y chaqueta en el hombre. Durante esta fecha sus principales clientes son  a los mismos colegios y particulares.
Orlanda compra sus materiales en la ciudad de Linares y en Santiago, su material de trabajo es principalmente telas e hilos. 
Su casa es su lugar de trabajo, a la cual recurren todos sus clientes en diferentes temporadas del año. Cuenta con la ayuda de su hija para realizar sus confecciones.
Con este préstamo, pretende comprar telas, botones, cierres e hilos, para aumentar la producción y generar más clientela e ingresos.
Su sueño es aumentar su producción y agrandar el negocio. 
Para Orlanda la ayuda de Fondo Esperanza ha sido fundamental en su negocio, ya que le ha permitido financiar y organizar su negocio. 
Longaví es una comuna de la región del Maule, zona central de Chile. Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa “cabeza de serpiente”. Es una comuna eminentemente rural, agrícola, emplazada entre montañas, precordillera  y cordillera, de gran belleza natural, siendo su punto más alto el cerro Nevados de Longaví, con 3.242 metros de altitud.
texts.en:
Orlanda belongs to the Communal Bank “Vida Nueva” (New Life), which is in the city of Longaví. She produces clothes of all types such as dresses, shirts, and trousers. Orlanda has performed this type of work for thirty years.

During the school year, she has five regular customers consisting of high schools and nursery schools for which she produces school uniforms. For the patron saint festivals (those held in Chile include costume parties), Orlanda makes cowboy and cowgirl outfits. These include floral dresses, skirts, and blouses for women, and trousers and jackets for men. During the rest of the year, her main customers are these same schools and individuals.

Orlanda buys her materials in the cities of Linares and Santiago. The supplies she uses for her work are primarily fabrics and thread. She performs her work at home. Her customers rely on her at various times throughout the year. With the help of her daughter, she is able to complete her work. Orlanda will use this loan to buy fabrics, buttons, zippers, and thread to increase her production, attract more customers, and generate more income.

Her dream is to increase production and expand her business. For Orlanda, the assistance from Fondo Esperanza has been essential in helping her to finance and organize her business.

Longaví is a commune in the region of Maule in central Chile. Its name in the Mapuche language means “head of the serpent”. This is predominantly a rural farming area situated in the foothills between two mountains of great natural beauty. The highest point of Longaví is the snowy peak that stands 3,242 meters above sea level.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, buttons, zippers, and thread

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maruja; la socia tiene 40 años es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de restaurante ella brinda el servicio de almuerzo y cena la socia trabaja de lunes a sábado el restaurante se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa , la socia lleva años en este negocio del cual le trae muchas satisfacciones ya que le permite estar más tiempo con su familia esto es algo que le agrada bastante y desea continuar así la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas insumos como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maruja, 40, is a member of the “RICHARY ANTEÑA” communal bank located in Anta district which belongs to Anta province, Cusco department.

She has a spouse and four children.  She alternates her daily chores with running a restaurant; she cooks lunches and dinners, Monday through Saturday.  The restaurant is located in her home.  She’s been in business for years and it gives her much satisfaction because it allows her time to be with her family, something she enjoys very much.  She wants to continue like this.  She is a very cheerful person with much desire to get ahead.

She is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like: rice, sugar, milk, noodles and oil, among others.

She is happy because of the loan and commits to repay her installments.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients like: rice, sugar, milk, noodles and oil, among others.

loans.name: Mary Mwihaki

texts.en:
Mary has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 20 years.  She is 53 years old, married to John M., and they have five children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be her third loan. She paid for her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Mary hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan, 50, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia.  Her husband works as a carpenter and her two younger daughters attend college.  They have a decent standard of living.  

They used to live in the countryside and they came to live in the city when they lost all of their livestock because of a natural disaster in 1999. Then Jargalsaihan began selling wooden products made by her husband by renting a container at a local market in 2004.  She started selling used shoes in 2010 in addition to the wooden products.  Her further wish is to expand her business and increase her working capital in the future. 

She is a hardworking and sociable person who says, " We want to finish our house that is being built at the moment.  I wish to have my own place where I can operate my business in the future so that I can save money on rent".  She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more used shoes and wood materials for her family based business.

loans.use: To purchase more used shoes

loans.name: Sinuern

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinuern S. is 50 years old and her husband, Mr. Sokea Sue, is 49 years old (pictured together). They have been married since 1984 and have three children – two sons and one young daughter. One of the children is a construction worker, one is a garment factory worker and the other attends school. The family lives along National Road Number 2, approximately 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.
Sinuern is a farmer while her husband is a taxi driver. Unhappily, a part of his van is old and does not work well. This has upset his business. Therefore, Sinuern is asking for a loan of $1,200 to help her husband to repair the van and change the broken part.

loans.use: to repair her husband's van and change the broken part

loans.name: Ana Regina

texts.es:
Ana Regina  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Victor echave”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene cuatro hijos (2 independientes). Cuenta con estudios de educación secundaria.
La señora se dedica a la venta de artículos artesanales  y a la venta de comidas, trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de artesanías.
Ana solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de  S/1300.00 nuevo soles, con éste dinero comprará 4 kilos de lana para la fabricación de chompas y chalecos.
Trabaja sola en su negocio, su esposo trabaja en la mina.
Su sueño es abrir una tienda de abarrotes donde pueda ofrecer muchos productos de primera necesidad.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad
texts.en: Ana Regina is a member of the "Victor Echave" Communal Bank, located in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 56 years old and married by common-law with four children, two of whom are living on their own. She has a high school education. She works selling handicrafts as well as food. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for one year. Her first loan was for 300 nuevo soles, which she invested in her handicrafts business. Ana is applying for a new loan for 1,300 nuevo soles with which she plans to buy four kilos of yarn in order to make sweaters and vests. She is the only one who works for her business. Her husband works in mining. Her dream is to open a grocery store where she can sell basic necessities. What Ana likes about the communal bank are the meetings, the punctuality, and the responsibility involved.

loans.use: to by 4 kilos of yarn for making sweaters and vests.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre soltero de 32 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de agua y luz. Su casa está ubicada en el caserío Alfredo Vilca  Aguilar a unos 15 minutos de  Tambogrande  y a 30 minutos del  departamento de  Piura.  Esta zona rural se dedica ha la actividad agricola,  ganadera y turismo.

Jaime se dedica ha manejar su mototaxi (transporte utilizado por las personas en rutas pequeñas), cubriendo la ruta que va desde su caserío a Tambogrande y visceversa .  Jaime tiene su propia clientela e incluso lo contratan para llevar a niños en edad escolar por lo mismo que vive en el mismo lugar, ésto le permite tener mayores ingresos para poder ayudar  de algún modo a sus padres a solventar los gastos diarios. Otra actividad que realiza es la crianza de animales.

A solicitado un préstamo ha Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su mototaxi, ya que lo utiliza diariamente mañana y tarde y por ser un camino accidentado necesita realizar algunos cambios de respuestos, permitiendole garantizar un mejor servicio y obtenga a largo plazo mejores ingresos.

Jaime es muy cocnocido en el caserío Alfredo Vilca Aguilar por ser un joven de confianza, muy respetuoso y responsable con su clientes que utilizan sus transporte, con el objetivo de seguir mejorando en la vida.
texts.en:
Jaime, 32, is single living in his parents’ house which only has electricity and water.  His house is located in the Alfredo Vilca Aguilar hamlet about 15 minutes from Tambogrande and 30 minutes from Piura Department.  This rural area is devoted to farming, raising cattle and tourism.

Jaime drives a mototaxi (transportation vehicle used by people for short routes) covering the route that goes from his hamlet to Tambogrande and vice versa.  Jaime has his own established clientele that even hire him to take their children to school because he lives in the same place as them.  This allows him to have higher income to somehow help his parents meet daily expenses.  Another activity he undertakes is raising animals.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to service his mototaxi because he uses it daily morning and afternoon.  Because the roads are in poor shape he needs to replace some parts to guarantee better service and continue earning income in the long run.

Jaime is very well known in Alfredo Vilca Aguilar hamlet for being a trustworthy, very respectful and responsible young man toward the customers who use his transport with the goal of continuing to improve his life.

loans.use: to service his mototaxi.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia y tiene dos hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad, ella vende pan todas las tardes en los caseríos cercanos, es una mujer muy trabajadora y comprometida con el bienestar de sus hijos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina, huevos y leña, además de otros insumos que son necesarios para elaborar el pan, este préstamo le será muy útil pues no dispone de muchos materiales y espera solventar la situación.
Su sueño es que sus hijos crezcan y darles el estudio, que tengan un hogar estable y velar por sus necesidades.
texts.en:
María lives with her family. She is the mother of two children, aged 4 and 6. She sells bread in the nearby villages every afternoon. She is a hard-working woman and committed to the well-being of her children.

She applies for a loan to buy flour, eggs, firewood and some other ingredients that are needed to make bread. The loan will be very useful to her because she is about to run out of ingredients and she hopes to be able to resolve her situation.

Her dream is to see her children grow up and get a proper education and that she can provide them with a stable home and look after their needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs and firewood for her bakery.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has one child.

Ali has a shop selling used and new auto parts since 2007. He is experienced in this field, has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

 He is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred, a 32-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines where for the past three years she has operated a mini grocery shop that sells canned goods, food in pouches, food ingredients, school supplies, and refreshments. She earns a monthly income of PHP 6,000.00.

A new member of GDMPC, Mildred is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from GDMPC to purchase store stock to sell. She hopes to someday have a large grocery shop in their town.

loans.use: to purchase store stock to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 42 years old.   She is married and has nine children between 2 and 21 years old. Her bananas vending business is well-organized. Esther has 6 years of experience in her business and works from 6 am until 6 pm every day except on the weekends. She currently employs four people to help her.

Esther has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more bananas to sell.  With any profit generated, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: buy bananas

loans.name: Darou Ndiaye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Darou N. est créé le 14 mai 2010, il est composé de femmes venant de différents quartiers de la ville mais sont unies par affinité, amitié et par confiance; elles s'activent dans diverses activités telles que le petit commerce, la couture, la coiffure et l'élevage.


Madame Gnagna est âgée de 44 ans, mariée elle est mère de sept enfants, elle s'active dans la vente de légumes et capitalise une bonne expérience de plusieurs années. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite tout près de la table et habillée en boubou noir.


Elle s'approvisionne et vend ses légumes( choux, carottes,navets, aubergines, gombos....) au marché central de la ville.


Son prêt lui permettra d'augmenter et de varier ses légumes afin d’attirer plus la clientèle et ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus.

Avec les bénéfices obtenus Gnagna appui son mari pour la nourriture et la santé  de la famille; elle renforce aussi son épargne et gère ses petits besoins.
texts.en:
Solidarity group "Darou N." was established on May 14, 2010. It is composed of women coming from different parts of the city, but linked by affinity,  friendship, and trust. They run various small businesses, such as : retail, sewing,  hairdressing and breeding.

Gnagna, age 44, is married and the mother of seven children. She sells vegetables and has several years of experience. In the photograph, she's standing on the right next to the table, dressed in a black boubou.

She gets her supplies and sells her vegetables (cabbage, carrots, turnips, eggplants, okra, …) at the central market of the town. Her loan will enable her to increase the quantity and the number of varieties of the vegetables she sells, in order to be more attractive to customers and make a high income.

With her profits, Gnagna will help her husband with the family's food and healthcare expenses. She will also strengthen her savings and provide for her small needs.

loans.use: to buy and resell vegetables

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 30-years-old Mariatu. She is married to a petty trader and has three children age 4, 7 and 12 years. 

In 1996, Mariatu established her business in used clothing: underwear, dresses, trousers and skirts. She began her business because she decided to marry after the war when things were very hard for her parents.  

Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Mariatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now she requires a new loan in order to pay for four bales of dresses at SLL 450,000, two bales of skirts at SLL 600,000 and two bales of trousers at SLL 500,000 and three bales of underwear at SLL 300,000.  

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 200,000. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to educate her children to college level and visit the holy land, Mecca, some day. 

She is well known because of the type of items she is selling, which are in high demand. Mariatu is hard-working and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for four bales of dresses at SLL 450,000, two bales of skirts at SLL 600,000 and two bales of trousers at SLL 500,000 and three bales of underwear at SLL 300,000.

loans.name: Julian

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old businesswoman Julian, a married mother of two children aged 13 and 6 years. She also has two additional dependents living with her because she wants to assist them with their education.

In 2003, Julian established her slippers and sandals business in order to become productive in the home. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month. Now requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy more plastic slippers and sandals, she hopes the loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.

In the future, Julian plans to build a store to help her husband educate their children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic silppers and sandals for her business.

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: Mr. Seak, 26 years old, lives in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He is married to Ngen and has no children. Currently, he has a business selling soybean near one market and around his community. With his smile and very good friendliness, he sells well every day. He can earn around $3 per day. He is a hardworking husband, supporting his family's daily needs. To improve his family's living conditions, Mr. Seak would like to request some funds from Kiva's partner HKL in order to purchase more soybean. He says that this loan will increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase more soybean.

loans.name: Kalima's Group

texts.en:
Kalima, 41, is the leader of this group. Together with her husband, who works in a ferro-concrete factory, she brings up a daughter and a son. Their daughter is in school but their son doesn't yet attend as he is pre-school age (under seven). Kalima works in a textile factory. Two years ago, she saved 10,000 soms and, with that money, she and her husband started to breed livestock. Kalima applied for this loan as she needs additional money to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, she dreams to purchase a big house for her family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for breeding.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Celestina works hard to support her family.

She has a business making coconut charcoal in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Celestina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy coconut shells for her coconut charcoal making business.

Celestina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of providing a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy coconut shells to make charcoal

loans.name: Gioconda Isabel

texts.es: Gioconda tiene 23 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo es trabajador independiente. Ella se dedica a la venta cosméticos, los préstamos le sirven para comprar su mercadería y seguir ampliando cada día más su negocio.Con su nuevo préstamo comprara ropa interior para caballeros y damas, tratamientos, body, cremas, perfumes, polvos, lápiz labial, brillos, entre otros.Nos cuenta que el negocio le está dando muchas satisfacciones, está viendo el fruto de su trabajo y se siente feliz porque puede ayudar a sus hijos cuando ellos lo necesitan, su esposo también aporta para los gastos básicos del hogar, espera seguir trabajando con créditos.
texts.en:
Gioconda, 23, is married and has two children.  Her husband works for himself.  She sells cosmetics and the loans help her buy her merchandise and continue expanding her business more every day.  She will use the new loan to buy underwear for men and women, hair treatments, conditioners,  creams, perfumes, powders, lipsticks, nail polish, and more.  She tells us that she gets a lot of satisfaction from her business and she is seeing the fruit of her labor.  She feels happy because she can help her children when they need it, and she also helps her husband pay the basic household expenses.
She hopes to continuing working with the financing.

loans.use: to buy underwear for men and women, body treatments, creams, perfumes, powders, lipsticks, eye shadow, and more.

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.ru: Зулфинисо вдова и она мать 5 детей. Она в молодости потеряла своего мужа, и вырастили своих детей сама. Сейчас все ее дети совершеннолетние и имеют свою семью. Несмотря на свой не молодой возраст она занимается переаботкой, сушкой абрикосов и торговлей сухофруктов. Зимой она продает шерстяные платки. Займ хочет получить для закупа сухофруктов и перепродажи их зимой.
texts.en: Zulfiniso is a widow and a mother of five children.  She lost her husband when she was young and raised her children on her own.  Currently, all of the children are adults and have their own families.  Despite her respectable age, Zulfiniso is involved in processing and drying of apricots and sales of dried fruits.  She sells wool scarves in the winter.  Zulfiniso wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of dried fruits and sales of them in the winter.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Begmuhamad

texts.ru: Бегмухамад женат, имеет четверых детей. На содержании у него его родители. Он старается в достатке содержать своих родителей и семью. Для этого требуется огромный труд. Бегмухамад  вместе с сестрой занимается продажей искусственных цветов и детских игрушек. Весь товар он закупает оптом у оптовиков. Искусственные цветы очень востребованы так, как в настоящее время все уделяют внимание декоративному оформлению своих домов, а игрушки всегда нужны. Он хочет получить займ на оптовую покупку товара к наступлению праздников. На  праздниках можно получить хорошую выручку. Он надеется получить займ. Заранее благодарен.
texts.en: Begmuhamad is married and has four children.  He also supports his parents.  He tries provide well for his parents and family, but this requires an enormous amount of work.  Begmuhamad and his sister are involved in selling artificial flowers and children's toys.  He buys all of the merchandise at wholesale prices from wholesale dealers.  Artificial flowers are in high demand because currently, everyone pays attention to home decoration, and toys are also always needed.  Begmuhamad wants to obtain a loan for a wholesale purchase of merchandise in anticipation of upcoming holidays.  He can make a good profit during holidays.  Begmuhamad hopes to get this loan and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the holidays

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
La educación es la base principal para el desarrollo de un país y es por este motivo que hoy en día se requieren maestros muy capaces y con altos conocimientos en la materia. Consciente de esto,  la señora Marlene se dedica a laborar como maestra en el municipio de Telica atendiendo niños de varias edades y cuya preocupación principal es la educación en estas personas ya que son el futuro de la nación.

Ella acude a Ceprodel porque requiere solicitar un crédito para el mejoramiento de su vivienda y para ello comprará cerámica, cemento y pago de mano de obra. Cabe señalar que Ceprodel se ha caracterizado por apoyar a estos maestros que sin duda contribuyen al desarrollo de los pequeños.
texts.en:
Education is the mainstay of a country’s development and this is why competent, well trained teachers are required today.  Conscious of this, Marlene works as a teacher in the town of Telica teaching children of various ages.  Her main concern is the education of these people who are the nation’s future.

She calls on Ceprodel to request a home improvement loan to buy tile and cement and to pay labor costs.  It’s worth pointing out that Ceprodel has stood out for supporting teachers who without a doubt contribute to the development of these little ones.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Abd Almahdi

texts.en:
Abd Almahdi is a 28-year-old hardworking single man who lives with the rest of his family of 10 members.

Abd Almahdi recently bought coffee making equipment to make Turkish and Arabic coffee and started to make coffee at home, filling it in special containers and distributing it to the coffee shops in the area.

Because he is now getting a lot of requests from new coffee shops, he has applied for a loan in order to buy more equipment and ingredients to make more coffee and sell it to new shops and in that way, expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more equipment and ingredients to make more coffee for distribution.

loans.name: Digna Petita

texts.es:
Digna de 55 años, con la ayuda de Dios empezó con su negocio algunos años atrás (tienda de viveres), con el cual mantiene a sus hijos porque su ex esposo no se encuentra con ella y no ayudaba con los gastos de la casa. Realiza su trabaja todos los días sola de 8 de la mañana hasta las 10de la noche.

Su dificultad es que vive en un cerro y el sector es muy peligroso debido a la delincuencia. No está casada y tiene hijos pero son todos mayores. Con el prestamo quiere comprar viveres como bebidas, arroz, azucar. 

Su meta alcanzar es poner un comedor en su casa.
texts.en:
Digna, 55, with God’s help started her business a few years ago (grocery store) that she uses to support her children since her ex-husband is no longer with her and did not help her with household expenses.  She works alone every day from 8am until 10pm.

Her difficulty is that she lives on a hill and the sector is very dangerous due to crime.  She’s not married and has children but they are all adults.  She will use the loan to buy groceries like beverages, rice and sugar.  Her goal is to manage to open an eatery at home.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Earnest

texts.en:
Earnest, who is 36, has shown that devotion, steadfastness and sedulous work can bring many dividends in business. Plying his Irish potato farming trade for the last two years been a very worthwhile experience for him. Irish Potatoes are increasing becoming a staple food in most Ugandan households, and they sell very well in most food markets, not only in Kyenjojo but in the central region too, where Earnest intends to expand his market.

Earnest, who is single but plans to get married, has a weekly sales revenue of UGX 40,000, and also derives income from a barber shop. He says that the Kiva loan he is requesting will help finance the purchase of more germinating Irish potato seedlings to grow.

loans.use: to purchase more germinating Irish potato seedlings to grow.

loans.name: Carmen Olga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Olga; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de maíz, la socia vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, la socia quiere terminar de construir su casa, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como arena, yeso y arena para terminar de construir su casa.   
                                          
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmen Olga, 39, is a member of the “Sayhua 3” communal bank that’s located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.  

She is married and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business buying and selling corn.  She sells in Urubamba’s market from 7am until 4pm.  She wants to finish building her house. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell corn.  She’s asking for the loan to buy building materials and supplies like sand, plaster and sand to finish building her house.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TINKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teodora; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de preparación y venta de tortas, galletas y postres, ella los días sábados y domingos vende las tortas en la plaza tupac amaru y los días de semana trabaja a pedido de personas en general, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las tortas, galletas y postres. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, mantequilla, azúcar y bandejas para implementar su negocio de venta de tortas. 


 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Tinka.” The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Teodora. She is 42 years old, has a partner, and 4 children.

The member alternates her daily activities. She has a business making and selling pastries, cookies and deserts. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells the pasties in the Plaza Tupac Amaru and during the weekdays she works selling through requests to people in general. Through her work the member supports her children. Her dream is to have a facility where she can sell the pastries, cookies and desserts. 

The member is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies such as flour, butter, sugar and trays in order to supply her business of selling pastries.

The member is happy for the loan and she promises to comply with the agreed terms.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, butter, sugar, and trays to use in her pastry business

loans.name: Abakorerahamwe Group

texts.en: ABISHYIZEHAMWE is a group led by Melanie who is 41 years old. The group name means “Alliance” in English. She is married with five children aged 9 and 17 years, they all go to school. She has a shop and has been doing in a business for the past 6 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, Irish potatoes and soda for sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, Irish potatoes and soda for sell.

loans.name: Deysi Araceli Rivera

texts.en: For 4 years my business has sold paper and office supplies. I decided to become independent and run my own business in order to cover family expenses. I have a good location and the preference of clients who can find a complete assortment of paper and supplies. For this school year I want to sell more school supplies and for this I need the loan to provide a complete assortment.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, pencils, markers, printer ink, printer paper and posterboard.

loans.name: Nassouvi

texts.en:
Mrs Nassouvi D. is the mother of seven (7) children. Her husband, a grower by profession, doesn't have a fixed salary that would allow him to cover all the needs of the family. The high number of children constitutes a large burden that is overwhelming Mrs. D. and her husband. To withstand the burden, she works without letup selling palm kernels. Despite the fact that it is difficult work, she gives it her all so she can help her husband support the children. Despite all her determination, she has not yet been able to get the family out of its precarious situation. Mrs D. is looking for a loan of $750, that will allow her to increase her stock so she can respond to the demands of her clientele. This business provides an income that improves the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Nassouvi est mère d’une famille de sept (7) enfants. Son mari, cultivateur de profession, ne dispose pas d’un revenu fixe qui lui permette de prendre en charge les besoins de la famille. Le nombre élevé des enfants constitue un poids important qui écrase Madame D. et son mari. Pour pouvoir supporter ce poids, elle travaille sans relâche dans la vente des palmistes. Malgré que ce soit un travail très difficile, elle s’y donne entièrement afin d’aider son mari à supporter les enfants. Mais malgré toute cette détermination, elle n’est pas encore parvenue à sortir de la précarité. Madame D. sollicite un apport financier de $750 qui lui permettra d’augmenter son stock afin de répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle. De ce commerce sortira un bénéfice qui améliorera les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Storage and sale of palm kernels

loans.name: Akporuru

texts.en: Akporuru E. lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. She is 35 years old and married with three children. She started her business in the year 2004. She needs the loan for her business expansion.

loans.use: To improve on her business

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta was born and raised in her small community of Los Botados. She is the proud mother of two children who are 21 and 9 years old. She is a hard-working woman. Before starting her present business, she used to make "quipes" (deep fried bulgur roll) and "pastelitos" (meat or chicken turnovers). Fifteen years ago she started the present day business, a "colmado" (mini-market or grocery store). Now she plans on using this loan to increase her supplies, especially chilled refreshments, without which she fears losing sales during heightened weekend demand.

loans.use: To increase supplies/inventory

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: Osman S. is thirty eight years old and married with three children. He has a small general store and his business is the sole source of income for the family.  He is requesting a loan of $200 to increase his stock.  Osman plans to expand into wholesale where he would supply the retailers in small shops with a few select items.

loans.use: Expansion and diversification of his general store

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Maria del Carmen is a 42 year old single mother with one son who sells flowers and vegetables near her home and three times a week she travels to the city to sell her products. She belongs to the group named Niño de Atocha 1 together with doña Gloria Eloyna Hernández Torres, who manufactures bride gowns and accessories, and doña Rutila Vásquez González who sells chicken. With the loan they will buy products to increase their stock and make sales go up.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA DEL CARMEN ,es madre soltera , tiene 42 años y un hijo , se dedica a la venta de flores y verduras en colonias cercanas a su domicilio y viaja tres veces a la semana a vender sus productos a la ciudad . Pertenece al grupo Niño de Atocha 1 junto con doña Gloria Eloyna Hernández Torres (confecciona vestidos e implementos de novias)y doña Rutila Vásquez González (venta de pollos trozados).Con su préstamo invertirán en comprar productos para incrementar las ventas al tener un mayor stock.

loans.use: Sale of flowers, vegetables, poultry, bride gowns and accessories

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Luu Thi D. is 43 years old. She lives in Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa with her husband and three children. All the children are at school ages therefore her family expenses are rather high. Her husband, Mr. Le Van Oanh, is a farm worker (he ploughs fields). She raises pigs at home to make ends meet. Their family income is around $180 USD/month. This time she requests a loan of $375 to buy more pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, a Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lưu Thị D., 43 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Cả 3 cháu đều đang trong độ tuổi ăn học cho nên chi phí trong gia đình rất lớn. Anh Lê Văn Oanh, chồng chị, đi cày thuê để kiếm tiền trong khi đó chị ở nhà chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình hiện nay khoảng 180USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 375 để mua thêm lợn về chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy pigs.

loans.name: Zahi

texts.en: Zahi is a 32-year-old man who lives and works in the region of Saida, in south Lebanon. Zahi repairs and sells motorcycles. Zahi is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy motorcycle parts to develop his business. He is planning to insure a decent living for himself and his future family

loans.use: To buy motorcycle parts

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: T. Dilbar lives in Spitamen. She is married and has 3 children. She has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006. Mrs. T. Dilbar started her business practically from scratch and now she has her own shop selling food products (wholesale and retail sales of drinks, sweeties, pastries, milk-sour products, meat products, oil, flour products, etc). Now Mrs. T. Dilbar requests a loan of $1200 to increase the range of assortment and business development.

loans.use: To increase range of assortment and business development

loans.name: Hosptial East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rebecca N.. She is currently in the business of maize milling and is requesting a loan to purchase more maize. Rebecca is 23 years old and is single. Each week, Rebecca makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more maize to make flour. Rebecca has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add in maize milling business and the loan was paid back on time.

Rebecca is joined in her small group by Lydia M. and Margret B.. Lydia M. has a business in beauty salon and wants to buy more salon equipment like oils, and braids. Margret B. is currently operating a business in charcoal selling and wants a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To boost maize milling business

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Señora Asunción belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres de Grandes Retos" (Women of Grand Challenges). She makes a living by selling food at the entrance of the central market of Huaraz, in the department of Ancash.

With this loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy: 6 bags of sugar, 3 bags of oatmeal, 40 kilograms of quinua, and 2 packages of eggs.

She is 53-years-old, is a window, and has 3 children. She works so she can educate her children, who are in school.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Asunción, pertenece al Banco Comunal de Mujeres de Grandes Retos, se dedica a la venta de alimentos , en la entrada del mercado central de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, 6 sacos de azúcar, 3 bolsas de quaker, 40 kilos de quinua, 2 paquetes de huevo.

Ella tiene 53 años de edad, es viuda, tiene 3 hijos, ella trabaja para educar a sus tres hijos que están estudiando

loans.use: With the loan, she will purchase quinua, eggs, sugar, etc., for her business

loans.name: Marielos

texts.es:
Marielos is requesting a loan in order to invest it in the improvement of her house, located in the municipality of Nueva Guinea.  This is an area in which, despite being a productive region, the salaries provided to the teachers are very low.   Marielos has been a high school teacher for 18 years.  Marielos is also a small businesswoman that sells cosmetics in the afternoon. 

It's important to mention that Marielos, with the previous loans provided by AFODENIC, has improved her home to a great extent and has improved the life of her 3 children.  The oldest daughter is 16 years old and is currently in her 4th year of secondary school, her 2nd son is 8 years old and is studying in the 2nd grade of primary education and her youngest son is 2 years old.  Her husband works for a company marketing roots and tubers(plant) and with this loan they want to repair the roof over the kitchen that is in bad shape and finish building some bathrooms.  Marielos is a woman that dreams about a better future and that her children have the basics in economic terms as well as their studies. 

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

Marielos está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, habita en el municipio de Nueva Guinea, este es un municipio que a pesar de ser una zona productiva los salarios que devengan los maestros es muy poco,  es docente de educación secundaria  desde hace 18 años. Marielos es también una pequeña comerciante, que por las tardes se dedica a vender cosméticos.

Es importante mencionar que Marielos con los créditos anteriores otorgados por AFODENIC a mejorado su vivienda en gran medida y ha mejorado la condicion de vida de sus 3 hijos, la hija mayor tiene 16 años actualmente esta cursando 4to año de secundaria, el otro niño tiene 8 años de edad estudia 2do grado de educación primaria y el niño menor de 2 años. Su esposo trabaja para una empresa comercializadora de raíces y tubérculos, con este préstamo pretende cambiar el techo de la cocina que se encuentra en mal estado y terminar de construir los servicios higiénicos. Marielos es una mujer que sueña con tener un porvenir mejor y que sus hijos tengan siempre lo básico tanto en lo económico como en sus estudios.

loans.use: To change the roof of her house and finish building bathrooms

loans.name: Lan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lan Thi N. is 39 years old with two school-aged children. She joined the Fund in 2007. Her husband is a busy village official and does not have time to help her with the house chores; she alone takes care of the homestead. Outside of house work, she takes care of the family farm, which has over 100 pigs and 600 ducks. The farm is her main source of income. Every month, she averages around 300USD in income. This time around, she requests a loan of 825USD to buy more feed for her flock of ducks and drove of pigs. Her farming model has been emulated and put into practice by many people in the community.

Translated from Vietnamese by Trinh Quoc N., Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lan, 39 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2007. Chị có 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Chồng chị là một cán bộ xã có ít thời gian chăm lo việc nhà, một mình chị Lan quán xuyến mọi việc. Ngoài việc chăm sóc trang trại lợn với hơn 100 con chị còn nuôi thêm 600 vịt đẻ lấy thu nhập hàng ngày. Mỗi tháng bình quân chị Lan thu 300USD. Vòng vốn này chị Lan xin vay 825USD để mua thêm thức ăn cho đàn vịt và lợn của mình. Mô hình chăn nuôi của chị đang được nhiều người áp dụng và học tập.

loans.use: Buy food for pigs, ducks

loans.name: Samrit

texts.en:
Samrit M. is 49 years old, married and lives in Kampong Cham province with her husband and four children. She and her husband are farmers, and make about $2 a day. They are supported by two of their children, who work in garment factories. The weather has been difficult for farming in Cambodia over the last year, and inflation has caused prices to soar. These factors have have made life difficult for many Cambodians.

Samrit M. has applied for a $700 loan to buy a new tractor to replace her old one, which breaks down frequently and uses a lot of gas. A new tractor will mean lower expenses and a higher standard of living for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy a new tractor.

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr:
Mr. Konaté is a native of Thies, born in 1962. He is married and lives with his wife in the Lamy district of the city. His main business is the manufacture of postcards, which he sells to local bookstores and shops in Dakar. At the same time, he creates works of art which he sells during tourist season. With this loan he wants to increase his working capital.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr Konaté est un natif de Thies en 1962. Il est marié et vit avec sa femme au quartier cité lamy. Sa principale activité consiste à fabriquer des cartes postales qu'il vend aux librairies de la place ou à Dakar. En meme temps il fait des tableaux d'art qu'il vend pendant la saison touristique. Avec ce pret il veut renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Making of postcards

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria started her business when she became unemployed. She needed to earn an income to help her husband cover the costs of keeping their home and providing education for their children. In January of 2004, some friends invited Gloria to sell natural products. She accepted, as this type of business allowed her to spend more time with her children, something that is very difficult to do when working for someone else. In the first two weeks Gloria had excellent results, and with her husband's support she's now in contact with several clients. Gloria become the director of her zone, the second award that her business has won. She is now in charge of 20 distributors.

Gloria needs a loan of $500, which she'll pay back in 6 months. She'll use the funds to stock up on all of the products that her clients need. Gloria wants to continue providing them with good service so that they recommend her to others.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria inició el negocio porque se quedó sin trabajo como empleada de una empresa y el ingreso que percibía del mismo era necesario para los gastos del hogar. Ella necesitaba contar con un ingreso para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, además que este negocio le permitía pasar mas tiempo con sus hijos sin descuidarlos, algo difícil de hacer cuando trabajas para una empresa. Comenzó en Enero de 2004, al quedarse sin trabajo, unas amistades la invitaron a vender productos naturistas y le fue muy bien desde entonces ya que en las primeras 2 semanas tuvo excelentes resultados y con el apoyo de su esposo que ha contactado también muchos clientes para estos productos. En la actualidad es Directora de área, que es el segundo reconocimiento que otorga la empresa y actualmente cuenta con 20 distribuidores a mi cargo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para poder surtir todos los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes y seguir dándoles un buen servicio para que la recomienden con otras personas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Mr. Sor L. S. is 30 years old and is a father of three children who are too young to attend school. He and his wife work growing rice on their piece of farmland, and the outputs twice a year contribute $4 each day.

In Cambodia, people grow rice twice a year, which is called "rainy season rice" and "dry season rice," but in some areas, people can grow rice up to three times per year. In order to increase his family's income, Mr. Sor L. S. would like to request a loan from Kiva via CREDIT to purchase fertilizer for his crops, buy rice crops from growers to keep in stock, and resell when the price is increasing. Moreover, he will use the leftovers of the loan to purchase a motorbike to operate a motor-taxi when he is free from his farming work. (His wife is pictured because Mr. Sor L. S. is unavailable).

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en:
Nihfadhi has been making dresses in Zanzibar since 1998. She is 48 years old, divorced, and has five children. She works at her tailoring shop from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and earns a monthly profit of approximately $85. She is hoping to use this loan to by more fabrics and tools so that she may make more dresses.

Nihfadhi will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members: Safia, Fatma, Aisha, Biubwa and Umanzi. They each also have their own businesses in Zanzibar making and selling foods.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics and tools to make clothing.

loans.name: Demihindo

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de famille, Madame A. Demihindo est née le 25 août 1967. Ayant vite détecté  son talant de cuisine, elle décida d’ouvrir un petit restaurant dans un coin de la ville de Kpémé. Sa réputation et la qualité de son service font que le nombre de clients ne cesse d’augmenter. Dans le souci de stocker du céréale en temps d’abondance afin de l’utiliser en période où ça devient très coûteux; elle sollicite un crédit qu’elle compte utiliser en partie pour l’achat du céréale et le reste pour l’achat des épices et légumes à contre saison qui sont indispensables aux mets qu’elle fait. 
Ce crédit débloqué permettra de la redynamiser et augmenter son revenu pour une augmentation de son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of a family, Mrs. Demihindo A. was born on August 25, 1967. Having discovered her talent for cooking at a young age, she decided to open a little restaurant in the town of Kpémé. Her reputation and the quality of her food cause the number of customers that come to her to continually grow. With a view to stockpiling cereals when they are abundant so as to rely on them when they become very expensive, she is asking for a loan that she intends to use in part to buy cereals and also to buy spices and vegetables in the off season—both of which are indispensable for the dishes she prepares.

Receiving this loan will allow her to increase her income so that she can improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stockpiling cereals

loans.name: Saray

texts.en: Mrs. Saray A. is a villager in Prey Chhoeur Teal village in Takeo Province, Cambodia, where she owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Bo Sitha, is a worker. Their two incomes together are less than what they need to provide better conditions for their household. In order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. Saray A. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. She is 27 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Señor de los Milagros (Our Father of Miracles) Village Bank. She is 34 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their six children. Maria runs a restaurant in her home, where she works every day with the help of her daughters. On weekends, she prepares traditional Ayacuchan dishes like mondongo (tripe soup) and puca picante (potatoes and pork served in a special beet-peanut sauce). Maria needs a loan of 1800 soles to buy vegetables and decorate her restaurant.  Maria’s dreams are to save more to outfit her business and for her children to graduate with professional degrees. 

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros. 
Maria es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 6 hijos, Maria tiene un restaurante en su casa ubicado en una avenida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijas, además los días sábados y domingos prepara comida típica como mondongo y puca picante. 
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras y para ambientar su restaurante. 
Los sueños de Maria son ahorrar mas para implementar mas su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buy vegetables and decorate restaurant

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en:
Munavvar is a responsible and loving mother who is always thinking of the well-being and security of her children. She is dedicated to raising cows and sheep. While she is exerting herself in this, her husband leaves very early in the morning and travels great distances to provide veterinary services to peasants in need of care for their animals. The hope of this responsible mother is to purchase more animals to expand their business. To reach this goal they are requesting a loan of 600 USD, which they plan to repay in 8 months.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  cattle in order to expand her business

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan B. is a rice grower. He is 39 years old and has two children. He used to be a security officer, but he was not happy about guarding office premises because of the low income he got from his job. He started tilling their small parcel of land to support the needs of his children. His family gave him a share of two hectares of rice field. From then, he started to manage the land, grow some crops and make it sustainable. He uses his harvest to feed his family and to earn a little income from selling rice to the villagers.

Allan is asking for a loan of 10,000 pesos to grow more rice. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers including two bags of urea, triple 14, 21-0-0, 1 quart trebon, 1 box mipcin, 2 quarts 2 4 D, Hostathion, and Bushwack. The fertilizers will definitely give him a bigger and better harvest.

Because he is a CEVI client, Allan has access to the CEVI credit program, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers, insecticides and other farm chemicals.

loans.name: Lat

texts.en: Mrs. Lat K. lives in An Doung Samrith village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She also sells palm sugar which is made by her husband. Her husband, Mr. Thun Tha, is a palm juice collector. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn too little income to provide a better house for their family living. Thus, Mrs. Lat K. decided to request a loan to buy zinc and timbers. She would use the rest of the loan to hire a laborer to build the house. She is 45 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom work in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. She and her husband are presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy zinc and timbers,  and  hire a laborer to build a house.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 28 years old. She sells cooked food and drinks. She is married with 3 children, and she lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She wants to satisfy the demand of her customers by requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell and cook. She says thanks to all who make this possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to cook and sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Cài Nguyễn, 43, lives in the town of Hưng yên. She is single and does not have any chlidren. To make a living, Cài owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from cultivating fruit trees & harvesting fruit for sale. Cài has been engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, Cài joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cài has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund, used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Cài is requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Cài from TYM Fund. Cài plans to use the revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: Purchase seeds.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah B. is married, has one child and has received an education through Senior High School. Since 2006, she has worked as a trader selling canned tomatoes, beans and rice at Elmina. While Sarah works as a trader, her husband is employed as a computer mechanic. Sarah will use the loan to purchase more food supplies for selling. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to save towards buying a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies for selling.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: Nely es una mujer muy querida y admirada en su barrio, tiene 23 años y vive muy feliz con su hija Liliana de 3 años, en la casa que sus padres le dejaron. Siempre fue muy trabajadora, desde muy pequeña aprendió a tejer artesanalmente, ahora lleva ya 5 años en su negocio de tejidos, donde trabaja todos los días sin descanso, y para mejorar su producción se asoció con otras personas que al igual que ella gustan de tejer y de esa manera hace crecer su negocio. Nely disfruta de su trabajo, es especial de tejer artesanalmente, aunque le resulta muy dificultoso realizar los acabados a las prendas, pero lo hace con mucho gusto. Su deseo a futuro es tener un local adecuado para realizar sus tejidos, ya que actualmente lo hace en su casa. Este es el primer préstamo de Nely con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, es una persona muy alegre en su banco comunal y tiene pensado adquirir más préstamos posteriormente. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende en su puesto.
texts.en:
Nely is much loved and admired in her community. She is 23 years old and lives very happily with her 3-year-old daughter, Liliana, in the house that her parents left her. She has always been a very hard worker ever since she was a little girl, when she first learned to do artisanal weaving. For 5 years now Nely has had her own weaving business, and she works every day without a break. She went into partnership with other people who, like her, enjoy weaving in order to improve her production, and that way she was able to make her business grow. Nely enjoys her work, especially doing artisanal weaving; she works very hard to make each finished garment, but she does so with great pleasure. Her hope for the future is to have an adequate place to do her weaving, since she currently does the work in her home. This is Nely’s first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she feels that she is capable of making her loan payments on time. She is very happy with her communal bank and is thinking of applying for more loans in the future. She will use the 500 soles she is requesting to purchase more wool so she can increase the amount of merchandise she sells from her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wool for her weaving

loans.name: Bobokul

texts.en:
N. Bobokul is 45 years of age and lives with his wife and 6 children. His wife helps him with household expenses now that she is a merchant with a stall in the oriental market in Shahrituz. Bobokul has worked in agriculture for 15 years. The biggest problem he has is a lack of funding. Bobokul cultivates the lands that he inherited from his father. His plans for the future are to succeed in establishing more farmland to be able to help his children build their homes. He requests this loan to invest in farm supplies.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
Melania es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas.
Melania es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Melania se dedica a la agricultura de papa, quinua en sus tierras de Sachabamba, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de peones, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad de Lima. Además Melania tiene un carro con el cual realiza transporte urbano en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Melania necesita un préstamo de 3500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fertilizantes y para la preparación del terreno.
Los sueños de Melania son comprar mas carros, mejorar su producción y tener una tienda de repuestos.
texts.en:
Melania is a member of Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas.

Melania is married, 44 years old and has 3 children. Melania farms potatoes and quinoa on her land in Sachabamba with the help of workers. She sells in the city of Lima. Furthermore, Melania has a car with which she offers urban transportation in the city of Ayacucho.

Melania needs a loan of 3500 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers and for the preparation of soil.

Melania’s dreams are to buy more cars, improve her production and have a spare parts shop.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and prepare the soil

loans.name: Agnes
