texts.en: Agnes is 50-years-old. She is a widowed mother to four children. All her children are grown up and they live on their own, easing many burdens on her. Her husband died mysteriously but she never gave up her business. She works hard to provide for herself and her business. She prepares and bakes bread. She has done this business for thirty-five years now, in spite of the challenges she faces. It is with her bread business that she managed to care for her children to this level. She has customers who come to her to buy in bulk. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials to meet her demand. She requests loan support to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide for her family and, most especially, her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for baking bread.

loans.name: Mayra Mayita

texts.es:
Es una joven soltera de 22 años de edad, manabita, oriunda de Jipijapa de ocupación profesora, desde muy niña ella empezó en el mundo de las ventas ya que sus padres sostenían un negocio de legumbres y hasta los actuales momentos lo conservan gracias al apoyo de ella y de sus hermanos que han sabido trabajar junto a sus padres.

Ella distribuye muy bien su tiempo para salir en el carro y recorrer entregando a los clientes las legumbres como tomate, cebolla, brócoli, papas, coliflor y más productos, comentaba que  tiene un recorrido de ciudades donde entregan como Pajan, Machalilla, Puerto Cayo entre otros.

Mayra comenta que para ella es tan importante este negocio ya que por medio de él ha podido obtener sus estudios, aunque para sus hermanos no ha sido fácil porque han tenido que dejar de estudiar para dedicarse por entero a las ventas.

En Mayra se podía notar durante la conversación que es una persona llena de fortaleza y de grandes retos, y que las ganas de trabajar son muchas, en sus planes a futuro ella desea terminar una nueva carrera universitaria.

Le preguntamos en que invertirá el préstamo y ella emocionada nos comentó que lo invertirá en comprar más productos, para abastecer su negocio, eso consiste en que tiene que viajar  a ciudades como Ambato, Guayaquil y Portoviejo para comprar los productos necesarios  y seguir vendiendo como hasta ahora lo ha venido haciendo sin ningún problema.

Ella está feliz porque tienen ya sus clientes fijos que la esperan para recibir las verduras frescas y en buen estado para consumirlas, todo esto le ha hecho acreedora de una gran confianza en sí misma para seguir apoyando a sus padres, muy a pesar de sus edad ella ama a los niños se involucra con ellos y es una excelente profesora, nada de esto le quita el sueño de llegar lejos y obtener más experiencia en el mundo de los  negocios.
texts.en:
Mayra is 22 years old, and she is a native of Jipijapa, a province in the Manabí region of Ecuador. She is employed as a teacher. When she was a little girl, she began working in the sales world by helping in her parents' business of selling vegetables. Until now, they have preserved that business thanks to the help of Mayra and her brothers, who have learned how to work through their parents.

Mayra budgets her time well when she travels in her car to deliver vegetables to her clients, such as tomatoes, onions, broccoli, potatoes, cauliflower, and more. She has certain cities where she delivers the vegetables, such as Pajan, Machalilla, and Puerto Cayo, among others.

Mayra believes her business is very important because through it, she has been able to fund her education. Although for her brothers, it has not been easy because they had to stop their studies in order to dedicate themselves entirely to the business.

In conversation with Mayra, you can see that she is a person full of strength with great challenges, and because her desire to work is so strong, she plans to complete a new degree course at the university in the future.

We asked her how she would invest her loan, and she excitedly responded that she will invest it in more products to supply her business, which includes trips to the cities of Ambato, Guayaquil, and Portoviejo to buy the products she needs. She will continue selling, without problems, like she was doing before the loan.

Mayra is happy because she now has her regular clients that wait for her in order to receive her vegetables, which are fresh and ready to eat. She credits this to her strong confidence in her self to continue helping her parents. Despite her age, she loves her students and involves herself with them, and she is an excellent teacher. None of this overtakes her dream of getting farther and obtaining more experience in the business world.


Translated from Spanish by Suzy Marinkovich, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to supply her business

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El señor Santos C. C., tiene la edad de 50 años, habita en el barrio las enramadas, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe. Junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen dos hijos, estudiante actualmente, los planes hacia su futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida, desde hace 27 años se dedica a la agricultura, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y la afectación volcánica, el inicio esta actividad con esfuerzos propios, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones del cultivo. Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y poder aplicar a la cosecha para poder vender a mejor precio en el mercado. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los créditos pues es su séptimo ciclo el cual ha podido dar buen seguimiento a sus siembra.
texts.en:
Santos C. C. is 50 years old and lives in the Las Enramadas neighborhood in the municipality of Ticuantepe. Along with his wife, who also works, they cover household expenses and provide for their two children, who are currently in school. Their plans for the future is to improve their quality of life. For the past 27 years Santos has made a living in agriculture. His biggest problem has been a lack of funding and volcanic activity. He started his work on his own and plans to improve his crops in the future. With the loan he is requesting, he plans to buy fertilizers and planting supplies to be able to sell his crops at better prices at the market. He is thankful for Kiva and the loan institution for its support, since this is his seventh credit cycle and he has been able to well-monitor his plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and planting supplies

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia O. sells fish. She buys fish at the seashore, smokes it and sells in Elmina, near Eselem. Cynthia is married and has four children. Her husband is a fish monger. Cynthia has been selling smoked fish since 1999. She has no formal education. She helps her husband with the payment of bills and settlement of school fees. Her loan will enable her to buy more fish to be processed as smoked fish, then sold. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy fish for smoked fish processing and sale

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mr. Thy T. is a villager in Trapaing Knol village in Takeo province. He is a breeder who raises pig, duck and cow. Since these breeding businesses are going well, he wants to expand it so he decided to ask for a loan to buy two piglets, 500-duck and a cow for his current breeding business. His wife, Mrs. Tong Keng, helps him on the businesses. Mr. Thy T. is 45 years old and the father of nine children three of whom are employed in a casino club while other three are attending the local school. The other three stay at home because they are too young to work and study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy two piglets, 500-duck and a cow for his current breeding business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace O. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Grace is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns and operates a business in the retail sector, buying and selling fish in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Grace is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
43-year-old Ruben B. owns and manages a small rice field. He has seven children. His eldest child is 30 years old and is married. Ruben wants to improve the family's living conditions, He needs additional capital to finance his business and support the needs of his grandchildren.

He would like to apply for a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to pay the laborers who help till their farm. The loan will also helped buy the farming necessities to ensure a quality and abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Akhpalwak Group

texts.en:
This is the 'Akhpalwak' group. There are four members in this group. The leader of this group is Azada. She is a married woman. She lives with three children in Khair Khan, Kabul, Afghanistan. She has two sons and one daughter. They are at the university and Azada’s husband is a teacher. Azada wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She needs three new disks for her tailoring.

M. Kabeir and Sayad Nasa want to take a loan for their business of selling carpets. They produce and import carpets from Harat and sell them in Kabul. They want to develop and improve their business.

Akhpalwak also wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of selling car parts. He wants to buy necessary materials for his business. And he wants to expand and develop his business.

With this loan they can make their businesses larger and support their families and make a better future for themselves and also for their families in the future.

loans.use: Improve and expand their businesses

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic A. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Marivic is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling processed food, such as longganisa and peanut butters, in the local community. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marivic joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marivic from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell

loans.name: Fatimum

texts.en:
Fatimum sells drinks and frozen foods from her house. She is happy because she does not have to pay to rent a stall. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She has been in this business for 8 years.

Fatimum is 32 years old, married with 4 children. She lives in Badagry, Lagos State, Nigeria. Fatimum hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more frozen foods and crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Rosmery Susana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Rosmery tiene 23 años, es conviviente y tiene un hijo llamado Héctor Enrique que tiene dos años y medio.  Ellos viven en la ciudad de Urcos a 45 Km. de la Ciudad Imperial del Cusco. 

La socia se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar y después se dedica a la artesanía y a la confección de chompas de lana de alpaca. Rosmery alquila el espacio donde trabaja y vende la artesanía. Ella trabaja dos tipos de artesanías: muñequería (Confección de Muñecas con trajes típicos de la ciudad del Cusco) y peletería (Confección de alfombras, prendas de vestir y accesorios, adornos con lana de alpaca). Rosmery exporta sus productos a los países de España e Inglaterra. Ya son tres años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre joven, trabajadora y emprendedora que requiere el préstamo para comprar más material como tela, hilos, lana de alpaca, etc., para seguir confeccionando artesanía. 

La socia es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Rosmery is 23 years old, has a common law partner and a two and a half-year old son named Hector Enrique. They live in the town of Urcos, located 45km from the Imperial City of Cuzco.

The member gets up very early in the morning to take care of household chores and after that she makes crafts and knits "chompas" (a type of sweater very common in the region) with alpaca wool. Rosmary rents the space where she works and sells her craft. She works in two kinds of craft: the making of dolls with the typical clothing of Cuzco and the knitting of rugs, clothing, accessories and decorations with alpaca wool. Rosmery exports her products to Spain and England. She has had her business for 3 years and it is going very well thanks to all her hard work. Our member is a young, hardworking and interpreneur mother who requests a loan to buy more supplies such as fabric, thread, alpaca wool, etc. for her craft.

The member was born in the town of Urcos, province of Quispicanchis of the provincial department of Cuzco. She belongs to the "Qori Orcco" Community Bank of the Arariwa Association.

The member is thankful for being given this opportunity and will comply with the scheduled payments.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member requests the loan to purchase more working materials such as fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Maria Concepción G. tiene ya mas de doce años dedicándose a la venta de juguetes y aparatos de electrónica.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía ya que se le termino y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder hacer la inversión, es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo para poder surtir de mercancía el negocio y así tener mas ingreso.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Concepción G. has been selling toys and consumer electronics for more than twelve years. Her business lacks a variety of merchandise, but she does not have the money necessary to make additional investments. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise so that she can restock her business and generate more income. She plans to repay this loan with the profits from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Asengo

texts.en:
Asengo A. is currently in the business of selling fruits and vegetables in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase onions and tomatoes to sell. Asengo is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a potter. She has four children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to keep sending her children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Rayhana Kharasan Group

texts.en:
Bibi Rayhana is the group leader of Rayhana Kharasan group. She is a 40 -year -old woman married with four children who are in school. She lives in 11 district of Kabul Afhganistan.She has a bakery in her area. She knew about this skill when she was 15 years old becasue her mother had the same business. After marriage she had some economic problems that is why she decided to start the business of bakery. At the begining she had a few clients,but now she is quite famous among her neighbors. She wants to take a loan for her bakery to purchase fire wood and some tools which are necessary for baking the bread.
For her future she hopes to open a new shop and progress her business.

loans.use: purchasing fire wood and tools

loans.name: Sadaina

texts.en:
Sadaina is a married woman with four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She rents a one-roomed house where she lives with six people. They have electricity but no piped water at home. The family eats three meals a day. 

Sadaina works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She operates a retail shop in Kampala city where she sells bed sheets. She will use her loan to buy more products for her shop. Sadaina works six days a week and sells to an average of 15 customers a day. She uses public transport to and from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala. Sadaina has been in this business for the past ten years and has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for five years. She is now on her twelfth loan and her main monthly expenses include rent for accommodation, daily market dues, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise such as bed sheets  for her retail shop

loans.name: Vith

texts.en:
Mrs. Vith L. is 44 years old and she is a villager who lives in Kouk Doung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ang Morng, are farmers who own a 2.5-hectare field to cultivate rice on. In this farming, Mrs. Vith L. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine and fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming crops. 

Aside from farming, Mr. Ang Morng is also a duck breeder who can earn a small income by selling duck eggs to support the family. This couple has two children who both are students in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine and fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Santa Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Santa Kumari N. is a farmer in the village of Dolchoki. Dolchoki is one of the developing villages located in Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are farmers. Mrs. N. has eight members including herself in her family. She lives with her husband, Mr. Jay Krishna N., and six children. Her husband works in a government office. She has four sons and two daughters. All of her children are now studying in secondary school.

Mrs. N. grows green vegetables on her land. She mostly grows seasonal vegetables and sells in the local market in the mornings and evenings. Now she is requesting a 10,000 Nepalese rupee loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her agricultural farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her farming

loans.name: Seguku A Lubwama Teddy Group

texts.en: L. Teddy is a single mother of three children, two of whom are going to school. She has a charcoal business that she has been operating for over five years. Previously, she could purchase only ten or fewer bags of charcoal at a time, but now she will use the loan to purchase fifty or more bags to sell. Her business is growing like wild fire. She is encouraged to work very hard. Her hope for the future is to construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase fifty bags of charcoal at a time to sell.

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke is a friendly woman. She sells plastics to make a living. She sells for long hours to enable her meet the basic needs of her family and also supports her husband. She is 40 years old, married with 3 children. Her husband is a contractor and he also supports their home. She is requesting for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more plastics to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: Ernesto M. M., tiene la edad de 36 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y su hijo de 5 años de edad, que son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Ernesto también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Ernesto M. M. is 36 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 5-year-old child. They are his first priority. He is requesting this loan for his farm, specifically for coffee growing—he plans to buy manure and fertilizer. He hopes to properly maintain his coffee crop in order to achieve better quality and maximize profit at harvest time. This is the first time he has taken out a loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the opportunities they offer. Ernesto has worked in agriculture for many years. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Coffee growing

loans.name: Nancy Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Nancy V. es socia del banco comunal Cochapamba, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel, perteneciente a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es conocida por su productividad agrícola, la misma que abastece a su población, también se dedican a la ganadería, muchos salen a la ciudad en busca de un mejor trabajo, una gran parte de la población joven a migrado a otras partes del mundo para brindarles un mejor futuro a  sus familias.

Doña Nancy se encuentra cerca de cumplir 45 años de edad, es casada y en su unión ha concebido 4 hijos, su primera hija tiene 23 años, casada y vive de manera independiente, su segundo hijo de 21 años estudia en el universidad, el tercero de 13 años estudia en el colegio, y su último hijo tiene apenas 5 años de edad, su esposo ha migrado para brindarles un mejor futuro. Con el esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y también a la cría de animales como: borregos, pollos los que vende en su propia comunidad. Con el nuevo crédito que recibe de parte de la fundación Espoir lo va a invertir en vitaminas y alimento para sus animales, su meta es seguir creciendo y criar más animalitos.
texts.en:
Nancy V. is a member of the Cochapamba communal bank. She lives in the community of San Miguel, which belongs to the parish of Valle. This parish is known for its agricultural productivity, which supplies its population. Its people are also involved in cattle farming. Many leave for the city in search of a better job, and a large portion of the young generation has migrated to other parts of the world to provide a better future for their families.

Nancy is almost 45 years old, married, and in her marriage has conceived 4 children. Her first daughter is 23 years old, married and lives independently. Her second child, her son, is 21 years old and is in college. Her third is 13 years old and he is in high school, and her fourth is just 5 years old. Her husband has migrated to provide them with a better future. With her husband’s work, they have been able to build their own house.

Nancy does the household chores and also raises animals such as sheep and chickens, which she sells in her own community. With the new loan that she receives from the Espoir foundation, she will invest in vitamins and food for her animals. Her goal is to continue growing and to raise more animals.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grass, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Fasha Group

texts.fr:
Aline N. est une commerçante âgée de 24ans qui habite la Commune de Rugombo en Province Cibitoke  à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce du riz depuis cinq ans au Marché de Rugombo.Elle était cultivatrice avant de commencer cette activité commerciale. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 5e année du primaire. Elle est  divorcée. Elle est maintenant  au 3e cycle dans le crédit communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 2enfants âgés de 6ans et de 3ans dont un est à l’école. Elle a connu de sérieux problèmes du ménage parce que son mari le maltraitait, raison pour laquelle elle a été contrainte de divorcer. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour augmenter  la quantité de riz qu’elle achète pour revendre aux clients. Elle a l’espoir qu’avec le crédit de Turame, elle pourra avoir beaucoup de bénéfice et faire ses épargnes pour résoudre ses divers problèmes financiers et acheter une parcelle pour construire sa propre maison.

Elle reconnait que le crédit Turame est facile à rembourser et affirme qu’elle va continuer à le prendre.

 Elle est une des membres du groupe  communautaire « Fasha ».
texts.en:
Aline N. is a 24 year old shopkeeper who lives in the town of Rugombo in the Cibitoke province located in western Burundi. For the past five years she has sold rice at the Rugombo market. She is divorced. She is currently involved in her third community loan with Turame. She is the mother of two children, aged 3 and 6 years of which one is in school. She has known serious household troubles because her husband mistreated her, which was the reason she was forced to divorce him. She is asking for a Kiva loan to increase to quantity of rice she buys and can resell to her clients. With the loan from Turame, she could increase her profits and invest in her savings to solve her varied financial issues and buy a plot of land on which to build her own house. She recognizes that the loan from Turame is easy to repay and she asserts that she will continue to borrow from them. She is a member of the Fasha Community group.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase the quantity of rice she buys to resell to her clients

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a single woman with one child who attends school. She rents a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. She has been selling cosmetics and women's undergarments at the market in her community. She also runs a retail shop, which contributes to her income. With the loan of Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of clothes to sell. She faces a competitive environment, as many people in the neighborhood work in the same business. Anita hopes that someday she will open a boutique and increase her profits so she can live a comfortable life. She decided to work with Yehu so as to get a  loan to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice Atieno

texts.en:
Beatrice Atieno O. is a fish vendor, a business she started in 2006. Before that, she used to operate a salon but, due to low income, she had to ditch it.

Beatrice buys her stock directly from the lake because the fish are cheap there. To improve her business, she has applied for a Ksh 10,000 loan.

Beatrice is 31 years old, is married, and is the mother of two children. Her dream is to be economically stable.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her business, such as new and used magazines and used footwear for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Ret Aeth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen people who have selected Mrs. Ret A., a village bank president who was born I. 1969. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to support their businesses located I. Tuol Trea village I. Takeo province.

Mrs. Ret A. is a famer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support herself. She is also a pig breeder. Since her breeding is going well, she wants buy more piglets. So, Mrs. Ret A. is applying for a loan to buy more piglets. With the rest of the loan she will purchase fertilizer and hire farm laborers to grow rice. She is a widow with two children who are both studying at school and also help I. her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Kyeva

texts.en:
Kyeva I. is a 49-year-old herbal products trader in town center, Mombasa.  Kyeva is married to one wife who is also a businesswoman who also contributes to the family income. They are blessed with two children.

Kyeva has been in this business for the last three years and his income is great. He is now requesting his first loan with KADET and he would like to add to his inventory of "Forever Living" herbal medicinal products with the loan amount. He plans to use the anticipated profit to expand this business even more.

Kyeva hopes to be successful and become a leading supplier and a distributor of Forever Living products

loans.use: To purchase more Forever Living herbal medicinal products

loans.name: Rodori

texts.en:
Rodori G. is one of the good-performing and active member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance institution partner in the Philippines since 1999. She is 46 years old and is the mother of five children. She got married at the early age of 18 and only finished her junior year in high school. With this experience she was encouraged to engage in business so that she can provide her family with a better living and send her children to school.

Rodori joined ASHI to have access to capital that she and her husband utilized in fish trading, their primary source of income. As part of the success of their fish-trading business she was able to put up a store that she manages. The profit in this secondary business helps with their daily financial needs and school allowances for her children.

Again, Rodori is applying for a loan of Php 20,000 to buy an additional stock of fish for trading and fingerlings (small fish) for their fishpond. She is optimistic that their income will increase so that she can earn and save more for the expense of her children’s schooling. She is dreaming that all her children will finish a degree in college and find a stable job in the future.

Rodori is thankful for what ASHI and Kiva provide to her family. All the blessings that they benefit from are fruits of the assistance and support that the two institutions offer. She is praying that these institutions will reach more poor but deserving families in the future and change their lives.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell and fingerlings for her fishpond

loans.name: Oldemar

texts.en:
Oldemar is a 42-year-old pepper producer and father of four who lives with his family in the region of Upala in the Northern part of Costa Rica, minutes from the Nicaraguan border. Oldemar is a dedicated farmer. He plans to focus his efforts on the planting and harvesting of Cayenne and Habanero peppers. He works to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. The land he works is his own. In addition to his agricultural activity, Oldemar feels it is important to be an active member of his community. As a result, he dedicates a significant portion of his time to community meetings, groups and events. The rural zone where Oldemar lives is sparsely populated with infrequent bus service and a general lack of infrastructure. Oldemar is working hard striving to reap the maximum benefits from his land and his labor. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Oldemar and his family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Upala community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Cayenne and Habanero peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labor and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Oldemar. The production cycle (from planting to harvest) for these types of peppers is roughly one year. Oldemar planted his peppers four months ago and will expect to harvest in the next eight months. Typically, he dedicates the hours from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM everyday to his agricultural activities. 

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial (PROPICA) is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Upala, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The main obstacle Oldemar and other producers in the Upala community face is a lack of access to working capital funds. The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to Oldemar, his family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve living conditions for Oldemar as well as the community at large. Above all, Oldemar wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. He wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his home and neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural chemicals and nutrients.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 26 years old and a single mother of one. She runs a boutique to earn a living.  She has been in the business for four years.  She appreciates Faulu Kenya for giving her financial support; hence, she has been able to add business stock. She hopes to open another boutique in the future.  

She has requested a loan of 45,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more clothes so as to keep stock for the Christmas festive season, when the demand is high.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe P. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 45 years old. Fe is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Fe runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, biscuits and junk foods. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Asifa's Group

texts.en:
Asifa is a resident of Lahore, which is famous in Pakistan for its history and culture. She is a widow whose husband died suddenly a few years ago. It was a very difficult time for her, but she recovered her senses for her children. She started a business sewing clothes for her neighbouring clients. Her sons have had to leave their education and start doing work to financially support their mother. Her eldest son has a business selling ready-made garments while her younger son works as a medical representative for a pharmaceutical company.

Asifa has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her elder son’s ready-made garments business. With the loan, he will buy a variety of ready-made garments in bulk quantity, which will help him make more income and increase sales.

He has been running this business for some time now and Asifa is hopeful that a loan investment will bring good profits for her son. She wants to help him marry and she is hopeful that better business conditions will help her save more money for his marriage. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and is hopeful that this will be a good profitable experience for her.

Note: In the photo, the woman who is raising her hand is Asifa.

loans.use: To buy ready-made garments for resale.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa T. is from the village of Solinog Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Nelfa is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Nelfa owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, bread, canned goods, noodles, and rice in the local community. Nelfa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nelfa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelfa is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nelfa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Adalberto Enrique

texts.es:
Adalberto, es comerciante de medicina alimenticia, tiene 24 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel con su esposa y dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, él está trabajando de 7:00am a 5:00pm este es su fuente de ingreso para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de medicina  ya que por momento su inventario este vacio, con este préstamo ayudara a tener constante medicamento para ofrecer a los clientes y poder atender sus necesidades.
Sueña que a través del negocio pueda convertirse en un gran empresario mayorista de medicamentos y lograr estabilizar los ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Adalberto is a salesman who sells nutritional medicine.  He is 24 years old and lives in San Miguel, in San Miguel department, with his wife and two children aged 5 and 3.  He works from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  This is his source of income with which he covers his household needs.

Adalberto is requesting a loan to buy medicine since at the moment he has no inventory.  This loan will help him to have medicine available constantly to offer to his customers and serve their needs.  Adalberto dreams that, through his business, he will be able to become a wholesaler of medicines and manage to stabilize his household income.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Mayrambek

texts.en:
Mayrambek T. is 46 years old, married and has three children: his elder son serves in the army, one daughter has graduated and the youngest daughter is a schoolgirl.  After finishing school, Mayrambek worked as a driver at the local cargo station.  In order to support his family and find an additional source of income, he decided to start his own business in cattle breeding.  With the starting capital of 10,000 KGS, he managed to develop his farm and earn about 3,000 KGS a month. 

For successful implementation of his plans for maintaining his own farm with a large number of cattle, he took his first loan from Bai Tushum, which was used as intended and repaid without any delays.  Now Mayrambek has applied for a loan of 70,000 KGS to broaden his farm by purchasing ten sheep and two colts. With the additional revenues, he plans to increase the number of cattle. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase ten sheep and two colts.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace H. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Peace has a retail shop business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Peace has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Peace hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to build rental houses. Peace is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es: Héctor Antonio se dedica a brindar el servicio de soldadura. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, ya que tiene que buscar lo necesario para sacar adelante a su familia. El es una persona muy emprendedora que disfruta de realizar su negocio, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre están satisfechos por el buen servicio que ofrece. El motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como soldadora, bomba desoldadora, guantes entre otros.
texts.en:
Héctor Antonio is a welder. He’s been in this business for over four years because he has to seek what’s necessary to support his family.  He is a very enterprising person who enjoys running his business.  Most of his customers are always satisfied with the work he does.  

The reason for the loan request is to buy raw materials like a soldering machine, a soldering pump and gloves, among others.

loans.use: To buy soldering equipment.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: Mario Jose tiene un negocio que es la venta y elaboración de repostería. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio. Este negocio lo aprendió como un tipo de trabajo que le genere ganancias para mantener a sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo. El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de harina, mantequilla, huevos entre otros productos. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Sueña con es establecer otro negocio de repostería.
texts.en:
Mario José makes pastry to sell.  He’s been in business over 11 years.  He learned the business as a way to generate funds to support his two children that are in his care.

He will use the loan to buy flour, butter and eggs, among other products.

This activity is his main source of income for support.  He dreams with setting up another pastry business.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter and eggs, among other products.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en: Rhodora is 45 years old, single and supports her family by operating three business ventures: pig fattening, gasoline retailing and basket weaving. Rhodora joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rhodora has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy livestock supplies for her pigs and gasoline for resale so that she can continue to save up for the future renovation of her house. Rhodora is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase livestock supplies and gasoline for resale

loans.name: Zosima

texts.es: Zosima de 35 años, natural del distrito de Kimbiri; esta casada con Yover de 33 años y tienen 03 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa ubicado en la comunidad de Santa Fe, anexo del distrito de Kimbiri. Zosima y su pareja Yover son el pilar de su familia. Ha Zosima desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra,  y creció con esos dotes, en la actualidad cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de café y plantaciones de hojas de coca, plantas originarias de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene trabajando 10 años en sus propias tierras, En tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros para las extracciones de los frutos y así avanza con mayor  rapidez en cuanto a  sus cosechas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es recolectar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco y Quimbiri; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos y hojas de coca. Su dificultad es; no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo con las cosechas; es por ello que acude a los préstamos que facilita la Institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantaciones de café por que es una de las plantas que mayor demanda en el mercado. Este es  su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo y se siente muy agradecida con la Institución. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en las cosechas de café.
texts.en:
Zosima is 35 years old and from Kimbiri district.  She is married to 33 year-old Yover and has 3 children.  They live together in their own home which is located in Santa Fe community, a small village in Kimbiri district.  Zosima and her husband Yover are the pillars of their family.  Since she was a little girl, Zosima's parents taught her to work on the farm and she grew up with these talents.  She currently owns 3 hectares of land where she grows coffee  and coca leaf.  These plants are native to the rainforest area of the Apurimac River Valley.  She has been working on her own land for 10 years.  At harvest time she hires laborers to pick her fruit so that she can harvest more quickly.

What Zosima most likes about her work is collecting the fruit from her plants since this is when she feels that the months of hard work are providing her with some reward, in the quality of her fruit.  She considers that the most difficult part of her work is transporting her produce from the farm to the wholesale centers in San Francisco and Quimbiri.  This is where she is offered the best prices for her beans and coca leaf.

The difficulty Zosima faces is that she doesn't have enough money to cover, in advance, the wages of the laborers who support her at harvest time.  For this reason, she is taking loans with MFP.  However, right now her main priority is sowing more coffee plantations because this is one of the plants that is in greatest demand on the market.

This is Zosima's first loan with MFP.  She knows that she is responsible for making all her repayments punctually and she is prepared to do this.  She is very grateful to the institution.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to hire laborers to support her in her coffee harvest.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help her with her coffee harvest

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna R. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Myrna runs a general store in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. 

Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Myrna is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Myrna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products for her general store

loans.name: Christian Eduardo

texts.es:
Christian de 31 años, es un hombre trabajador  gracias a la ayuda de su mama pudo comprarse un vehículo con el cual trabaja como taxista, escogió esta actividad debido a que no encontraba trabajo.

En la actualidad trabaja solo desde las 6H00am hasta las 21H00pm. le afecta mucho la delincuencia  ya que la ciudad se ha vuelto peligrosa. Con el préstamo va a darle mantenimiento al vehículo para así no tener problemas con el tiempo y así seguir incrementando sus ganancias. Ya que en un futuro quiere obtener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Christian, age 31, is a hard-working man. Thanks to help from his mother, he was able to buy a vehicle which he uses to work as a taxi driver. He chose this business because he did not find a job. 

Currently, he works alone from 6:00 a.m. until 9 p.m. He is strongly affected by crime, because the city has become dangerous. With the loan, he will carry out maintenance on his vehicle, so that he will not have problems over time. This will help him continue to increase his earnings, since in the future he wants to obtain a house of his own.

loans.use: to pay for tires and maintenance.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 54 años de edad, en la actualidad está separada pero de esa relación tuvo tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive un nieto de doce años que desde que nació vive con ella, el mismo que estudia en colegio.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual venden  todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, carne, pollo, pescado, etc.    Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y veces hasta más tarde, los productos los compra en Portoviejo ya que allá le salen más baratos y algunos los  recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva más de 20 años con su negocio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 10 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le han servido de mucho para ayudar a sus hijos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The 3 de Mayo (May 3) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo’s Picoaza Parish, a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the joy of its people.

We met Ana, 54, here.  She is currently separated but she had three children, all adult and independent now, from her relationship.  She lives with her 12 year old grandson who has lived with her since birth; he is going to school.

She has a home based grocery store where she sells all types of products like: rice, sugar, oil, detergent, meat, chicken, fish, etc.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  She buys her products in Portoviejo because they are less expensive there and some of her stock is delivered to her.  She’s been in business over 20 years.

She is going to use this loan to stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats and other basic need items. 

She’s been in the communal bank for 10 years and she likes it because the loans have been very useful for her to help her children.

Her goals are to stay in business and that her store grows more each day.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Women In Need Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Women In Need” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 per member. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Abie is the leader of this group. The 38-year-old is married to a police officer and they have 4 children. Abie has been a businesswoman for many years now, selling palm oil and pepper. With her share of this loan, she will buy these items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and pepper wholesale.

loans.name: Gazelle Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Gazelle sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 27 ans et 2 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Château de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de pagnes wax, d’habits pour enfants,  de chaises en bambou, du caoutchouc de lessive, du mil et des jus de fabrication locale. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer  au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
Madame Kadia compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  50 chaises en bambou avec des forgerons du village de Noumou Wêrê au grand marché de Ségou lors des foires. Elle les revend en détail à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame Kadia espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The majority of the seven women who make up the Gazelle group are married in monogamous families, with an average age of 27 and two children each. They all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and are acquainted through kinship as well as business activities at the Château de Ségou market. The group's members sell "pagnes" (colorful West African cloth), children's clothing, bamboo chairs, rubber, detergent, millet, and locally made juice.

In order to increase their working capital, the group's members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. This is their first group loan.

Madame Kadia plans to use her loan to buy fifty bamboo chairs from the blacksmiths of the Noumou Wêrê village at Ségou's big market during the fairs. She will sell them retail to a clientele composed of both men and women.

Madame Kadia hopes to make an average monthly profit of 22,000FCFA, which will be reinvested in the business and used to pay her children's health care.

loans.use: to buy bamboo chairs.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
This is Flordeliz.  She is 38 years old and is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is single and works hard to sustain herself. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Flordeliz operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Phps worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Flordeliz earns income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 712 in sales every day.

To help continue the operations of her business, Flordeliz is requesting a loan for Php 10,000 buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Flordeliz hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to save money in the bank. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Tumenbileg

texts.en:
Tumenbileg is 51 years old and lives with his wife and twins in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia.  His one son is a worker and other one is a student.  

His wife is a salesperson who has her own business.  He operates a uniform trading business at a rented stall at Narantuul, one of the crowded markets in Ulaanbaatar city.  He started his business in 1995 and gained much experience.  Now he has 3 stalls where he sells a variety of uniforms for all ages.  He is a hardworking man who says, "I want to increase my business sales."  He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials to sew uniforms.

loans.use: To purchase materials to sew uniforms

loans.name: Las Trenzadoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS TRENZADORAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Adela, está compuesta por seis integrantes que están dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora Elizabeth tiene el cargo de presidenta. Ellas nos comentan todas ellas tejen mantas que comercializan, pero con el afán de apoyarse con otros negocios desarrollan las siguientes actividades: Venta de manta de vicuña, venta de ropa, confección de prendas deportivas 

La señora Elizabeth,  indica que es el primer ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer, e ingreso por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas, que aprendió de su amiga. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de lana para el tejido de mantas, los que comprará de la Feria de la 16 de Julio  y posteriormente elaborados sus productos los venderá a solicitud de una clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en administración de su crédito.
texts.en:
The “LAS TRENZADORAS” (The Weavers) communal association will start its firs cycle with Pro Mujer in their Villa Adela office. It is composed of 6 members, guided by a directive board presided over by Elizabeth. They all make and sell blankets, but wanting to provide for themselves with other activities, they also engage in selling blankets made of vicuña wool, in clothes sale and in the production of sportswear.

Elizabeth says this is the first cycle she is working with Pro Mujer, and she was invited to join the group. She engages in making blankets, an activity she has leant from a friend.

The loan she is currently requesting will be uses to buy wool to knit blankets. She will buy it at the 16 de Julio market, and once her products are ready she will sell them according to her customers’ requests. As she is married and has seven children, this activity allows her to earn money to support her family as much as she can.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the training received in managing her loan.

loans.use: To bjuy wool to knit blankets

loans.name: Kenneth Joy

texts.en:
Kenneth Joy is 23 years old and is a married woman with a two-year-old child. She and her husband are both farmers and have been growing and selling rice for six years.

Kenneth Joy is requesting a loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. This loan will help Kenneth Joy and her husband achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and farm inputs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 30 años es una mujer alegre, con ganas de salir adelante y trabajar duro para así poder dar una buena educación a sus dos hijos junto a su esposo con quien lleva varios años casada y comparte su casa que pudieron comprar con esfuerzo y trabajo.Elizabeth se dedica al transporte de carga de materiales y algunas otras cosas propias de la región llevándolas a otras regiones D. Perú. Todo lo realiza por la parte fluvial, lleva realizando este trabajo ya varios años junto a su esposo quien es el que se encarga de salir al puerto de Pucallpa a buscar a los clientes, mientras que ella se queda en su casa que funciona como oficina.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede compartir muchas cosas con su esposo además que se puede quedar en casa junto a sus hijos y dispone de tiempo para poder realizar algunas actividades que también le generan ingresos. Elizabeth está muy contenta pues tiene una muy buena cartera de clientes fijos con quienes trabaja ya varios años. Ella esta en proceso de arreglar su casa pues la utiliza como oficina de trabajo.Este es el sexto préstamo entre ella y la institución MFP, le gusta trabajar con este grupo ya que se siente contenta de tener compañeros responsables y sobre todo cumplidos.Con el préstamo solicitado 2500 soles ella pagara fletes para su transporte, además de comprar materiales para arreglar su oficina.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 30 years old, a happy woman who wants to succeed and work hard in order to provide a good education for her two children, along with her husband, to whom she has been married for several years and with whom she shares a house that they were able to buy with effort and hard work.  Elizabeth works in freight transport, of materials and other things specific to the region, carrying them to other areas in Peru.  She handles all the work by river, and has been doing this work for several years, along with her husband, who is responsible for going the Pucallpa port to look for customers, while she stays at the house, which functions as an office.

What she likes most about her work is that she can share many things with her husband, and can also stay at home with her children.  She also has time to engage in some activities that also generate income.  Elizabeth is very happy, for she has a very good portfolio of steady customers with whom she has worked for several years.  She is in the process of arranging her house, to use it as an office.  This is the sixth loan between her and MFP.  She likes working with this group, as she is happy to have responsible colleagues who are reliable.  With the loan requested (2,500 soles), she will pay for freight for transporting, and also buy material to improve her office.

loans.use: pay freight for transportation, in addition to buying materials to improve her office.

loans.name: Mpara Abagamba Kamu Traders Group .a

texts.en:
Gertrude plies a clothing business in Mubende Market. She set forth in her business with savings from her previous farming business. The profitable nature of the aforementioned business was a motivator in her decision.

Gertrude comes across as a warm, lighthearted and congenial business woman. These attributes have won her laurels and golden opinions. It partly uncovers why her business has been making lots of headway ever since its inception. Along the way, she has had to bear with the inevitable adversity that plagues every business. Her determination, strong resolve, tenacity and upbeat attitude have, needless to say, been momentous.

Monthly, Gertrude says, this business's gross sales revenue totals to Uganda shillings 200,000. Gertrude's Group is receiving a loan from Pearl Micro-finance for the 4th time now and their repayment record has been good enough. She intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Aizat's Group

texts.en:
Aizat is the leader of this group. She is 27 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two children, both of whom are preschool age. Five years ago Aizat started to take orders and sew Kyrgyz national clothes, pillows and blankets. In this way she earns about 3000 soms per month. This profit made it possible for her to save money to build a summer kitchen. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to finish house repair. The loan purpose is the purchase of building materials. In the future Aizat wishes to purchase a vehicle for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito is 52 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns income from raising pigs and farming sugarcane and rice. Charito requested a 25,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. Charito hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen tiene como actividad la venta de repuestos de fotocopiadoras actividad que realiza los días jueves y domingos en la populosa feria de la 16 de julio de la ciudad de el Alto de la Paz, LA Sra. Carmen vive junto con su esposo quien es constructor y sus tres hijos que están estudiando,  esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ellos, en esta ocasión solicitan financiamiento para el aumento de capital de operaciones comprando repuestos por cantidad , la Sra. Carmen también  diversificaran su actividad realizando acopio de chatarra para su posterior venta a las fundiciones, de esta manera poder mejorar sus  ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen is in the business of selling spare parts for photocopiers. She works on Thursdays and Sundays at the crowded 16th of July Market in the city of Alto de la Paz. 

Carmen lives together with her husband who is a builder, and her three sons who are studying. 

This activity is the principal source of income for them. She is asking for a loan in order to buy spare parts in quantity to increase her profits. She is also thinking of branching out now by gathering iron scrap for later sale to smelters, and in this way be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase photocopier spare parts in quantity

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a trisikad (cycle rickshaw/ pedicab) transport business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 2 years.

Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad (cycle rickshaw/ pedicab)

loans.name: Restituto

texts.en:
Restituto is a jolly person who has no other dreams in life than to become a rich man. He means rich in love. Restituto is 47 years old and married with four children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines, planting rice in his two hectares of field. 

Due to the increasing price of farm inputs like fertilizers, seeds, insecticides and herbicides, Restituto decided to borrow a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy the farm inputs and pay for the labor of land preparation and planting. He will have a big smile if he receives the loan because he will not think anymore of where he will get the budget to use in farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay for labor

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles es una mujer muy dedicada que la mayoría del tiempo se la pasa en su trabajo, como promotora de harina de maíz que misma acomoda en los estantes de una tienda comercial. En este momento se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para mandar dinero a su mama que se encuentra enferma y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar el hospital. María de los Ángeles se preocupa por el bienestar de us mama  y quiere recompensar de alguna manera todo lo que le dio durante su infancia y juventud hablando de cosas materiales como los alimentación, un techo donde vivir cómodamente, educación y lo mas importante el amor.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles is a very dedicated woman who spends the majority of time at her job selling cornmeal that she herself puts on the shelves of a commercial store.

At the moment she finds it necessary to request a loan to send money to her mother who is sick and doesn't have the necessary money to pay for the hospital.

María de los Ángeles is worried about her mother's well-being and wants to pay her back somehow for everything that she did for her during her childhood and youth, speaking of material things such as food, a roof over her head, and education, as well as the most important thing, love.

loans.use: to pay hospital expenses.

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en:
Xuan, age 45, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She is married with one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Xuan and her husband run a clothes-selling business. Most of her family's income depends upon the sale of clothes. Xuan established her shop in 2001. 

Xuan would like to take a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of clothing to sell from her shop. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase a greater range and quantity of clothing to sell from her shop.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
El señor Vidal tiene 51 años y vive en Brisas del Paraíso, una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Jesus de Otoro. Ha estado casado 27 años con su esposa Orfilia, la cual es ama de casa. La pareja tiene 4 hijos de 32, 30, 28 y 22 años de edad. Vidal vive con su esposa y un nieto. Uno de sus hijos le ayuda económicamente. 

Hace 3 años, don Vidal empezó una pulpería con solo L20,000. En la pulpería vende productos de la canasta básica como lácteos y granos básicos. También vende productos como papel higiénico, churros, y medicamentos. Atiende a su clientela de las 6 de la mañana a las 9 de la noche.  Puso la pulpería para no trabajarle a nadie y crecer como comerciante. Antes, don Vidal se dedicaba a la agricultura. 

Solicitó este crédito de L7,000 para surtir su inventario con la compra de refrescos, lácteos, embutidos, y otros productos de alta rotación. Desea que su negocio sigue creciendo.
texts.en:
Vidal is 51 years old.  He lives in a village in the Jesus de Otoro municipality.  He has been married to his wife, Orfilia, for 27 years.  She is a housewife.  The couple has four children; ages 32, 30, 28, and 22.  Vidal lives with his wife and a grandson.  One of his children helps him financially.

Three years ago Vidal started a grocery store with only 20,000 lempiras.  In the grocery store he sells staples like dairy products and basic grains.  He also sells products like toilet paper, churros, and medications.  He tends to his customers from six in the morning until nine at night.  

He established the grocery store in order to work for himself and to grow as a merchant.  Vidal previously devoted himself to farming.

He requested this loan for 7,000 lempiras to stock his inventory by purchasing soft drinks, dairy products, sausages, and other products that have a high turnover rate.  He wishes that his business continues growing.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, dairy products, sausages, and other products that have a high turnover rate.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from one of the primary schools in Waterloo, a town near Freetown where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They have request a loan to solve their immediate financial challenges.  At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. The school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayment on their behalf. 

Elizabeth is the leader of this group of teachers. The fifty-year old is a native of Makeni.  She is married to a pastor and the couple has three children. Elizabeth has requested this loan to buy some pieces of furniture and equipment for her house.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her house

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen es socia del banco comunal Arco Iris, vive por la comunidad Tres Marías que pertenece a la parroquia de Turi,  esta parroquia es el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio.

Doña Carmen tiene 34 años, es casada y ha concebido un hijo que se encuentra de un año y medio. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
Ella se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y labora en el arreglo de casas, trabaja de lunes a sábados solo el medio día. En su casa también se dedica a la cría de cerdos, pollos y cuyes.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cerdos y en alimento para animales.

Su meta es construir una casa para su hijo.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank Arco Iris.  She lives in the community of Tres Marías, which belongs to the parish of Turi.  This parish overlooks the city of Cuenca.  The people there work growing crops, raising animals, and running businesses.

She is 34 years old, is married, and has a one-and-a-half-year-old boy.   Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  They own their own house.

She attends to the household chores and works cleaning houses from Monday through Saturday, working half-day shifts.  At home she also raises pigs, chickens and Guinea pigs.
