This is her third loan with the communal bank and will invest the funds in chickens, pigs and feed for her animals.

Her goal is to build a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: El señor Luis Carlos a sus 54 años de edad es un agricultor de cardamomo o “grano del paraíso”, es el fruto de una planta con el mismo nombre. Esta planta, de la cual se consumen solamente sus semillas, es originaria de la India y Sri-Lanka. Gracias a un proyecto de  una entidad de su municipio, el señor Luis Carlos inicio con esta actividad desde hace 5 años y actualmente cuanta con 2000 plantas. Debido al invierno, los cultivos han sufrido deterioro y la producción a disminuido, por lo cual el señor Luis Carlos necesita realizarle mantenimiento a sus cultivos para que se puedan recuperar y así continuar con su labor y poder generar los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Luis Carlos is  a  54-year-old farmer who grows cardamom or "grain of paradise" which is the fruit of a plant with the same name. This plant, of which only the seeds are consumed, is native to India and Sri-Lanka. Thanks to a project of an organization in his municipality, Mr. Luis Carlos started growing Cardamom  5 years ago  and currently has  2000 plants. Due to the winter weather,  crops have suffered and harvesting has declined. This is the main reason Mr. Luis Carlos needs to do maintenance on his crops so that they can recover and  he can continue with his work and generate enough income to cover his family's basic needs.

loans.use: To maintain the soil  for the growing of Cardamom plants, to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Dellie

texts.en:
Dellie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her bamboo weaving business.

Dellie has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from a sari-sari (variety) store.

Dellie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for bamboo weaving.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: El señor Saúl de 30 años de edad, es soltero, vive en la zona central de Cochabamba, tiene un grado de instrucción de nivel profesional como Comunicador Social, no tiene  hijos dependientes de sus ingresos. La principal actividad  del señor es el servicio de asesor de créditos, con una antigüedad de 2 años de experiencia en el rubro, trabaja en una fundación reconocida de la ciudad, pero como sus ingresos no son suficientes, los fines de semana se dedica  a otra actividad relacionada con su carrera. Muy pronto él se casara y para poder vivir con su futura esposa solicita un préstamo para remodelar  y refaccionar una vivienda y de esta forma ofrecerle mayor bienestar y comodidad a su futura familia.

loans.use: Remodelar  y refaccionar una vivienda

loans.name: Dotou Group

texts.fr: DOTOU est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui fréquente la même religion. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Koussialé Justine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 40 ans. Koussialé Justine est mariée à un dépanneur du nom de Nicolas. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Endehors de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à sa charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Koussialé Justine et son mari. Pour cette raison, Koussialé Justine prépare du haricot qu'elle vend à son domicile et de façon ambulante depuis dix ans. Koussialé Justine  vend aussi des serviettes jetables de façon secondaire, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Koussialé Justine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Koussialé Justine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe DOTOU, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du haricot, des bidons d'huiles et des serviettes jetables.

loans.name: Tangini Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a 36-year-old mother of two (a boy and a girl). She is not married and supports her family by selling clothes and drinks.  She has been in this line of business for 10 years now. She works from 11am to 6pm daily and is able to realize a small monthly profit from her business. 

Mwajuma is now requesting her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner. She will manage to repay back her loan successfully. Her capital base is still small, so she is requesting the loan to restock missing clothes, particularly children’s clothes. She wants to expand her business to improve her life. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Tangini," which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to restock missing clothes, particularly children’s clothes.

loans.name: Racha

texts.en: Racha is a 25 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one child. Her husband represents the income source in the family in order to fulfil their family needs and improve their lifestyle. He sells and repair wooden furniture. And as per her, she doesn’t work, she is only focusing on her family members .Today, she is in need for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the school fees for her child what make her very happy that she will able to ensure hi a suitable education and secure a brilliant future.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for her child

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
This business is a member of Naretoi Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Patricia is an active member of Naretoi Women Group. She is married with 3 children.

Patricia received her first loan from WEEC of USD.300 in 2001. She bought two steers and started her business of making handicraft at home, selling them in Isinya. She then received a loan of USD.600 and bought 4 more steers. To date, she has over 20 steers. She able to pay her children school fees and meet all family requirements. The demand for steers is very high because this area was hit by prolonged drought which forced some cattle keepers to relocate.

loans.use: They plan to improve the type of feeds to counter natural disasters. Therefore, this loan will enable them to buy the improved feeds and buy more steers.

loans.name: Test

texts.en: test

loans.use: testing

loans.name: Khwaja Mohammad

texts.en: Khwaja Mohammad S/O A. Hakim lives is District 15 of Kabul and is married. He runs a shop where he sells blankets and shoes. He buys blankets from Pakistani traders and sells them at the market. His business did not start well because he had little money, and so had few items to sell, therefore less customers. He heard about the AFSG loan program from a friend and decided to participate so he can develop his business. He is requesting a loan so he can increase his stock and reach more customers. This will improve his business and help him develop more trade.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and blankets

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Mrs. Lun S. is 47 years old.  She is married and a mother of three children.  She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. She works for a small restaurant in the area as a chef and earns about $1.5/day in revenue. Her husband is a construction foreman and typically makes about $5/day. Two of her children are construction workers, while the other is a student.  Lun Sintharn is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy her husband some contruction tools and wood frames for his job. She hopes the loan will provide the family an opportunity to improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase wood frames and other construction tools for her husband's business

loans.name: Paletina

texts.en:
Paletina joined the programme in June 2007. She is married with four children. Her husband also works but his salary does not meet their family's daily needs. She decided to join SPBD because she deeply believed that she could earn money if she opted to do something for herself.

She now runs her own barbeque stall along the side of the road leading to the international airport. Paletina has many plans for the future but for now, she is considering setting up a small shop beside her stall.

loans.use: To  help with her barbeque stall.

loans.name: Marina Victoria

texts.en:
Since she was very young Marina had to face great adversities and until now, thanks to her strength of character, she has been able to overcome them. One of the greatest challenges and battles that she had to take on was raising her children, alone with out any help, after they were abandoned by her partner. This man decided to run away more than 8 years ago, leaving them completely abandoned. Regardless, Marina has known how to overcome adversity and to continue moving forward with the help of her family. Thanks to this she was able to open a small grocery store in her house. This business is helping her to provide for the studies of her children and to cover the expenses of the home.

Now she is beginning to face new challenges due to the decision of her children to undertake studies in the university of her small city. This decision increases Marina’s happiness and also her worry because she has to find a way to cover the increased expenses that are her children are going to generate over time. It is for this reason that Marina asks for the sum of $200 in order to put a juice maker in her store and increase income. With your help and the strength and diligence of a mother we can convert her dreams into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein.

Doña Marina desde muy joven tuvo que pasar por muchas adversidades en la vida y hasta ahora gracias a su entereza ha podido sobrellevarlas.Una de las más grandes adversidades y luchas que tuvo que asumir sola sin ninguna ayuda es la crianza de sus hijos frente al abandono de su pareja, ya que este sujeto decidió huir hace más de 8 años y dejó a sus hijos en completo abandono.Sin embargo, ha sabido sobreponerse y salir adelante con el apoyo de su familia, gracias a ello pudo abrir una pequeña bodega en su casa y ésta le ha ayudado a solventar los estudios de sus hijos y los gastos de su hogar.Ahora comienza a tener nuevos retos debido a la decisión de sus hijos de emprender una carrera universitaria en su pequeña ciudad. Esta decisión acrecenta la felicidad y preocupación de Marina porque tiene que empezar a ver la forma de solventar los gastos que irán generando sus hijos con el transcurso del tiempo.Es por ello que solicita la suma de 200 dólares para implementar una juguería en su pequeña tienda con el fin de obtener mayores ingresos.Con tu colaboración y el esfuerzo de esta diligente madre podremos convertir sus anhelos en realidad

loans.use: Purchase of parts for the installation of a juice maker in her small store.

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en: Koreti K. is  35 years old and married. She is a creative lady capable in making and designing elei (a traditional Samoan fabric) materials and she wishes to use her talent to earn a living. She has applied for this loan in order to buy the materials she needs, such as paints, brushes, and fabrics. Koreti delivers her products to big shops in town. She works  three days per week and make a profit of 260 Tala ($104 USD) per day. Koreti is very proud of her business especially now that she has some financial support through loans.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her elei (traditional Samoan fabric) printing

loans.name: Tushikamane A Group

texts.en:
Mwashamba S., age 23, is married with 1 child (2 years old) and also takes care of her mother. Mwashamba owns a water and ice cream business which she started almost 2 years ago. Working from 8am-10pm daily, she earns about $264 a month from this business.

Mwashamba is the leader of Subgroup A of Group Tushikamane (Swahili for “Be Together”), which totals 40 members. She will be sharing this loan with subgroup members Asha M., Zaria M., Tatu S. and Retisia W., who have businesses dealing in selling food.

Mwashamba hopes for a loan to purchase more ice cream ingredients.

In the picture, Mwashamba is standing on the left.

loans.use: To buy more ice cream ingredients

loans.name: Hoindossi

texts.fr:
Madame K. Hoindossi est une femme très dévouée. Mariée à un cultivateur, elle est mère de cinq (05) enfants et a à sa charge deux (2) petites sœurs en apprentissage. Elle peine énormément pour couvrir les dépenses de la famille car son activité de vente de produits de première nécessité ne rapporte pas assez car elle manque de moyens. Malgré que ce commerce soit florissant, Madame K. n’en jouit pas convenablement. Voulant renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un financement de $400 pour agrandir son étalage et s’approvisionner en produits alimentaires afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. L’octroi de ce crédit lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Hoindossi K. is a very dedicated woman. Married to a farmer, she is mother to five children and supports her two younger sisters who are apprentices. She has great difficulty covering the family expenses, as her business—selling basic products—does not bring in sufficient revenue due to a lack of financial resources. Despite the fact that her business is flourishing, Madame K. could make more of it. Wishing to strengthen her business, she is requesting a $400 loan to expand her display of goods and stock up on food products in order to meet the needs of her clientele. The granting of this loan will help Madame K. to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Katogo D(2056)B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Justine N.. She is currently in the business of selling new shoes and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Justine is 21 years old and is married. She has 3 children ranging from age 6 months to 3 years and her older two children go to school. With the extra business profits from her loan, Christine hopes to be able to pay the rent for a full-sized shop.

Justine is joined in her small group by Cissy M., Christine N., Sauda B., and Babirye N.. Cissy M. has a business selling fruit and wants to add to her business. Christine N. is currently operating a business selling sweet potatoes and wants a loan to expand businesss. Sauda B. operates a business of new clothing sales and wants to expand business. Babirye N. is currently in the business of making and selling paper bags and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her shoe selling business

loans.name: Teolinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Teolina P. Santillán is a partner in the Sarita Colonia Community Bank. She lives in the San Martín region of Mariscal Cáceres in the Juanjui district. She makes and sells chifles (fried banana chips), empanadas (fried pastries with meat filling), and regional fruit drinks which she prepares in her own home and sells in the city at the Alameda, where athletes meet daily to play. With a loan of $625, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy bunches of green bananas, liters of cooking oil, sacks of potatoes, hundreds of regional fruits, plastic bags, disposable plates, a variety of condiments like mayonnaise, ketchup, and mustard to accompany her dishes, as well as firewood and a cooler to preserve her food and to provide sanitary conditions and a high quality product. She is 43 years old and, along with her husband and her daughter, she is happy and satisfied with the business she has developed. She longs for a kiosk where she can offer a variety of snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Teolinda P. Santillán es una socia del Banco Comunal “Sarita Colonia”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chifles, empanadas y refrescos de frutas de la región, que los prepara en su propia casa y los comercializa en la Alameda de la ciudad donde diariamente se reúnen los deportistas a jugar. Con el crédito de S/.1,700.00, el cual sera pagado en 4 meses comprará plátanos verdes en racimos, aceite en litros, papas en sacos, frutas de la región en cientos, bolsas de plástico, platos descartables, diversas cremas como mayonesa, kepchu, mostaza para acompañar sus productos, también leña en tercios, y una caja térmica para conservar sus productos, para así ofrecer un producto higiénico y de buena calidad Tiene 43 años, junto a su esposo y su hija se siente feliz y satisfecha con el negocio que desarrolla y anhela tener un kiosco en el que pueda ofrecer refrigerios variados

loans.use: To purchase bananas, potatoes, fruits, etc. to make  and sell snacks.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa Isabel R. C. is 45 years old: she studied up until the fifth grade of primary school. She has six children in total, but only four are still dependent on her. She lives in Chogoyape in the district of Paiján in the province of Ascope in the department of La Libertad – Perú.

Rosa Isabel began her business selling a few vegetables to her neighbours and acquaintances, and with the passage of time she was able to secure a stall at the “El Tambo” market, in the district of Paiján, where she sells merchandise such as vegetables, salads and condiments. She constantly travels to Trujillo district in order to buy vegetables and spices to grind wholesale.

See joined the Community Bank “Manos Unidas” where she obtained her first loan of 300 Soles, using this money to buy a variety of vegetables by the sack.

With this loan of 800 Soles, which she will repay within six months, she will buy: 20 Kg. of carrot, 25 packets of coriander and spring onions, celery, leeks and other vegetables as well as all types of condiments.

Her dearest wish is to expand her business and see her children become professionals.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rosa Isabel R. C. tiene 45 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria. Tiene seis hijos en total pero cuatro aun dependen de ella. Vive en Chogoyape en el distrito de Paiján en la provincia de Ascope en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

La señora Rosa Isabel inicia su negocio ofreciendo y vendiendo un poco de verduras a sus vecinos y conocidos, al pasar el tiempo logra conseguir un puesto en el mercado “El Tambo” en el distrito de Paiján, lugar donde ofrece sus productos como verdura, ensaladas, condimentos. Viaja constantemente al distrito de Trujillo para comprar al por mayor las verduras y especias para los molidos.

Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 este dinero lo utilizo para comprar una variedad de verduras por sacos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual pagara en seis meses comprará: 20 Kg. de zanahoria, 25 paquetes de culantro y cebolla china, apio y poro, y otras verduras además todo tipo de condimentos.

Su mayor sueño es ampliar mas su negocio y ver a sus hijos profesionales.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi T., 51 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 1997. Two among 4 of her chilren are still going to school. At first, Mrs. T. used 100 USD borrowed from the Fund to breed pigs. Then, since her house is now facing the National Road, she decides to invest in opening food shop and general store. Because of good location, she has a lot of customers. Her current average income is 220 USD/ month. This time, she wants to borrow 625 USD to buy more food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị T., 51 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1997. 2 trong số 4 người con của chị đang đi học. Số tiền 100USD vay ở vòng đầu tiên được chị T. đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Sau một thời gian, nhà nước mở đường quốc lộ đi qua trước nhà, chị vay vốn lớn đầu tư kinh doanh ăn uống và bán hàng tạp hóa. Nhờ địa thế thuận lợi nên rất đông khách đến với cửa hàng. Thu nhập hàng tháng hiện nay của gia đình là 220USD. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 625USD để mua thực phẩm làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy food

loans.name: Gaibullo

texts.ru:
Gaibullo S. lives in the area of Shahrinav. He has a high school degree with a special focus on driving. He works as the driver of a fixed-route taxi. He rents the taxi which is a "Gazelle". A repair of the running part of the vehicle is necessary. By receiving the loan he can make a major repair on the vehicle. Therefore he has asked Kiva to help. He plans to extinguish the credit within 12 months. Gaibullo has a great family, and is married with four children.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Сангинов Гайбулло житель района Шахринау. Имеет средне специальное образование. По профессии водитель. Так и работает шофером маршрутного такси. Арендует маршрутку марки «Газель». Необходим ремонт ходовой части автомашины . Получив кредит он сможет сделать капитальный ремонт. Поэтому он к нам и обратился. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 12 месяцев. Гайбулло имеет большую семью. Он женат и имеет четверых детей.

loans.use: Purchase of auto parts for vehicle repair

loans.name: Wadjindé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Wadjindé A. was born in 1964 in the village of Logodomé. Married to a farmworker, she has focused on growing corn for more than two decades. The income she makes from this business is almost entirely eaten up by the daily household expenses, since her husband’s income is very inadequate. She therefore lacks any working capital and is requesting a loan in order to boost her business. This will enable her to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Wadjindé est née en 1964 dans le village de Logodomé. Mariée à un cultivateur, elle s’est donnée au commerce de maïs depuis une vingtaine d’années. Le revenu qu’elle tire de cette activité est quasiment consommé par les dépenses quotidiennes du ménage parce que le revenu de son mari est très insuffisant. Ainsi, elle manque de fonds de roulement et sollicite un crédit pour ce relancer. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer la qualité de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell corn

loans.name: Niza

texts.es:
Mrs. Niza is a member of the Ricardo Palma Communal bank, located in Jr. Cesar Calvo #349, Calleria District in the Department of Ucayali. She is 62 years old, mother of 6 children, and her husband works for a natural gas company. With the first loan Niza received from Manuela Ramos of $125, she invested in her store. Niza started her business with a few products, and today has a variety of products. Day by day, she improves her business a little bit more.

With this loan of $700, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy drinks, a box of milk, 1 sack of sugar, rice, sweets, and other general items. Niza is totally happy as a businesswoman, but as a mother, this business has allowed her to tend and oversee the care of the home, and especially her children, who, as a result of her business, are always together.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Niza pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, ubicado en el Jr. Cesar Calvo # 349, Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 62 años y es madre D. 6 hijos, su esposo trabaja en una compañía D. gas D. camisea. Niza con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en su bodega. Niza Cuenta empezó el negocio con algunos productos pero hoy pueD. tener una variedad D. productos que día a día va implementado su negocio cada vez más. Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará bebidas, caja D. leche, 1 saco D. azúcar, arroz, golosinas, pasamanería y otros. Niza esta totalmente feliz como negociante pero ala vez como madre dado que este negocio le permite atender o ver los quehaceres D. la casa y en especial D. sus hijos y producto D. ellos siempre están unidos.

loans.use: Purchase of products in bulk (general goods)

loans.name: Rous

texts.en:
Rous S. is a 61 year old woman living in Penh, Cambodia. She is a widow and sells Khmer cake from her home to earn a living and is able to make $6 per day. She has two children, one works at garment factory while the other sells fruit at a market. Mrs. Rous would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for her son’s commute to work. This will save her son money that would be spent on taxi fare bringing fruit to and from the market.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son's commute to work.

loans.name: Esmira

texts.en: Esmira M. was born in 1966. She comes from the little town Jelah which is well known as a very commercial area. Esmira is the mother of three school-aged children. Her husband is a mechanic, and he has garage by his house and Esmira works at home. They are able to take care of their three children and earn enough for their living. Esmira is an accountant for a few little companies and stores at her place. She would like to expand her business, as she has more time now because their children are not so little any more. She decided to buy better equipment and needed materials to be able to get more clients. Esmira takes her second loan (the first was for the beginning of her business) in WWI in the amount of 1500 KM. She hopes to develop her business and provide a job for their children in the future.

loans.use: Esmira would like to buy better equipment for the small accounting business she runs out of her home.

loans.name: Téning

texts.fr: Téning Wagué, 38 ans, mariée, 02 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter des arachides qu’elle va décortiquer et transformer en pâte d’arachide pour vendre sur une table avec d'autres produits comme des légumes et du poisson séché. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui lui permet de participer aux charges familiales. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Téning Wagué, 38 years old, is married and is taking care of 2 children. She has been a member of the village bank Sinthiang Coundara for 5 1/2 years. She wants to buy peanuts that she will transform into peanut butter to sell on a table with other products such as vegetables and dried fish. She wants to reinforce her activity to contribute to the family expenses. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed in 6 months in only one repayment.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make peanut butter

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong T. is a 44 year old rice farmer. He lives in Pursat Province, west of Phnom Penh City. He has been farming rice since 1984. He is married and has five children, all of whom live in the family home. Two of the children are garment workers and three are in school. His wife is a grocery seller who sells many kinds of products in her village. 

To increase family income, Kong T. needs a loan for his wife's business to purchase more grocery inventory to sell. His wife is pictured above because Kong T. was not available in that time.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery inventory to sell.

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.es:
El señor Ponciano tiene 61 años, esta casado y tiene cinco hijos, varios nietos, que son su razón de vivir. Hoy tiene su propio negocio y gracias a ello ha podido educar a todos sus hijos que hasta hoy en día van a la universidad.
El negocio es familiar, todos ayudan en la atención de los clientes cuando no están estudiando, hace 16 años que recibe el apoyo de la Fundación Paraguaya y esta muy agradecido por ello.
Su deseo es seguir progresando y que sus hijos puedan lograr tener una educación superior a la que El no alcanzó.
texts.en:
Ponciano is 61 years old and married with five children and several grandchildren, whom are his reason for living. Thanks to having his own business, he has been able to educate all of his children, some of whom are still attending university today. His business is a family business. When they are not studying, everyone helps with customers. It has been 16 years since he received help from the Paraguayan Foundation and he is very grateful. He hopes to continue growing and hopes that his children can achieve a higher level of education than he was able to.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, milk, pasta, rice, bread, dairy products, meat, etc. for his store

loans.name: Paskazia

texts.en: Paskazia V. is a Tanzanian woman. She runs a shop at Buza ward in Dar es Salaam. She is married with four school children. She sells a varieties of commodities, which she purchases from the wholesale shops scattered around the city and sometimes directly from the producers. She plans to run a wholesale shop, but funding is a problem. Paskazia V. is requesting a loan of T.shs 600,000 ($450.00) to help her develop this business.

loans.use: Buy additional stock

loans.name: Mok

texts.en: Mok M. is 30 years old. Mok has three children and lives in the Siem Reap province with her husband. She grows rice and her husband fishes. Mok M. is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase wooden boat and fishing tools. She believes this will help expand her business and grow future profits.

loans.use: To purchase wooden boat and fishing tools.

loans.name: Ganyo

texts.fr:
Marié et père de quatre (04) enfants, Mr Ganyo K. est un cultivateur de 31 ans. Malgré sa volonté, sa capacité et sa force de travail, il n’a que de faibles rendements à la fin de chaque campagne agricole à cause de l’infertilité de sa surface cultivable. 
A cet effet, il sollicite un financement pour s’acheter de l’engrais afin d’améliorer sa productivité les saisons à venir. Ce financement lui donnera l’opportunité de jouir de ses potentialités et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Ganyo K. is 31 years old, married, and the father of 4 children. He's a farmer who, in spite of his will, capability and work strength, only gets low crop yields due to the infertility of the area he cultivates. He is therefore seeking a loan to purchase fertilizers, in order to increase his production for the coming seasons. This loan will give him the opportunity to enjoy his potential and to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Undrahbayar

texts.en:
Undrahbayar C. lives with her husband and three teenage children who attend the local high school in UvUrhangay, one of Mongolia's southern provinces.  In 2004, she and her husband rented a small stall in the local market and started a retail business in second-hand clothes, purchasing the clothes from wholesalers who import them from South Korea. They started the business with 50,000 MNT ($1 USD=1,500 MNT) and since then, the business capital has increased to 4,300,000 MNT. 

In 2007, because of their business' growth, they rented one more stall to sell the clothes, their dream being to afford a college education for each of their children. Undrahbayar is now requesting a loan to buy more second-hand clothes for her two stalls at the local market.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for the business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Mrs. Julieta B. is recognized as a regular member of Paglaum MPC since she became a member in November 2002. She resides at Barangay Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. The whole family has membership in the co-op and are all MIGS members in good standing. Julieta has obtained previous loans and has never defaulted in their repayment.

This is her twelfth loan. She is very happy managing her sari-sari store and prays that someday she will be able to grow her business significantly. She is thankful to God that there is Paglaum MPC to offer financial assistance to people who want to change their lives from a state of financial hardship to a better standard of living.

loans.use: To gain additional capital from her sari-sari store by purchasing grocery items.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Ernesto y su señora esposa Lourdes  Martínez viven en la ciudad de Morelos, Coahuila.
El trabaja para una agencia de transportes en Nava, Coahuila (cerca de su ciudad de residencia), desde hace 9 años, desempeñándose en el área de operador.
Ella esta a cargo del hogar y de la familia, ellos demostrando una gran estabilidad en su matrimonio luchan por brindarle a sus hijos una mayor comodidad en casa; este es el motivo por el cual tramitan este crédito, para la colocación de una losa de concreto de un cuarto en construcción para la ampliación de las recamaras.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Ernesto and his wife Lourdes Martínez live in the city of Morelos, Coahuila. For nine years he has worked as an operator for a transport company in Nava, Coahuila (close to where they live); she is a homemaker. Together they provide a united front to provide a stable and comfortable home for their children. This is the reason they are applying for the loan; they need to complete the roof in one of the rooms under construction to enlarge the rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete the roof in one of the rooms under construction.

loans.name: Hector Otoniel

texts.es: Señor Hector Otoniel A.  de Sesenta y cuatro Años de Edad es originario de la Zona 2 del departamento de Totonicapn ser una persona profesional el comenta ha su edad la vida le ha regalado mucho en donde ha puesto su propio negocio y que sus hijos todos son profesionales, hoy que don Hector esta jubilado se ha dedicado mas a su negocio, hoy necesita de un credito para surtir de  diverentes  productos de la canasta basica y a proyectado con el credito la entrega de los productos en las tiendas.
texts.en:
Hector Otoniel A., age 64, is originally from Zone 2 of Totonicapan department. He is a working professional; he comments that at his age life has given him a lot, in that he owns his own business and his children are all professionals. Today Hector is retired, but continues to dedicate himself to his business. He needs a loan to stock different household goods and he has planned the loan for the delivery of these products in the stores.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Razia Maqsood Group

texts.en:
Adeeba baji wants a loan to buy electrical items (fridge, and television) for her electrical items business.

Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy tools for her motor-repair workshop.

Azra baji wants a loan to buy iron for making iron rods to sell.

Irshad baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread, clothes and beads) for her embroidered-clothes business. 
 
My name is Razia and I have belonged to a city named Lahore, Pakistan, for the past ten years. My husband’s name is M. and he has a musical band. They go to functions like birthdays and weddings and perform for them and earn income. I run a business sewing clothes and use the earning to pay for the utilities. I am applying for a loan to buy a guitar for my husband’s band.

loans.use: To buy a guitar for her husband's band

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es: Yamileth es soltera, de 51 años de edad, trabaja como Delegada de Educacion en el Municipio de Santo Tomas, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores los que habitan con ella, aportan para los gastos del hogar, tiene un horario de trabajo de 8 a 5 pm. En tiempos normales, pero la mayoria del tiempo no tiene horario de salida, esta solicitando su 1er credito para utilizarlo para cambiar el techo de su casa, ya que esta bastante deteriorado y con el invierno se moja, pues quiere que sus hijos, sus nietos y ella tener un poco de tranquilidad en este invierno.  Se le conoce como una persona responsable, honesta y con muchos deseos de superacion.
texts.en:
Yamileth is 51-years old and unmarried. She works as Education Representative in the Santo Tomas municipality. She has 3 grown-up children who live with her and help out with household expenses. Yamileth's work schedule is from 8:00 to 5:00 p.m. during normal times, but usually she doesn't have a set schedule. She is requesting her first loan to replace the roof of her home. It is rather run down and leaks in the winter, so she wants her children and grandchildren to have peace of mind this winter. Yamileth is known as a responsible, honest person with a sincere desire to overcome any challenges.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of the roof of her house

loans.name: Munisa

texts.en:
Munisa S. is 46 years old. She started her own business two years ago in order to support her husband with the family's expenses. She is a market vendor in Istaravshan town. 

Munisa purchases sweets from a local confectioner and sells them in the local market as a wholesale. Munisa, being very polite and talkative by nature, has a lot of customers, which allows her to sell her goods immediately. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. 

Munisa is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of $600 USD to increase the inventory she has for sale. One of her plans for the future is to open a vending facility in order to expand her business. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Munisa reach all of her aspirations. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Enlarging the range of goods and purchasing a private store with the increased revenue

loans.name: Milagro Group

texts.es: El grupo el Milagro esta conformado por Juana Esperanza L., Rosa linda F. R., María Nela N. A., María de los Ángeles
texts.en: The El Milagro Group is made up of Juana Esperanza L., Rosa linda F. R., María Nela N. A., María de los Ángeles

loans.use: Buy beef, corn, rice, chile peppers and firewood

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a timber converter. She buys timber and takes it to the saw mill for conversion. She is 53 years old and married with six children. She hopes for a loan amount of 70000 NGN to purchase more timber. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase timber to take to the saw mill for conversion

loans.name: Filomena

texts.pt:
Filomena nasceu na província central de Sofala, de 53 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos todos com mais de 18 anos. Estudou ate 4 classe, no tempo colonial português e tendo parado por falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores.
Vive somente com os filhos e sem ninguém na sua responsabilidade financeira.

Saiu de Sofala no ano de 1978 com o marido para Maputo. Filomena foi militar e saiu da tropa no ano de 1981com direito a pensão no valor de 5.500,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e construção da sua casa de alvenaria, não consegue poupar.
Filomena ouviu falar da Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigas e outros vizinhos que lhe encorajaram no sentido de contraiu empréstimo para acelerar com a construção da sua casa. Nunca teve empréstimos em bancos. Este vai ser o primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra de cimento, areia e pedra para avançar com outra fase se construção na sua casa.

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos e sonha ver a sua casa terminada e sua família confortada.
texts.en:
Filomena was born in Sofala, in central Mozambique. She is a 53 year old single mom of 4, all of them over 18. She finished 4th grade during the Portuguese colonial times, and had to drop school because of her parents financial problems. She lives with her children and no one helps her financially. Filomena was in the military, and when she retired in 1981 she earned a pension in the value of 5.500,00MT (around U$ 180) per month, money that she uses to support her family and build her house, and she is not able to save any money. Filomena heard of Hluvuku-Adsema from friends and other neighbors that incentivated her to apply for a loan, in order to finish the work on her house. She has never borrowed money from banks. This is going to be her first loan, in the amount of $350 to buy cement, sand and rocks. She dreams of seeing her house finished, and her family living there comfortably.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction supplies (concrete, rock, sand)

loans.name: Eron

texts.en: Eron is a 51 single mother of ten children aged between 12 and 30 years. Six of her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Nuru resides and owns a four roomed house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Kireka Nubian Quarters. Eron works seven days a week.  Eron owns stall selling oil (second hand clothes Naguru Market. She buys her clothes from the traders in Nabugabo road in kampala city who imprt those second hand clothes from UK and incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping .  Eron pays monthly market dues as rent .  She sells to all categories of people and on both retail and whole sale and besides this clothing business she also rears chicken Eron has been in this business for eighteen years and with MCDT for eight years servicing her eighteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothes and chicks. Eron is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and start going to import second hand clothes directly..

loans.use: To buy more uesd clothes

loans.name: Noeu

texts.en: Noeu H., age 33, is married to Svay Ran, age 33. She has five single children, most employed as garment workers. She and her husband have been earning a living for many years by planting a rice crop on their own land next to their house. Farming business is very common for poor people who live in the commune. She and her husband have earned a better income since all their children grew up. Noeu H. is looking for a loan to buy a cow because her old cow doesn't support her field work.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Mrs. Khem L. lives in Andoung village in Kandal province. She is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food. She will use the rest of the money to buy fishnets for her husband. Her husband, Mr. Phan Phat, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a fisherman. Mrs. Khem L. is 30 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, pig food, and fishnets.

loans.name: Phourng

texts.en:
Phourng V., 41 years old, is a married woman and the mother of three children. They currently live together in a medium-size old wooden house located in Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. Phourng V. is hired by her neighbors to harvest their crop, while her husband is a motorbike taxi rider.

Phourng V. is taking out her loan to repair her husband’s taxi, which is not attractive to the customers.

loans.use: To repair a motor taxi.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad M. is from the village of Tonggo in Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Trinidad is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Trinidad runs a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Trinidad has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,600 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Trinidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Trinidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC that she used to purchase additional products to sell. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Trinidad's 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: A. Margaret is 38 years old and married with four children, all in school. She manages a retail shop business and she has been doing this for over four years. She is using the loan to purchase a variety of retail items, such as eggs, balls, umbrellas, maize flour, sugar, flasks and so on. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to succeed in whatever she does.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of retail items to sell.

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en: Hagar is a 38-year-old woman. She is married with four children who are currently in school. She lives in Offinsu in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and serves food like rice and stew. She says demand for food is on the higher side but she does not have adequate funds for expansion. She has been in food production for six years. Hagar works but still she can’t increase her output. She wants to use the loan to buy meat and bags of rice to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to help her husband support her family and their education.

loans.use: To buy more rice, vegetables, meat, firewood etc.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina K. is 29 and married with 3 children (ages 5-months - 12 years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Regina has 5 years of experience in this business.  Regina needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 tala or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Regina joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Regina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Regina K. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.87 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Y. Marie-Madeleine

texts.fr: A. Y. Marie-Madeleine est née le 29 Mai 1965 à Dassa-Zoumé dans le département des Collines au Bénin. Mariée à EZIN K. Jérémie, Marie-Madeleine est mère de cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille s'est installée à Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique, il y a 2 ans environs. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Marie-Madeleine a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Marie-Madeleine mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, conserves de tomate, lait, sardine, savons, oeufs, etc.) à Allada. Marie-Madeleine vend de façon secondaire, les produits de poissonnerie. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Marie-Madeleine se ravitaille. Marie-Madeleine a obtenu une fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Désireuse d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et d'élever le niveau de son activité, Marie-Madeleine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
A. Y. Marie-Madeleine was born on May 29, 1965 in Dassa-Zoumé in the province 'Collines' in Bénin. Married to EZIN K. Jérémie, Marie-Madeleine is the mother of 5 children, who are all enrolled in school. The family came to live in Dogoudo in Allada, in the province 'Atlantique' about two years ago. The couple share in supporting the family.

Marie-Madeleine left school when she reached secondary level. To support herself, she sells various items (pasta, tinned tomatoes, milk, sardines, soap, eggs, etc.) in Allada. As a secondary business, she also sells fish. She stocks up in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Marie-Madeleine has already received one loan from ALIDé. Wishing to add to her working capital and bolster the level of her business, she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé so as to better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of pasta, tinned foods, trays of eggs, and soap

loans.name: Ludovina Xavier

texts.pt:
Ludovina Xavier L. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo Nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 37 anos de idade, solteira mae de 2 filhos de 15 e 7 anos de idade todos vao a escola. Frequenta o 2º ano de faculdade na Universiadade pedagogica. Vive na casa propria com os seus filhos e sustenta seus pais enviando lhes dinheiro para a despesas de casa.
 Nunca saiu da Província de Maputo, actualmente vive no bairro Thanda Banto Distrito de Boane, é funcionária do Ministerio da Educaçao há mais de 17 anos. Foi formado pelo Centro de formaçao de professores de Namaacha e pelo Instituto de Magisterio Primario em Boane, trabalha como professora desde 1993 aufere um salario de 6.500.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta Bancaria.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua cunhada que tambem foi cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( azuleijos, blocos, varoes de ferro e outros ) para dar c ontinuidade com a construção da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 12.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt todos para  a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para terminar a sua residencia, iniciar com a construção do murro de vedação para poder ofercer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua familia.
texts.en:
Ludovina Xavier L. was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo province, in the south of Mozambique. She is 37 years old and a single mother of two children ages 15 and 7, both of whom attend school. She is in her second year at the University, studying education. She lives in her own home with her children and also supports her parents, sending them money for household expenses. She has never moved outside the Maputo Province. She lives in the Thanda Banto District neighborhood in Boane. She has been an employee of the Ministry of Education for more than 17 years. She graduated from the Teachers College in Namaacha and from the Institute of Elementary Education in Boane. She has been working as a teacher since 1993 and earns 6.500.00 MT monthly, which she uses for household expenses and also saves a bit in her bank account. She has never had a loan with other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through her sister in law who also was a client of Hluvuku. This is her third loan, for 20.000.00 MT which she will use to purchase construction materials (tiles, cinder blocks, metal rods, etc.) to continue building her home. The previous loans were for 12.000.00 MT and 15.000.00 MT, also for the same purpose. In the future she would like to request more loans to finish her home and to begin construction on an exterior wall to provide her family with better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional wheat flour, rice and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. sells vegetables such as peppers, tomatoes, garden eggs (eggplant) and onions at Jukwa. She has received junior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer.

Yaa provides a helping hand to her husband by paying school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy additional vegetables to sell. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Making and selling cassava flour

loans.name: Anathalie

texts.en:
Anathalie is 42 years old, married with three children; the first born is 13 years old; the following is 8 years old, and the last one is 6 years old. All of them are in school. Anathalie owns a small shop which sells various products such as: biscuits, Highland milk, cosmetic products, bread and so on.  Anathalie has an experience of three years selling these kinds of products as a retailer. She employs one person in her business. She sells to locals and passersby every day from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening.

Anathalie is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business through purchasing more products for resale. If her goals are reached, Anathalie will be able to satisfy her customers by offering good qualities. With this satisfaction for her customers, Anathalie hopes to earn more profits which will help her to pay school fees for her children and to provide all that is necessary for them. With extra money Anathalie expects to buy her own business place.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es: Deisy es una emprendedora mujer de 38 años de edad, ella comparte su vida con su esposo y su hijo Andrés de 10 años,  juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas de 2 años se ha dedicado en la venta de comida, actividad que realiza en su propia casa, preparando los más deliciosos almuerzos para sus fieles clientes. Deisy anticipadamente recibe los pedidos, de esa manera sabe cuanto es la cantidad que debe preparar para el día y así no se arriesga en perder su mercadería. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede disponer de su tiempo y eso la hace sentirse independiente y con esperanzas de darle un futuro mejor a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poner un negocio más fijo como un restaurante, pero por el momento se siente tranquila con su trabajo, pues debe velar por su hijo Andrés que se encuentra en edad escolar. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y asegura que seguirá siendo muy puntual con los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ingredientes en mayor proporción para así preparar cantidad de platillos, de esa manera aumentará sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Deisi, 38, is an enterprising woman. She lives with her husband and her 10-year old son, Andres, in a house they own. She has operated a business selling prepared food for more than 2 years. It's work that she can do at home, making delicious lunches for her loyal customers. She receives orders for meals in advance so she knows just how much food to prepare for any given day, a practice that allows her to avoid wasting any. She likes the work a lot because she can decide how best to use her time, something that gives her a degree of independence but still allows her to contribute to the family income. She hopes to set up a restaurant eventually but, for now, she is happy with the business as it is because it allows her to watch over her son, Andres, who is still in school. This is Deisi's second MFP loan and she is committed to repaying it on time. She will use the loan to buy wholesale supplies of ingredients so that she can increase the number of meals she prepares and, in turn, her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana Isabel de 24 años de edad es soltera, habita en el municipio de Nueva Guinea junto a su familia compuesta por su abuelita y su niño de 7 añitos que estudia 2do grado de primaria. Desde muy pequeña se ha dedicado al comercio y gracias al apoyo recibido por su mamá que habita en Estados Unidos y un pequeño ahorro que tenia Ana inicio su propio negocio desde hace 8 años, en el que comercializa ropa nacional, ropa de marca, zapatos, alhajas etc.  

Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de fortalecer su inventario comprando ropa, zapatos de nuevos estilos y otros cositas que le permitirian satifasfer la demanda de su clientes y poder diversificar más su negocio.  En su comunidad es conocida como una joven emprendedora  que siempre ha luchado para salir adelante con su familia.  Ademas tiene un alto espiritu de superacion pues acutalmente esta estudiando la carrera de Farmacia en la universidad UDO.  

Su mayor sueño es coronar su carrera, que su hijo sea un hombre de bien y ver crecer su negocio, ya que es el patrimonio que dejara a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel is 24 years old, single, and lives in the municipality of Nueva Guinea with her grandmother and her 7-year-old son who is in 2nd grade. Since very young she has been a merchant and thanks to the support from her mother who lives in the U.S.A. and her personal savings she set up her own business 8 years ago, where she sells brand clothing, shoes, jewellery, etc.

This is her first loan and it will be invested in increasing her stock, buying clothes, shoes in fashion and other objects in order to meet the demands of the customers and diversify her business. In her community she is known as an entrepreneurial young lady who has always fought to get ahead with her family. She also has a great spirit of self-improvement and presently she is studying pharmacy at the university UDO.

It is her dream to graduate, that her son become a good man and to see her business grow as it is the patrimony for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam R. is from the village of Gingoog City. She is 40 years old. Meriam is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Meriam owns & operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Meriam has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Meriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meriam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Meriam is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Meriam from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi 2 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de SESSO dans la préfecture de SAN, région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 49   ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles cultivent essentiellement de l’arachide.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne.
AISSATA SEYDOU D., qui est la présidente du groupe, compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles, au grand marché de TENE. Après l’hivernage, la récolte est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de TENE, de MOPTI et dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 15000 à 36000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi 2 is a grouping of married women in the village of SESSO in the prefecture of San, which lies in the region of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women live in traditional families, average 49 years of age and have an average of at least five children each. They cultivate primarily peanuts. Since they are concerned with making their agricultural operations profitable, the group's members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their first farming loan. Aissata Seydou D., who is the president of the group, is planning on using her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut grains, as well as small equipment and agricultural inputs, at the large market in Tene. After the winter the crop is stocked for a certain amount of time in order to gain value before being sold at the large market in Tene, Mopti and surrounding markets, on a retail basis (and often on a wholesale basis) for cash to a customer base originating primarily from large towns. The group members are expecting to make a profit of 15,000 to 36,000FCFA, following the sale of their agricultural products; this will be used to repay the interest on the loan and to cover the daily family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of intrants, grains and small equipment

loans.name: Jenipher Achieng

texts.en:
Jenipher Achieng O. stays in Manyatta, Kisumu. She started a charcoal selling business in 2006 to generate income to help her husband in supporting their four children.

She buys her stock daily in Kibuye market and, despite the income generated from her business, she wishes to expand it and buy livestock. Therefore she has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the KMET-Kiva micro finance initiative for that.

She is 38 years old and her dream is to buy a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: Expand business with purchase of livestock

loans.name: Marioly Maria

texts.es:
Marioly de 36 años, tiene una tienda pequeña, vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo de Guayaquil. 

Ella comenzó con una vitrina vendiendo dulces y bebidas, poco a poco fue surtiendo su local con víveres, hasta ahora que tiene una pequeña tienda surtida en la parte delantera de su casa vende dulces, bebidas, granos. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Ella quiere surtir mas su tienda por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo vitrinas, y arroz. En el futuro quiere comprar una camioneta para vender arroz por quintal.
texts.en:
Marioly is 36 years old, has a small store, and lives in an urban area named Guasmo of Guayaquil.

She started selling candies and beverages in a display cabinet and little by little began supplying her shop with supplies. Now she has a small store located on the front part of her home and sells candies, beverages, and grains. She works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. everyday.

She wants to supply her store with more goods which is why she wants to buy more display cabinetss and rice with her loan. In the future she wants to buy a truck to sell rice in lots of 100lbs.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of display cabinets and rice.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes C. is a married woman who lives in Park Punta, Barangay Hilutungan, Bantayan, Cebu City. She earns her living by operating a fishing business.  Her husband, Santos C., who is 39 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 12 and 13 years old. 

Mercedes joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mercedes has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 11,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $170, raising the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more fishing gear and equipment so that she can continue to save up for future tuition fees and for daily expenses. Mercedes C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna P. is from the village of Bonfal Proper, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old. Myrna is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a vending business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of fruits and vegetables for sale. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Myrna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Saeeda's Group

texts.en:
Saeeda is the resident of Borewala, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its shrines. 
Saeeda is a 39 year old, uneducated lady. She loved getting an education when she was young but, unfortunately, her parents couldn’t fulfill her wish due to their poor financial condition.
   
Saeeda got married at the age of 20 and has given birth to four children. Her elder son runs a small bakery in the market where he sells ready-made baked items such as breads, biscuits and cakes on order. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her son’s business. With the loan amount her son will buy bread, biscuits and cakes in bulk quantities for his bakery. 

Saeeda is very supportive person and she is always ready to help her family in improving their living standards. She hopes that her son will get good profits from his business by making an investment towards it. 

Note: “In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Saeeda”.

loans.use: To buy bakery items for reselling.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old. She lives with her son in the village of Sasape Viejo in Tucume, a traditionally rural district where many residents raise animals for a living.

Maria is a seamstress. She has been operating a small business out of her home for the last twenty years, providing individual tailoring and repair services to her neighbors and friends. She also sews commercial clothing which she sells to the local markets.

Maria is requesting this loan in order to purchase additional fabric and other supplies so that she can expand her offerings and meet her clientele's demands. She hopes that she will be able to make a bulk purchase in order to increase her profit margin and subsequently improve her family’s well being.

Maria doesn’t have any other outstanding loans. She is well recommended by her friends and neighbors. She is a very hardworking and dedicated woman.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabric and other supplies so that she can expand her offerings

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen L. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more tomatoes to sell.  Hellen is 37 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has three children who are in school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. For over a year, he has been wholesaling and retailing clothes at the market and to his neighbours and passersby. James faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business, and his greatest monthly expense is transportation.

Hoping to increase his stock, he is requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to purchase a bale of clothes and shoes for resale. James decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie E. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 50 years old,  married, and has five adult children. To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and junk foods in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. This loan will be Elsie's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Zuurakul's Group

texts.en:
Zuurakul B. is 42 years old, and she is married to an excavator operator. The couple is bringing up four children: three daughters and a son. All of them are students except the youngest daughter who is only two years old.

For seventeen years the family has made their living through cattle breeding. Animal fattening and resale makes it possible to make a profit. As a result, the family has managed to celebrate a daughter's wedding and to prepare a dowry of 16,000 KGS.  

Zuurakul intends to increase the family budget by increasing their cattle stock. For this reason she wants to purchase livestock animals with the sum of 20,000 KGS and to spend the rest of the money on buying coal for the winter. For her plans to come true, she needs a loan. In the future, her aim is to give a proper education to her children, and then to obtain a car.

	--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and coal for the winter

loans.name: Eliana Cinthya

texts.es:
Eliana es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedoras, tiene 20 años, es conviviente y tiene 1 hija de 7 meses de nacida. Se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas caballeros y niños por pedidos.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá para surtir su mercadería ahora que se acerca la campaña navideña.
Eliana antes tenia un puesto de ropa y lo cerró, le sale mas a cuenta atender sólo pedidos y le va bien le pagan en forma semanal.
Le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque comparte gratos momentos con sus compañeras , aprende mucho en las capacitaciones que recibe de su promotora, accede al crédito y puede ahorrar. 
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y poder abrir una tienda propia de prendas de vestir.
texts.en: Elian is a member of the communal bank "Emprendedoras."  She is 20 years old, lives with her partner, and has a 7 month old daughter.  She sells women's, men's, and children's clothing by order.  She will invest the loan she is taking out to stock her merchandise now that it is almost Christmas.  Eliana used to have a clothing stand that she closed because it is more profitable for her to take orders.  This is going well for her and she is paid weekly.  She likes the meetings with her communal bank because she has a good time with her friends and learns a lot in the trainings she gets from her promoter.  She can accesses loans and save.  Her dream is to grow her business and be able to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Tseveen

texts.en: Tseveen B. is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in a rented enclosure. Tseveen manages a shoemaking business in his home with help of his wife.
