He started his business in 2008 and has since built a stable operation. He can produce about 8-10 pairs of shoes per month which he sells at the local market, earning between 150,000 and 180,000 MNT profit monthly. His earnings have enabled him to open a saving account for him and his child. For the future, Tseveen says, "I plan to save enough money so that I can afford to buy my own plot of land and enclosure for my family." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary tools, materials such as leathers, and other supplies used in making his shoes.

loans.use: to purchase necessary tools and materials

loans.name: Florence Eshun Araba

texts.en:
Florence Eshun Araba A. prepares 'banku' (fermented corn dough) and sells it, together with fried fish and pepper sauce, at Elmina.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a secretary. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

 Her loan will serve as working capital to buy more bags of maize to cook 'banku' for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a cafeteria.

loans.use: to use as increased capital to buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Efrain Ponciano

texts.es:
Efraín, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, tiene 37 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos (los dos menores de edad), quienes son su motivación de seguir trabajando, vive en la Zona de La Flor, distrito de Carabayllo. 
Efraín trabaja para poder solventar los gastos familiares. Lleva 2 años estudiando en el Instituto CAPECO, la carrera de Técnico en Construcción Civil. 
Una de sus metas es poder terminar su carrera y que sus hijos estén orgullosos de él. 
Con el préstamo solicitado desea pagar la matrícula y sus pensiones.
texts.en:
Efraín, is a hard-working, tenacious, 37 year old man. He is married with two young children, who are his motivation to continue working. He lives in Zona de La Flor in the Carabayllo district.
Efraín works so that he can meet his family's living costs. He has been studying for two years at the CAPECO Institute, on a Civil Engineering Technician course.
One of his goals is to be able to finish his course and that doing so will make his sons proud of him.
He wishes to use the requested loan to pay his registration fees and his lodgings.

loans.use: To pay registration fees and lodgings

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Esperanza” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní en el Asentamiento Santa Rosa. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas de comestibles.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Este comité está empezando con el primer ciclo, con muchas ganas de sobresalir adelante con este grupo.
La sra. Maria Paulina es la presidenta del comité y ella posee una despensa en su domicilio donde provee de comestibles a todos sus vecinos, pero necesita cargar más productos a su despensa para poder cubrir mejor las necesidades de sus clientes. Por ello solicita el crédito, para poder adquirirlo.
texts.en: “La Esperanza” [Hope] Group was formed by several neighbors from the city of Santaní in the Santa Rosa district. All the members of the group carry out independent business activities, such as food sales. The members form a tight-knit group capable of working together to strengthen their camaraderie. This group is starting their first loan cycle, and is looking forward to improving their lives through the group. Maria Paulina is the group's president and she has a grocery store in her house where she provides consumable goods to all her neighbors, but she needs to get more products for her store so she can better meet the needs of her customers. She is requesting the loan in order to obtain them.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, fruits, bread products, and consumable goods in general.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Mr. Benito F., 61 years old, is married and lives in Burgos, Oroquieta City. His source of income comes from a sari-sari (general store) business. His wife is very supportive of him; in fact, she's the one who oversees the business from time to time. 

The business started when Benito became a member of Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative. Financial Assistance was provided by the cooperative. He has obtained loans several times already.

Today, Benito applies for PHP 14,900 to buy additional working capital for his sari-sari store business. In the future, the couple dreams of having a mini grocery someday.

loans.use: To buy additional working capital.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana, de 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la  selva tropical peruana, ubicada en la comunidad de Sirenachayocc anexo del distrito de Quimbiri, donde tienen su techo propio construido a base de madera y techo de calamina. Debido a la crisis nacional que aquejaba nuestro país en los años 80, la familia de Maximiliana estaba a punto de sucumbir, su fuente principal era la actividad agrícola, pero ante los cierres constantes de las  carreteras no  pudieron vender ninguno de sus productos, y todo lo invertido se convirtió en deudas para su familia. Maximiliana con apenas 09 años se daba cuenta de las penurias que pasaban en esa época. Hoy es una mujer bien centrada y responsable de sus actividades y junto con su esposo se dedican a labrar la tierra; en su parcela tienen sembrios de plantas de café y cacao. Viene trabajando 18 años en sus propias tierras, En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de la mano de los jornaleros  para  así avanzar con mayor  rapidez con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para así mejorar sus productos; además en el futuro anhela ampliar sus plantaciones de cacao ya que cuenta con 02 hectáreas de terreno. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además se siente satisfecha por trabajar con su banco comunal. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados,  comprará abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Maximiliana, age 39, is married and has two children.  They live together in the tropical Peruvian jungle in the Sirenachayocc community, an annex of the Quimbiri district.  They have their own house, which is built from a wood foundation and a tin roof.

Due to the national crisis that affected our country in the 80’s, Maximiliana’s family was at the point of succumbing.  Her main source of income was the farming, but after the constant road closings they could not sell any of their products.  Everything they had invested turned into debt for her family.  At just nine years of age Maximiliana realized the hardships that occurred during this time.  

Now she is a well-centered woman who is responsible with her business activities.  She works the land with her husband.  They grow coffee and cacao plants on their plot of land.  She has been working on her land for 18 years.  During the harvest season she has the help of her children and the labor of workers who can pick the fruit with great speed.  

What she likes the most about her work is harvesting the fruits of the plants.  She feels that the months of hard work are compensated by the quality of her fruits. She considers the most difficult part of her job to be transporting her products from the farm to the distribution centers in the city of San Francisco.  That is where they offer better prices for her grains.

The requested loan is to buy organic and chemical fertilizers to improve her products.  Also, in the future she longs to expand her cacao plantings because she has two hectares of land.  

This is her third loan with MFP.  She pledges to continue making her payments on time.  She is very pleased to be working with her communal bank.  She will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy natural and chemical fertilizers in order to improve her production.

loans.use: to buy natural and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a 43 year old widow with 4 children.  With 1 child  in school, Angeline works very hard to provide for them.

Angeline runs a feed retailing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

Angeline has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as hog and fish feed. 

In the future Angeline would like to save money to expand her business and send her child to college.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of feeds to sell

loans.name: Hercilia

texts.es:
Hercilia tiene 41años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y sus dos menores hijos  en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos y a apoyar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de animales (ganado ovino y caprino)

Hercilia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de belleza para exhibirlos en su domicilio, así sus clientes tendrán productos al alcance de la mano y no tendrán que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llega el pedido y para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Hercilia, age 41, is married and lives together with her husband and two young children in the Olmos district -- an agricultural area with a lively commerce which is located in the Lambayeque province, about an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Hercilia makes her living selling beauty products through a catalog. She commercializes them among friends and neighbors and every day makes a great effort to attract more clients since her income depends on the volume of orders she can place for the company that provides her with the inventory. This business allows her to cover her expenses and to help her husband with the financial needs of their household. In addition, she also sells livestock (sheep and goats)

Hercilia would like to expand her business with the purchase of more inventory of beauty products that she could showcase in her home -- this way her clients will be able to get the products immediately rather than have to wait till the end of the month for the delivery of the order. To achieve this goal, Hercilia has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 soles.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is from the village of Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old, married, and has ten adult children. To make a living, she runs a business venture in the food sector making and selling snacks in the local community.   Andresa has been engaged in her business for nine years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities. 

Andresa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi est marié et père de 04 enfants. Blanchisseur de profession, il a ouvert sa blanchisserie en1996 à Lomé et s’approvisionne dans un super marché de la place ’’RAMCO’’ pour rendre au propre les vêtements de ses clients. Ce  premier crédit permettra de renforcer son activité en équipement.
texts.en: Kossi is married and has four children. A washerman by profession, he opened his laundry business in 1996 in Lomé and gets his supplies at the local "RAMCO" supermarket to clean his customers' clothes. This first loan will allow him to strengthen his business and get more supplies.

loans.use: To refurbish his store and buy laundry products.

loans.name: Kankeletigui 6 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KANKELETIGUI 6 est une Association  de femmes mariées du village de  Dembela dans la préfecture de NIENA région de SIKASSO troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Le groupe est compose de 5 femmes, qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et au moins 5 enfants.  Elles exercent la culture d’arachide de riz et de mil.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour payer les frais de labours, acheter  une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, de riz des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture au grand marché de Dembela. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de NIENA et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
ROKIA compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter, 1 sac d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 15.000 à 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group KANKELETIGUI 6 is an association of married women from the village of Dembela in the prefecture of NIENA, Region of SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group is comprised of five women who live in large, traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc.  The group members average 31 years of age and five children each, and they grow peanuts, rice, and millet.

Concerned about make their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. At the main market of Dembela, the current loan will be used to pay for: labor for plowing; a sufficient quantity of seeds to plant peanuts and rice; sundry supplies and equipment; and fertilizers and the like for raising crops. 

The crops are stocked up for a while, so that become valuable following the off-season. And then they are sold at the main market of NIENA and at surrounding markets. Cash or credit is accepted from a customer base of people from large cities in general. 

ROKIA intends to spend her loan on: a sack of urea, 2 sacks of cereal-blend fertilizer, and the labor for plowing and weeding. She envisions making a monthly profit of 15,000 to 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to cover typical family expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Chanda Nosheen's Group

texts.en:
Chanda nosheen is 44 years of age and has given birth to three children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.  
She is divorced and lives with her brother. She doesn’t want to become a burden on her brother. She started sewing clothes for her neighboring clients to afford the living expenses for her children and herself. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. 

Her brother operates a tea stall in the nearby market. Through his stall, he offers tea of different kinds e.g. green, milky and creamy, to his clients. His tea tastes good. That’s why he has a good number of clients who come to his stall regularly.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her brother’s business. With the loan, he will buy tea, sugar, milk etc. to improve the financial condition of his business. Chanda is confident that an investment in her brother’s business will be a good step towards its growth. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Chanda nosheen.

loans.use: To buy tea, sugar and milk for tea stall business

loans.name: Glory Be To God Group

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Rose has learned a great deal about how to effectively run a business during the past four years she has been operating her beauty salon. She says she is now at the stage where she can advise business-oriented people on how to begin and run their own businesses. While those who do not know her may question her confidence, this happily married mother of three says that her achievements have arisen frorm the courage of her convictions. The optimistic Rose says she lets negative people slide by like the water from the proverbial duck's back, a philosophy that has worked very much in her favor.

A farmer before embarking on her beauty salon enterprise, Rose also owns and operates a scrap metal sales business. Weekly, this business brings in profits amounting to Ugandan shillings 150,000. With this Kiva loan, Rose will purchase more cosmetics and other hair chemicals for use in her beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and other hair chemicals for use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es: Leonora tiene 27 años, es una joven sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia situado en la ciudad de Quimbiri junto a su pareja Leonardo de 29 años y sus 02 queridos por quienes vela por su salud y educación. Leonora, es una mujer de ardua labor con ganas de sobre salir y triunfar en la vida, su actividad  rutinaria es despertarse muy temprano para realizar el desayuno para los miembros de su familia  para luego dirigirse a abrir las puertas de su puesto de ventas, donde ofrece variedad de calzados al gusto del cliente. Ella es una vendedora muy hábil, sabe como convencer al cliente para que puedan comprarle un par de calzados. Menciona asimismo  que al principio le fue difícil ganarse la confianza de sus concurrentes, pero al ver la calidad y los precios módicos que ella las ofrecía, sus productos se fueron vendiendo de manera vertiginosa, recalca que todo esto se debe a ustedes, quienes depositaron su confianza en ella y gracias a ello adquirió un pequeño capital financiero y de ese modo fue progresando. Es así que una vez  más solicita el crédito para seguir progresando y poder comprar con el  dinero variedad de calzados. Su plan a futuro es seguir trabajando con el mismo ímpetu que la caracteriza para así sobresalir de la pobreza que aqueja su hogar. Este es será su segundo crédito y esta muy contenta de saber que una vez mas contará con el apoyo financiero y esta dispuesta a cumplir puntualmente con el rol de sus cronogramas de pago. Con el monto solicitado podrá adquirir zapatos y zapatillas en todas las tallas.
texts.en:
Leonora, 27, is an unassuming, hard working young woman.  She lives in her own house located in the city of Quimbiri with her spouse, Leonardo, 29, and their two beloved children whose health and education she sees to.  Leonora is a very hard working woman who very much wants to stand out and succeed in life.  

Her routine consists in rising very early to prepare breakfast for her family and then open up her sales stand where she offers a variety of footwear for her customers.  She is a very skilled seller; she knows how to convince the customer to buy a pair of shoes.  She also mentions that at the beginning it was difficult to win over their trust but upon seeing the quality and modest prices she offered, her products flew off the shelves.  She stresses that all this is thanks to you who have placed your trust in her because thanks to it she was able to get a little bit of financing and that’s how she started to make progress.

So, this is how she once again is asking for a loan to continue making progress and to be able to use the money to buy assorted footwear.  Her future plan is to continue working with the same impetus that characterizes her to overcome the poverty that afflicts her home.

This will be her second loan and she’s very happy to know that once again she’ll be able to count on financial support and she is willing to punctually follow the payment schedule.  She will use the requested amount to buy shoes and slippers in all sizes.

loans.use: to buy more footwear.

loans.name: Sengkun

texts.en:
Sengkun, pictured here, is a weaver. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has three sons and one daughter. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home, one child is a garment worker, and another one weaves silk at home. 

Sengkun is requesting a 600 USD loan to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business, which is a traditional profession. This will be her second loan.

loans.use: to purchase silk material

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina is 54 years old and married. She is from Aurora Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has two grown children who have helped her in taking care of their crops. They took good care of this corn production activity for two years and she receives PHP 8,000 a month. Although a tiresome and irritating activity, yet, the family managed. In 2008, Justina joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000  from the organization to purchase corn fertilizer, and for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: To purchase corn fertilizer and cost of weeding.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
From Uganda, Justine is single and has two children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her mother. Justine lives in a home that she owns; however, she has no electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food for the family. Transportation and seasonality are Justine’s main business challenges.

Justine has a shop where she sells daily-use products. She has had her shop for ten years and works seven days a week. She also generates additional income through farming and selling fried chapatti.

Justine has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of soap, bags of sugar and cartons of salt.

Justine’s goals and aspirations include owning a fully-stocked shop and educating her children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a businessman aged 35. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last four years, he has been selling stationery and providing printing and photocopying services. He also works as a taxi driver to earn more income for his family.

 In the next five years, he wants to have a well-established business. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a lamination machine. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become business-oriented.

loans.use: To buy a lamination machine.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 42-year-old single man who has been raising cows for 35 years. Ali is a hard worker who developed his business a lot through his vast experience in this field. The milk his cows produce and he sells is highly requested in the region because of its good quality. 

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for the first time to buy the necessary food for his cows in big quantities with a special discount to save for the winter season. Ali's vast experience in this field gives him the privilege among all his competitors. He plans to increase his cattle more and more in the future and to expand his farm and production.

loans.use: To buy feef for his cows in big quantities

loans.name: Bayardo Antonio

texts.es: Bayardo Antonio tiene 42 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de bolis. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues él se siente muy feliz ya que es por medio de los créditos que él ha podido realizar su negocio ha mejorado notablemente. Bayardo tiene más de 20 años en esta actividad pues él conoce muy bien su negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de grandes paquetes este prodcuto.
texts.en:
Bayardo Antonio, is 42 years old. He makes and sells bolis (a powdered soft drink). 

This is not his first loan, and he has been very happy because through the loans he has been able to carry out his business and improve it significantly. He has been doing this for more than twenty years. 

The reason for this loan is to buy the packaged bolis in bulk.

loans.use: to buy packaged bolis, a powdered softdrink, in bulk.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is 40 years old, married and has 1 child who is in school.

Minerva is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Minerva requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Minerva has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Minerva would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.ru: Рафоат разведенная женщина и имеет двоих детей. В Центральном рынке города она торгует детской и женской одеждой. В бизнесе она всего один год. До этого она помогала по торговле своей сестре и недавно начала свое дело. Иметь свое дело-это уверенность в стабильном материальном обеспечении. Детям всегда нужна новая современная и сезонная одежда. Рафоат хочет получить займ для расширения ассортимента детской одежды. Она думает, что в займе ей не откажут и она сможет расширить ассортимент к наступающим праздникам.
texts.en:
Rafoat is divorced and has two children. She sells women's and children's clothing on the city's central market. Before starting this business a year ago, she helped her sister. 
Having your own business gives one confidence in a stable financial situation. 
Children constantly require new clothes. Rafoat is asking for a loan in order to diversify her assortment of children's clothing. She believes that her loan request will be fulfilled and hopes to have new goods for sale by the upcoming holidays.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing.

loans.name: Aubreey Haydee

texts.es: Aubreey Haydee  D. treinta y tres años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una papelería donD. venD. variedad D. artículos papel, hojas, lapiceros, plumones entre otros, esta es muy conocida en la zona pues las personas siempre encuentran ahí todo lo que necesitan con producto D. calidad y a un buen precio además el servicio es excelente; Aubreey es una mujer dedicada a su trabajo el amor y la constancia son sus mayores secretos,  ella piensa  que por muy alta que sea una colina siempre hay un sendero hacia su cima, busca el camino del éxito es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar papel en variedad, lapiceros, plumones, globos y otros artículos. Aubreey Haydee tiene la confianza que con su esfuerzo lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Aubreey Haydee, 33, lives with her life’s companion and their children in a house she owns.  She has a stationery shop where she sells a variety of paper goods, sheets of paper, pencils and markets, among others.  She is very well known in her zone because people always find what they are looking for there and the products are good quality at affordable prices; besides service is excellent.

Aubreey is a woman dedicated to her work; love and constancy are her biggest secrets.  She thinks that no matter how high a hill might be there’s always a path to the top and she looks for the path to success.  This is why she’s asking Integral for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy an assortment of paper, pencils, markers, balloons and other things.  She trusts that with her effort she will manage to proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy assorted paper, pencils, markers, balloons and other things.

loans.name: Kawkab

texts.en:
Kawkab is a 53-year-old mother of seven sons and daughters. Five of them have gotten married already.

Her son Sulaiman has a small cafeteria shop located in a very active area in Al Zarqa where he serves hot drinks and soft drinks beside sweets and biscuits. Most of his customers are taxi and bus drivers or workers who are looking for fast cheap food to eat either as breakfast or lunch.

Kawkab helps her son Sulaiman by preparing the sweets at home and sending them with him on a daily basis. She also makes special orders for other customers. Now Kawkab wants to expand by distributing the sweets she makes to more areas in Al Zarqa and selling them in more sweets shops, but to do that she needs to make a larger quantity of sweets, and that’s why she has applied for this loan.

Because Kawkab is a conservative person, she asked her son Sulaiman to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making sweets.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana, originaria de la ciudad de León, de 54 años de edad, madre de 2 hijos,  de oficio comerciante vende ropa, zapatos, y bolsos. Inicio hace 25 años cuando tenía 29 años de edad lo heredo de su mama quien era comerciante y vendía mercadería en general al retirarse su madre se hizo cargo del negocio. Ella vende en un tramo ubicado en el mercado de la estación de buses de León. 
Ella realizo el crédito para comprar vestidos, camisas, chinelas, sandalias, ropa interior. Con esta inversión podrá invertir compra de mercadería nueva para aprovechar las ofertas navideñas y vender lo más que pueda. Pues desea expandirse y abrir otro tramo para contratar a más ayudantes pues actualmente solo tiene dos personas que le ayudan a atender el negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is from the city of León. She is 54 years old and the mother of 2 children. She sells clothes, shoes and purses. She started 25 years ago, when she was 29 years old. She inherited it from her mother, who was a merchant who sold general merchandise. When her mother retired, she took over the business. She sells in a spot in the market at the bus station in León.
 
She took out the loan to buy dresses, shirts, slippers, sandals, and underwear. With this investment, she will be able to buy new merchandise, taking advantage of Christmas sales and selling more. She wants to expand and open another sales stall and hire more helpers. At present, she has only two people who help her with the business.

loans.use: to buy dresses, shirts, slippers, sandals, and underwear.

loans.name: Chobeli Farmers Group

texts.en:
Violet is the facilitator of the Chobeli Farmers group. Violet and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

 Violet takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Violet had a good maize yield harvesting 5 bags on 1/4 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Violet was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/4 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Violet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Violet will educate her children, build a house, and invest in livestock rearing.

 In 2012, the members of Chobeli Farmers group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 26 years of age and is married with two children.

Epifania owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting "taamu" (giant taro) for sale.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Epifania needs a loan of WST $500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2010, Epifania joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Epifania's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone

loans.name: Maria Eusebia

texts.es:
María Eusebia  tiene 46 años es casada vive con el esposo  y  con los  hijos. Vive en el Recinto Las Blancas en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Ventanilla 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

María Eusebia  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul realiza las compras de sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos como urea, insecticidas entre los más usados  para el cuidado de los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia y para invertir en la siembra en semillas e insumos.  Su sueño es tener una casa.

Le gusta cuidar de su hogar y realizar la limpieza de la casa.
texts.en:
María Eusebia, 46, is married and lives with her husband and children in Recinto Las Blancas in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “26 de Noviembre” communal bank is located in Recinto Las Blancas belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to farming tasks in short cycle corn, rice and pigeon peas.

María Eusebia farms corn, rice and pigeon peas.  Her purchases take place in Ventanas and her sales in the Ventanas market.

She requested the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure like urea and the most commonly used insecticides for crop care.  The loan helped her to increase family income and to invest in seeds and supplies.  Her dream is to own a house.  She likes taking care of and cleaning her house.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal, 25, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband grill fish in order to produce smoked fish to sell. 

Because the demand for smoked fish is being increased, Sophal is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more fish and firewood to produce more smoked fish to sell. 

In the future, she would like to grow her business of selling smoked fish, build a concrete house and support her children to study until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and firewood to produce more smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Celestina Gladis

texts.es: La Sra. Celestina se dedica a la elaboración de masitas como ser suspiros, canelones grandes pequeños, alfajores de maicena entre otros ahora debido a la proximidad de la feria de la alasita la Sra. Necesita incrementar su capital para elaborar masitas en mayor cantidad para surtir a todas las vendedoras de la feria de la alasita por este motivo solicito su crédito para la compra de insumos como harina y azúcar, en otras temporadas la Sra. También se dedica a la venta de mercadería que trae desde  la localidad de  Desaguadero, El domicilio es de su propiedad y esta ubicado en la zona los Andes y el horno se encuentra en el mismo domicilio,  Su familia esta compuesta de dos hijos y su esposo el cual le ayuda a la distribución de sus productos.
texts.en: Celestina has a business making pastries, such as meringue cookies, small and large cannelloni, sandwich cookies, and other items.  Since the Alasitas Fair is approaching, she needs to increase her capital so that she can make meringue cookies in greater quantity to supply to the sellers at the fair.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as flour and sugar.  During other times of the year, Celestina also sells merchandise that she brings to her town from Desaguadero.  She owns her own home, which is located in the Andes neighborhood, and her oven is located in this home.  Her family includes her two children and her husband, who helps her distribute her products.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make bakery products for the Alasitas Fair

loans.name: Las Muchachitas Del Ranchito Group

texts.es:
GRUPO LAS MUCHACHITAS DEL RANCHITO ESTA INTEGRADO POR 5 MUJERES COMERCIANTES ELLAS SON VECINAS DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS,SE CONOCEN MUY BIEN Y SE DAN LA MANO UNAS CON OTRAS YA QUE EL LUGAR DONDE VIVEN ES MUY HUMILDE Y TODAS DESEAN SALIR ADELANTE Y MEJORAR SU COMUNIDAD. SUS NOMBRES SON CECILIA,MARTHA,SARA.YUVI Y TERESA.
HOY HABLAREMOS DE SARA, ELLA TIENE 33 AÑOS VIVE EN UNION LIBRE CON SU PAREJA,TIENE 3 HIJOS QUE ESTUDIAN PRIMARIA Y SECUNDARIA ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE CALZADO,PARA GANAR UN DINERO EXTRA Y PODER AYUDAR A SU PAREJA CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR Y LA ESCUELA DE SUS HIJOS. ELLA UTILIZARA SU CREDITO PARA SURTIR CALZADO SE TEMPORADA INVERNAL, Y PODER TENER UNA BUENA VENTA EN ESTOS MESES DE INVIERNO.
EL SUEÑO DE MARTHA ES LLEGAR A TENER UNA ZAPATERIA EN EL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD Y ASI INCRREMANTAR LAS VENTAS YA QUE ELLA QUIERE QUE SUS HIJOS TERMINEN LA ESCUELA Y SEAN PROFESIONISTAS.
texts.en:
Las Muchachitas Del Ranchito Group comprises five female merchants. They have been neighbors for several years and know each other very well. They help each other out, since they live in a very humble place and they all want to get ahead and improve their community. Their names are Cecilia, Martha, Sara, Yuvi, and Teresa.

Today we will talk about Sara. She is 33 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She lives with her partner and has three children who are in elementary and middle school. She works selling shoes in order to make some extra money so that she can help her partner with household expenses and to pay for their children's school. She will use her loan to stock up on shoes for the winter season so that she can make good sales during the winter months.

Martha's dream is to one day have a shoe shop downtown so that she can increase her sales, because she wants her children to finish school and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy winter shoes.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama âgée de 46 ans habite au Sénégal dans la région du sud elle est mère de 6 ans l'ainé est enseignant sa petite sœur est mariée le 3eme est dans l'armée et les 3 autres sont à l'école.Depuis 10 ans ,elle est dans le commerce produits alimentaire.Adama avait bénéficié d'un premier crédit 300 000f , qu'elle avait remboursé sans difficulté.Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000f pour acheter les jus de citron de la patte d'arachide de huile de palme des balais pour mieux satisfaire ses clients.Elle a comme ambition avoir un terrain dans la ville pour son fils ainé.

loans.use: ACHETER DE LA PATTE D'ARACHIDE,HUILE DE PALME DE BALAIS

loans.name: Inthia Penda's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 23 Décembre 2014 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Le banc villageois est composé de femmes désireux d’améliorer leurs conditions d’existence à travers  des activités génératrices de revenu. Elles vivent dans un même village depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce. 

Madame Inthia Penda  (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est veuve et mère de 04  enfants dont 03 garçons et 01fille. Agée de 64 ans , elle s’active après transformation dans la vente d’arachide 
.
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 05 sacs d’arachide à 11000f pour revendre certains sac et d’autres après transformation en patte d’arachide et le revendre en détails.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de s’occuper de ses enfants et de prendre en charges ses charges familiales.
texts.en:
Created and inaugurated on December 23, 2014, the banc villageois is comprised of women wanting to improve their living conditions through income-generating activities. They have been living in the same village for several decades and maintain strong relationships of solidarity and mutual support. Their main activity is small-scale trade. 

Mrs. Inthia Penda (sitting at far right with her left hand raised) is the group’s highlighted borrower. She is a window and a mother to 4 children: 3 boys and 1 girl. She is 65 years old and is active in selling peanuts after processing. 

With her new loan, she plans to purchase 5 bags of peanuts for 11,000f to resell some bags and use others to produce peanut butter and sell in retail. 

The profits will allow her to take care of her children and pay for family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 5 bags of peanuts for 11,000f to resell some bags and use others to produce peanut butter and sell in retail.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Mrs. Nhung is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She operates a fishing business and owns fish cages. She earns a meager income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of her family especially her children's education. She requested a loan, which she will use to repair and overhaul her fishing boat and maintain other fishing equipment to improve and expand her fishing business. In the future, she hopes to concrete her house.

loans.use: To repair and overhaul her fishing boat and maintain other fishing equipment to improve and expand her fishing business

loans.name: Elizabeth Wanko

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Naretoi Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Elizabeth is married with 15 dependants. She was educated up to primary school level, she is able to read and write. She is the current group secretary. She is also secretary to merry go rounds in her extended family. She is a member of Motherâ€™s Union where she is the secretary too.

Elizabeth has a small Farm where she rears 16 Steers. Together with her husband, they started the business in 1998. They have been able to bring up and educate their children. In 2001 she was given a loan of USD 300 by WEEC which enabled them to add 3 more steers. They make sure that they have reasonable stock to ensure steady supply to the butchery.

loans.use: Having established the market, they want to ensure that the relationship they have created with their clients is maintained. Thus this loan will enable them to add more steers in their farm.

loans.name: Sogbadji

texts.en:
Widowed for more than 5 years, Mrs Sogbadji A. is the mother of four (4) children who are completely her responsibility. She sells generic health products. Because of her courage and dedication, she is succeeding in improving the family's lot. Aware that exposure to sun constitutes a danger to the health of her clients, she is thinking of renting a location she could use as a shop. To do this Mrs A. needs capital of $700 that will allow her to rent a location for her shop and increase the size of her business. The success of this activity will allow her family to blossom.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Veuve depuis plus de 5 ans, Madame A. Sogbadji est mère de quatre (4) enfants qui sont entièrement à sa charge. Elle a comme activité, la vente des produits génériques dans sa localité. Grâce à son courage et son dévouement, elle arrive à s’en sortir. Consciente que les produits exposés au soleil constituent un danger pour la santé des clients, elle pense louer un local qui va lui servir de boutique. Pour ce faire, Madame A. a besoin d’un capital de $700 qui va servir à louer un local pour sa boutique et agrandir la taille de son activité. Le succès de cette activité permettra l’épanouissement de sa famille.

loans.use: Rent of location and sale of products

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She operates a drinking spot. She is seeking a loan of US$750.00 from Kiva to help her expand her production.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.en:
Rustamjon has over 12 years of experience in trade. He is married and has two daughters. He started his business by selling national dresses, bedclothes and head kerchiefs which were sewn by his wife and daughters. Gradually he was able to increase the turnover of his goods. So he bought an ice cream freezer and rented one more trading place for the summer season for his younger daughter to run. They are a very friendly family and help each other in business.

Today Rustamjon’s little shop has become one of the most well-known shops in the Panjshanbe market and he has a lot of clients. He always takes his customers' needs into consideration and modifies the goods he sells accordingly. He additionally started to bring modern goods from Tashkent, Usbekistan and Bishkek, Kirgisistan. Now he needs $1200USD to buy summer goods from these countries. P.S. There is Rustamjon's wife on the photo.

loans.use: Rustamjon would like to increase his business where he sells bedclothes, kerchiefs and dresses sewn by his wife and daughters.

loans.name: Baroatkhon

texts.en:
Baroatkhon has been selling children's clothes for 11 years. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a worker, but his salary is not enough to support the family. So she decided to help her husband.

Baroatkhon’s business is located in the open-air market in Panjshanbe. She brings her goods from Istaravshan’s wholesale market. She began her business by selling towels; gradually, she changed her type of goods to children's clothes. Baroatkhon became a client of MicroInvest in 2006. Her first loan was for 100USD. She used her loan to buy modern clothes for little girls. Soon she was able to increase the volume of her goods. Today her stall is one of the known stalls in the market. She has many clients and she always wants to meet their needs.

In future, Baroatkhon wants to expand her assortment by including seasonal clothes for autumn time. She is requesting $400 to do this.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Sra. Lidia belongs to the "Las Doncellas" (The Damsels) community bank in Ucayali, a region or "departamento" of Peru. She is 38 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a cab driver and earns very little so Lidia decided to set up a business at home, making lingerie and other clothing. With her first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$94) from Manuela Ramos, she started a business making clothing for women, selling what she made door-to-door.

The recently-granted loan of S/.500 (approximately US$167) from Manuela Ramos, which will be repaid in 4 installments, will be used to maintain her sewing machine and to buy 8 kilograms of cotton material, 1 dozen spools of thread and other materials.

Lidia feels complete because dressmaking is what she likes doing above all and it's given her the opportunity to earn income for the family's expenses and to provide for her young chidren.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lidia pertenece al Banco Comunal "Las Doncellas", del A. H. Primavera 2da etapa Mz 22 Lt 16 del Distrito de Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años de edad y es madre de 4 niños, su esposo es taxista, dado que su ingreso es mínimo, Lidia decide poner un negocio en su casa, se dedica a la confección de ropa y lencería. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300.00 soles decide confeccionar ropa para mujeres y la mercadería la venda casa por casa dando facilidades de pago.

El reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500 (US$ 167.00 aprox.) que cancelará en 4 cuotas, será utilizado para dar mantenimiento a su máquina y comprar 8 kilos de telas de algodón, 1 docena de conos de hilos y 3 conos de elástico.

Lidia se siente realizada dado que la costura es lo que más le gusta y con ello tiene la oportunidad de generar ingresos para los gastos de la familia, además de cuidar de sus pequeños hijos.

loans.use: Maintenance for sewing machine and purchases of cloth, threads, etc. for women's clothing business.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: I am the mother of three children, two boys and one girl. My children attend school, except the youngest one who is too young to attend. My husband has been abroad for the last few years. I thank God he is doing well over there and is able to send us money. I live with one of my brothers, who operates a cosmetics business. He is working very hard to make it a success. He needs to buy shampoo and other inventory items in bulk for his business, but lacks the necessary funds. He would like a loan of $350. I assure you that he is responsible and will repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To help her brother buy cosmetics and increase store inventory.

loans.name: Angela Ramona

texts.es:
Mrs. Ángela M. is a woman who works selling food. For a large part of her life, Mrs. M. has worked hard to be able to bless her children with being able to go to school. In addition, being a single mother, she has a responsibility to care for these little ones, offering them security and safety. She decided to sell cheese as a street vendor, working only in the mornings, so she could dedicate the rest of the day to her children and one grandchild that are in her care. One of her daughters is a single mother who works in the capital (city).

Later on she decided to sell food as a street vendor (instead of just cheese), to obtain better wages. At the same time, she started to take measures to obtain a section in the market, La Estacion. She successfully obtained this stand and renovated it with the loans that she had been granted, and continue to be granted, by Ceprodel.

Mrs. M. has worked with Ceprodel for three years and they have provided her with 13 loans, all of which she has paid back on time.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ángela M. es una dama que se dedica al negocio de la venta de comida, la mayor parte de su vida la Sra. M. se ha esforzado para poder bendecir a sus hijos con los estudios ya que además de ser madre soltera, debe de cuidar a estos pequeños brindándoles seguridad. Decide vender queso de forma ambulante realizando esta actividad solo por la mañana para dedicarles el resto del día a sus hijos y un nieto que tiene a su cargo ya que una hija de ella es madre soltera el cual trabaja en la capital.

Mas adelante decide cambiar de actividad y realiza la venta de comida, buscando obtener mayor ganancia siempre de forma ambulante, a la vez inicia a gestionar un tramo en el mercado La Estación el cual logra obtener y acondicionar con los prestamos que le ha otorgado y le sigue otorgando Ceprodel .

La señora M. tiene tres años de trabajar con ceprodel y se le han otorgado trece créditos de los cuales ha sido cancelado en tiempo y forma.

loans.use: Working captial for her business.

loans.name: Houndjo

texts.fr:
Mr. Houndjo K. was born in Havé Doumé in the Prefecture of Zio in 1975. He did not have the chance to attend school. Married and the father of four (04) children with one more in his care, he meets the needs of his family thanks to agricultural work and a motorcycle taxi service. His wife, a retailer, helps him from time to time in his work in the fields. Thanks to his experience, he manages his business well. Dynamic and courageous, he has already repaid a previous loan of $400.

Currently, this new loan request of $1000 will serve to expand his crops, such as maize, peanuts, and others, and also to acquire a new motorcycle for transport. This will allow him to increase his yield and improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur K. Houndjo est né à Havé Doumé dans la préfecture du Zio dans l'année 1975. Il n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter. Marié et père de quatre (4) enfants et autre en charge, il subvient aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux travaux champêtres et au taxi moto. Sa femme revendeuse, l’aide de temps en temps dans ses activités champêtres Grâce à son expérience, il maîtrise bien son activité. Dynamique et courageux, il a déjà remboursé un précédent crédit de $400.

A présent, cette nouvelle demande de crédit de $1000 lui servira à développer les cultures vivrières tels que le mais, l’arachide, et autres et à acquérir une nouvelle moto pour le transport. Ceci va lui permettre d’avoir beaucoup de rendement et de surcroît améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Honoratha's Hekima Group

texts.en:
Honoratha is a 39 years old widow with four children, ages 9 to 21 years old. Honoratha owns a small cafe that she started in 1982. Everyday, she works from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $290 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member who has a business selling bananas.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Faysilla

texts.ru:
Faysilla H. lives in Yavan. He is 55 years old, is married and has seven children. He has a secondary education. He has his own business – he raises livestock. He buys young calves, feeds them for 40 to 45 days and then sells them in the same market. He has a shed where he keeps his calves. He has been in this business for 15 years. Raising livestock is a common business in rural areas. Currently, it is the season to buy calves and Faysilla wants to purchase additional calves, which will increase his turnover and bring additional income. Since he doesn’t have enough money to purchase additional calves, he applied for a loan. He plans to repay his loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Хасанов Файзилла жтель города Яван. Клиенту 55 лет , он женат и имеет 7 детей. Образование среднее. Определенного места работы не имеет, но имеет свое дело. Он занимается животноводством. Покупает молодых бычков и после откормки, которая длится около 40-45 дней продает на тех же рынках. Имеет коровник в котором держит бычков. Занимается клиент этим видом бизнеса уже 15 лет. Эта деятельность одна из основных видов бизнеса в сельской местности. Сейчас сезон купле-продажи бычков , поэтому клиенту нужно купить дополнительных бычков. Это поможет увеличить товарооборот , что даст возможность получить дополнительный доход. Но для этого у него не хватает денег, поэтому он обратился к нам и хочет получить кредит. А погасить кредит он планирует в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Holmamad

texts.ru:
Holmamad I., 46, is married and has 6 children. His wife does not work and takes care of the household. Holmamad lives in the village Yutkonsoi in the Gafurov region. He has been in the business of selling cattle for the past 10 years. That is the main source of income for his family. His older son, who is 17, helps him to take care of cattle. Currently, he has 25 goats and 20 sheep. To increase the number of animals, he came to MicroInvest to obtain a loan.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Исломов Холмамад мужчина в возросте 46 лет женат имеет 6 детей , жена домохозяка.Он проживает в поселке Утконсой Гафуровском районе. уже 10 лет как занимается откормом скота на что и зарабатывает на проживание.По уходу за скотом ему помогает старший сын которому 17 лет. На данный момент у него сейчас 25 козочек и 20 баранов.Он хочет увеличить колличество скота, для чего обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Sales of cattle

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
The years of experience in this business have served Mrs. Eulalia by enabling her to make herself a prosperous merchant of groceries, thanks to this trade she has been able to take care of her 2 children (whom she has been in charge of since her dear husband passed away) without economic deprivation and has allowed them to learn their studies. She is a diligent mother who has a small shop in the Cerro Colorado market in the city of Juliaca and she desires to increase the variety and quantity of her merchandise to please the demanding regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Los años de experiencia en este negocio, le ha servido a doña Eulalia de experiencia para convertirse en una próspera comerciante de abarrotes, gracias a este oficio logró mantener sin privaciones económicas y brindarles estudios superiores a sus 2 hijos quienes quedaron a su cargo desde que su querido esposo falleció.Esta diligente madre tiene un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado Cerro Colorado de su ciudad natal Juliaca y desea aumentar la variedad y tener en stock sus insumos de primera necesidad para complacer a sus exigentes y asiduos clientes.

loans.use: To increase her capital to offer a better quantity of articles of necessity.

loans.name: Makbuliddin

texts.ru:
Makbuliddin is 31 years old, married and had three children. He lives in the picturesque mountain region of Isfara, in the Vorukh district.

Every year, from June to July, is the season for drying apricots. At this time, Makbuliddin and his family go to orchards to gather aprictos for drying.

To obtain additional fresh apricots for his gardens, Makbuliddin is applying to MicroInvest for a loan.

Translated from the Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Макбулиддину 31 год, он женат и воспитывает 3 детей. Живет он в живописном горном районе Исфары – джамоате Ворух. Каждый год в июне-июле наступает пора сушки абрикосов. В это время Макбулиддин и его семья выезжают в поле под фруктовые сады и сушат абрикосы. Для приобретения свежих абрикосов дополнительно к своим садам Макбулиддин обратился в МикроИнвест за займом.

loans.use: to purchase apricots

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 54-year-old Frida C., who is married and has four children aged between 17 and 35. She has one dependent living with her because he is an orphan. In 1999, Frida established her poultry business and is assisted by her children and one employee. She now requests a loan in order to purchase additional chicks and feed. In the future, she plans to to open another business. Frida thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. Who or what are ‘kuku’, you may ask. Kuku is Swahili for chickens, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed.

loans.name: Beatriz Del Carmen

texts.es:
Beatriz has been making hammocks for 10 years now. She was a little girl when she learned how to make hammocks from her mother. Today she is grateful for having learned to make her hammocks because she now sells them and she can support her family's expenses. She compliments her husband's income as it is not enough to cover their expenses. She is a mother of 2 children.

She needs a loan in the amount of $400 that will be repaid in a term of 5 months. She will purchase more merchandise and increase her inventory of materials to make hammocks. With your support Beatriz will be a success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Beatriz tiene mas de 10 años dedicándose al negocio de las hamacas, ella desde muy pequeña aprendió a elaborarlas gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre, por lo que ahora aprovecha de lo aprendido para elaborar sus hamacas y luego venderlas y así tener un apoyo para el gasto familiar, ya que con el suedlo de su esposo no le alcanza para solventarlos, ella es madre de 2 hijos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancia y asi tener inventario para poder elaborar sus hamacas. Con tu apoyo Beatriz saldra adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Thay

texts.en:
Mrs. Thay C. lives in Tumpoar Village in the Kampong Cham Province and is a pig breeder who raises ten pigs. Her husband, Mr. Yin Khan, is a healer in the local village. Mrs. Thay C. is 28-years-old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in school while the other, age four, is too young to work or study.

Since this business is going well, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding and she would use the rest of the money to buy pig food for them. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding and to buy pig food for the animals.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo Edwin y sus tres hijos Daniel de 16, Karelyn de 14 y Huber de 4.  Desde hace diez años, Luz se viene dedicando a la atención de su tienda, donde ofrece, productos de belleza, artículos de librería, fotocopias, etc, durante toda la mañana y de 3 a 6 de la tarde, que es donde hay demanda de sus productos.  Luz es abogada de profesión,  pero dada la realidad, no pudo ejercer, y decidió dedicarse al comercio, esta actividad le gusta mucho, ya que la  pequeña tienda que tiene arroja buenos ingresos económicos y le permite mantener a sus hijos y brindarles una buena educación, lo desagradable es tener abastecerse ella sola en la atención, ya que a veces se le hace muy cansado.  Luz trabaja en bien del futuro de sus hijos a los cuales quiere ver triunfar.  Con el dinero que Luz requiere, expandirá su negocio, comprando más mercadería, para que en el futuro su tienda llegue a tener más sucursales.
texts.en:
Luz is 40 years of age. She lives with her husband Edwin and her three children, Daniel who is 16, Karelyn who is 14, and Huber who is 4. For ten years, Luz has worked in her shop where she offers beauty products, stationery, photocopies, etc. She works all morning and from 3 to 6 in the afternoon, when there is a demand for her products. Luz is a lawyer by profession, but given her realities, she was not able to practice and decided to work in business. She really enjoys this work. Since she has been making good earnings from her little store, it allows her to support her children and to provide them with a good education. The unfortunate thing is having to provide all of the services which, at times, makes her very tired. Luz works with the future of her children in mind who she wants to see succeed. With the money that Luz needs, she will expand her shop, buying more merchandise so that in the future her shop will come to have more branches.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is 32 years old and a married mother with one child. Currently, the child is in school. Grace operates a restaurant and is also a baker, who bakes bread and cakes and supplies them to her loyal customers. She has 2 years of experience in the field. She wants to add to her existing business, such as by selling spring rolls which she says customers want for breakfast. She therefore wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice and flour, vegetables, eggs and assorted meat to expand her operation.

She is a member of the group called ‘Favor’. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taken when she was visited.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice and baking flour

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To replenish a small clothing shop

loans.name: Mam's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is composed of four borrowers and the group leader, Mrs. Mam S., 45, is a local doctor. She is widowed with four children, three of whom are married and live away from home. One daughter, Miss Mam Samnang, lives in the family home; she sells groceries out of their house.

S. and her daughter work hard every day with the business. In order to grow the business and increase their grocery inventory so as to increase their income, S. would like to request a loan for her daughter's business.

The other three borrowers:

Phan N. is 56 years old and is a traditional music player. He provides his service for wedding parties and other ceremonies. N. requests a loan to buy a used motorcycle to ride.

Hang T., aged 49, provides a Khmer music service. He needs to ask for a loan to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to make his family transportation easier .

Phat L., 42 years old, earns a living by selling groceries. She is applying for a loan to purchase additional groceries for sale.

The borrowers live in Slorkram Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory for sale

loans.name: Rachida

texts.fr: Yerima rachida est une demoiselle très travailleuse qui réside dans le quartier d’awatamé, elle a ouvert une boutique qu’elle a appelé « AKPAKI & FILS », dans cette boutique elle fait le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale et divers, elle n’a jamais sollicité de crédits chez wages et sollicite donc son premier crédit d’un montant de 500000F pour réapprovisionner son stock de produits d’alimentation générale, elle va s’approvisionner dans le grand marché de lomé. Elle aide beaucoup sa famille avec le revenu de son travail.
texts.en:
Miss Rachida Yerima is a very hard-working young woman who lives in the Awatamé neighborhood where she has opened a little store that she calls «AKPAKI & FILS ». In this little store she sells general merchandise. She has never asked WAGES for a loan before and so is requesting her first loan in the amount of 500,000 F to replenish her inventory of foodstuffs. She will do her buying in the big market of Lomé. She helps her family a great deal with the income from her work.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam has owned a small shop and has been a food seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 4 years. 
She belongs to Bahati loan group (Group code 2019).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250.Every day she works at her business for 14 hours.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items and other shop items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  

Maryam is 26 years old, married, and has one child: aged 4.

loans.use: To buy more food items and other items for her shop in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi: Chị Phạm Thị Ngân  năm nay 29tuổi,  chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2008 và đang kinh doanh hoa quả . Anh Quyết chồng chị làm xe ôm với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài thời gian đi làm anh cũng giúp đỡ chị rất nhiều vì thế công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị  phát triển tốt và cho thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các loại hoa quả về bán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi N. is 29 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2008 and is currently selling vegetables. Her husband Quyet works as a motorbike cabbie with an income of 2,000,000 VND per month. In addition to his work, he also helps his wife with her vegetables business, which brings her an income of 2,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in more vegetables to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar R. lives with his wife and three children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His oldest daughter is a cook in a small local restaurant. The other two children are high-school students. They live in a ger (a traditional mobile tent) built on land owned by their cousin, since Ganbaatar's family does not own one.

Since 2000, Ganbaatar and his wife have been reselling second-hand clothes in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. Since their capital for the business is quite small, they do not make much profit. They hope to expand the business as the capital allows.

Even though they always want to save their small profit to reinvest in their business for expansion, they can’t save any money for later due to the large expense of the family of five. Ganbaatar says, "It would be like a dream come true if my family could live on land that we own. Hopefully, I will be able to send at least one of my children to a university." He requests a loan to buy more second-hand clothes and thus to increase their business capital.

Tsetseghand, Ganbaatar's wife, is pictured at their clothing stall.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: May

texts.en:
Mrs. May G. is 30 years old and married to Manuel, a farmer. They are blessed with two children. Their source of income is their vegetable garden, where they grow "kangkong" (swamp cabbage). Both husband and wife help each other to cultivate the garden and to sustain the needs of the family.

Mrs. G. is a good member of Kiva's partner Paglaum and seeks a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 for pesticides and for fertilizers. She is very thankful to Paglaum for the assistance with her projects. She hopes to have an abundant harvest always.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals and fertilizers for her garden

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy shoes and beauty products

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita está casada y tiene dos hijos por quienes trabaja muy duro, pues la satisfacción de sus necesidades es la prioridad en su vida. Este año empezó a vender productos de belleza, actividad que la obliga a salir a las calles para visitar a diversas personas que van haciéndole pedidos cada mes, pero debido a la lejanía de su casa no puede trasladarse todos los días al centro de la localidad, teniendo que hacerlo sólo los fines de semana. Trabaja con esmero para incrementar sus ingresos, los cuales, con el tiempo, le permitan cumplir sus deseos de abrir una bodega en su hogar, aprovechando que en la zona donde vive no cuentan con tiendas cercanas, oportunidad que no desea dejar pasar y que está segura tendrá gran acogida. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y lo que le agrada de su banco comunal es la manera de trabajo, pues la responsabilidad y empeño son aspectos que caracterizan a sus compañeras. Los 600 soles que solicita le servirán para incrementar sus productos y aprovechar las ventas  por las festividades próximas a celebrar, como el día del padre.
texts.en:
Margarita is married and has two children for whom she works very hard, because their satisfaction and needs are the proirity in her life. This year she began to sell beauty products, an activity that obligates her to go into town and visit diverse people that are making monthly requests, but due to the remoteness of her home she cannot get to the center every day, she has only been able to do it on the weekends. She works diligently to earn more income, which over time will permit her to fulfill her desire to open a store in their home, taking advantage of living in an area where there are no nearby stores. This is an opportunity she does not want to pass up and it will surely have a great reception. This is her second loan with MFP, she likes the way the village bank works because the partners are characterized by responsibility and commitment. The 600 soles she requests will serve to build her products and to take advantage of sales for upcoming festivities to celebrate, such as father's day.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise.

loans.name: Koem

texts.en: Koem L. is 47 years old and mother to six children: four are single and the other two are married and have already started new families. In the beginning of 2000, Koem L. built a small store in front of her home. In her shop, she sells a few snack products to the neighbors who live near her house in the village. In addition, she always cultivates crops during the approaching of farming season. She is married to Khat Sarun, 44, a local carpenter. After the rains fall and the land is suitable for production, Koem L. will take out a loan to buy fertilizers and vegetable seeds to sow on her existing farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and vegetable seeds to sow on her existing farmland.

loans.name: Taesega

texts.en: Taesega A., 60, is married with eight children.  She has one year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and village people four days per week. She has one previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala.  SPBD loans are Taesega’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase knapsack sprayer, chemicals, knives, spade, wheel barrow

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is 48 years old and a married mother of six children. Two of her children have finished senior school while the others are still in school. Georgina is a trader in salt, which she supplies to food vendors and others. She travels to Accra to buy her salt, but she is only able to buy a few bags at a time as she does not have enough money to buy more. This means she has to travel to Accra frequently. She spoke to her husband and some family members about financial assistance, but to no avail. She is requesting a loan to buy salt in bulk as this will reduce her travelling. She dreams of being able to save more so that she can support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy salt in bulk

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
K. is 42-year-old married father who currently lives in the best territory of Phnom Penh Capital, in Cambodia Country. He is a local chef. He is always hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties and their other ceremonies, while his wife works as a tailor who sews the villagers' clothes. She also shares her sewing knowledge with her trainees for a fee. The family includes five devoted children, four of whom are single and one is married. 

K. would like a loan of $800 in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business. He will rent out this land to farmers for a fee.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a member of the Uaminifu borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 32 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 134,4 years.

Zuhura started her own clothing business selling clothes 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Zuhura`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Zuhura hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Jose Benito

texts.es: José Benito M. tiene El Nombre del Señor José Benito B. M. tiene la edad de 52 años, su compañera de vida labora en una tienda llamada Brodway. No es el primer préstamo que ha realizado en Fundación León 2000 ya que es por medio de ellos que ha logrado salir adelante. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es joyero en lo que realiza el siguiente trabajo anillos, pulsera, cadenas, chapas. Sus inicios se dan a la edad de 16 años y más tarde decide ingresar a un taller y al paso del tiempo decide instalar su mismo negocio e inicia con las siguientes herramientas una mesa, sopletes y balanza más tarde decide obtener su propio negocio. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que comprar  el oro y tiene que buscar donde se lo oferten de forma más factible para realizar cada uno de sus productos.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Lordgin

texts.en:
Lordgin is 31 years old and is married to Miguel, a security guard. The couple has been blessed with four children: Melogyn - 13, Clarizza Mae - 10, Mike Angelo – 6 and Christian James - 4. All of her children are studying; the eldest is in high school and the others are in elementary school. Their family lives in the village of San Antonio San Agustin, Isabela.

Lordgin is requesting a loan in the amount of Php 6,000 to buy animal feed for her hog raising business. This business has been very helpful in providing some of her family basic needs, as well as, helping to fund her children's education. She hopes that she will be able to raise the requested amount.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Бахром Рахимов проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 48 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Бахром по специальности более 11 лет проработал "мантером". В данный момент он имеет собственный магазин, где более 5 лет занимается торговлей продуктами питания. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Bahrom R. lives in the Tursun-zoda region. He is 48 years old. He is married and has four children. Bahrom has worked in his profession as a technician for eleven years. At this time he has own store where he has been selling groceries for more than five years. He is asking for a loan to increase commodity circulation.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
