This is Cecilia N., 37 years old. She lives with her family in a Habitat for Humanity village in Baseco Compound, Port Area, Manila. For ten years now, Cecilia has been selling used clothing. Then, three months ago, she ventured into direct selling of cosmetics. Her husband is an electrician. Three of their five children are in grade school.

Cecilia joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005. She has finished repaying her previous loan with CCT and is expecting a new loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos as fresh capital for her business. She is currently earning 14,000 Philippine pesos a month. From her profits, she has been able to renovate their government-subsidized row-house unit. She dreams of owning a delivery vehicle that she can use to transport her used clothing.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response to poverty and social injustice. It is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. CCT serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van L. is 50 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the local busy market for more than four years. Van L. has been blessed with two children who are married and live away from home, while her husband is a domestic ox trader. Van L. owns a plot of land that she inherited from her mother and she hopes to grow crops on it. Van L. asks for a loan to buy fertilizer and watermeL. seeds to plant.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Nhek

texts.en:
Nhek S. is 29 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She sells grocery items and weaves silk clothes to sell at the local market. She typically makes about $3 per day, while her husband earns less than $1 a day as a farm worker. This couple has two school-aged children. 

Nhek S. is asking for a loan of $1,200 as her husband needs to purchase cows to assist with his farm work.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Jane Njeri

texts.en:
Jane is 46 years old and married to George. They have two daughters and two sons, ages 18, 20, 21, and 23 years old, respectively. Jane was introduced to Kadet through an existing Kadet client. She has no loan history with other MFIs. 

Jane has been operating a salon business for the past five years, and she also operates a slaughtering business, which is her other source of income.

Jane plans to puchase cows for slaughtering to sell meat to customers with this loan. She intends to expand her business and supply meat to more clients with butcheries. Her dream is to grow her business to a level of being a meat supplier. She describes herself as an honest and hardworking businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase cows for slaughtering to sell meat to customers

loans.name: God's Time Group

texts.en: Barbara is thirty-eight years old. She is a wife and the mother of two children who are currently in school. She sells pastries such as meat pies and donuts. Barbara is constrained by a lack of funds needed to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business in order to scale up her business progress. She is the leader of a village trust bank group called God’s Time. All the members are engaged in trading. They work so hard to put food on the tables of their households and also to support their kids' schooling. They believe the loan will help them to have more resources to purchase food ingredients and stock in bulk to meet their customers' demands. They believe your support would enable them to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients and stock

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia T. is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in Purok Consing, Barangay Daga, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling the furniture made by her husband, a carpenter, and also by selling fish. Cadiz is a coastal city with a vibrant fishing industry, and many women have small businesses selling dried fish.

Alicia’s husband Jose Jimmy is a carpenter. They have five children from 13 to 22 years old, three of whom are working and help their parents with their household needs and two of whom are currently in school. All of them help their parents with the business as part of their daily chores.

Alicia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to earn an average monthly income of PHP 16,000 from her business activities.

Alicia is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 was used to fund the operations of her furniture and fish vending. It had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is taking out her 14th loan, for the amount of PHP 18,000, which she intends to use to buy supplies for her furniture-selling business, and also to maintain operations in her fish vending business. Alicia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. The photo above shows Alicia with her husband standing at the place where the furniture is made.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her furniture and fish vending business.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester E., 41 years old, desires for a better livelihood for her family. Currently she tills a small parcel of rice field to be able to earn an income for her family. She also raises a sow to produce piglets which she sells.

She has been dreaming to improve her harvest, especially because her three children are all going to school and she must help pay for their school fees. She wants this loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva field partner Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farm supplies and fertilizer and pig feed as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pig feed.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 54 years old, is married, and lives in Nyarugenge, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Marie is a self-employed businesswoman selling a variety of drinks in her bar. This is her fifth successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day.

Marie is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing more drinks so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers.

With these additional drinks for sale in her bar, Marie hopes to earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to take care of her family and use a portion of her profits to reinvest in her business.

Marie is really very thankful for any Kiva lender who will contribute to the loan so that she can increase her daily sales as well as increase the number of her customers.

loans.use: To buy additional drinks for her pub

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor tills a hectare (2.5 acres) of rice field in her town in Agusan Del Sur. She is 40 years old and has three children. Her oldest is only 10 years old and she hopes that all of them will be able to finish college someday.

Eleanor works hard at her farm to make it productive. It is the only source of income her family has so she spends all day making sure the farm is free of weeds and pests. She also sought the help of CEVI, a micro-finance institute in the Philippines. She requested Php 6,000 that she would use for farm supplies like seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla P. is from the village of Sto Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Perla owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish, shrimp and sometimes dried fish, in the local community. Perla has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Perla joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Perla is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. operates a provisions shop in Jukwa, where she sells bread and other goods. Afia has received a senior high education. She is married and has a child. Her husband is a teacher. With her business, she helps her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. 

Her loan will be used to buy varieties of provisions to fill her shop. She hopes to put some of the resulting profits from her business into savings in order to further her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy varieties of provisions for her shop

loans.name: One Word 2 Group

texts.en:
Theresa S. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called One Word 2. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children aged between 12 and 20 years old. She also cares for two nieces. She was fortunate enough to attend a teacher’s college.
For 15 years, Theresa has been producing and selling soaps and palm oil at Blama Cee Town Road in Brewerville, Liberia. Her father gave her two tins of oil to start her business. She attracts customers by producing clean, good soap, and approaching them in a good manner. Her goal is to grow her business to a shop, educate her children, and build a house for her family.
Theresa plans to use her 10,000 LRD portion of the group loan of 50,000 LRD to buy used clothes, palm oil and caustic soda to produce soap. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Theresa is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.
Join the Team LEAP – Liberia lending team on Kiva today at http://www.kiva.org/team/team_leap_liberia

loans.use: To buy used clothes, palm oil and caustic soda to produce soap.

loans.name: Sin Testigo Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sin Testigo” esta representado por el señor Jesús Reinaldo y conformado por 10 miembros 8 mujeres y 2 varones todos muy trabajadores y muy unidos. El señor Jesús Reinaldo es casado y tiene dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de bebidas en su propia licorería, el desea el financiamiento para poder comprar mercadería e incrementar su stock de venta, el reside en su propia casa donde se encuentra su licorería la cual atiende en dos turnos descansando solo en las mañanas. El resto de las socias se dedica a diferentes actividades como la venta de cosméticos, comida, ropa, libros y material escolar, transporte público y alquiler de motos en la plaza principal. Como todo negocio tienen competencia, pero saben como salir adelante la mayoría de los socios de este grupo tienen motocicletas de alquiler que es un negocio lucrativo en nuestra ciudad ya que la mayoría de las personas cuentan con una motocicleta para transitar. El crédito será destinado a la reparación de sus motocicletas, al incremento de su mercadería y a la construcción de algunas viviendas. En Agrocapital están en su primer ciclo sus antecedentes crediticios son regulares con la institución y la mayoría de los socios de este grupo han tenido experiencia en bancos comunales en otras instituciones.
texts.en:
Jesús Reinaldo represents the Sin Testigo group, which is comprised of ten members. There are eight women and two men in the group. They are all very hard-working and very united. Jesús Reinaldo is married and has two children. He sells drinks in his own liquor store. He wants the loan to be able to buy merchandise and increase his stock. He lives in his own house, which is where his liquor store is. He works in the store in two shifts, and he only rests in the mornings. The rest of the members work at different activities like selling cosmetics, food, clothes, books, or school supplies. Others work in public transportation and rent motorcycles in the main plaza. Like all businesses, they have competition. But, they know how to get ahead. Most of the members of this group have motorcycles that they rent. This is a lucrative business in our city. Most of the people count on a motorcycle for transportation. The loan is for repairs on their motorcycles, to increase merchandise, and to build some housing. They are in their first cycle with AgroCapital. Their previous loans with the institution were fine. Most of the members of the group have had experience in communal banks with other institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: Omar L. C., tiene la edad de 37 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Omar también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Omar L. C. is 37 years old. He is married, and he lives with his wife. The loan that he wants is for help on his farm. Specifically, it is to help his coffee crop. He will buy natural and chemical fertilizers. He wants to give his crops adequate upkeep in order to get better quality and the most earnings possible at harvest time. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms he got. Omar has worked in agriculture for many years. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and greater economic security. He wants to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help for his coffee crop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary D., 58, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Vicente D., a driver, they are blessed in their marriage. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own doormat-making business while overseeing operations of their jeepney.

Mary has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow six times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her doormat business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying raw materials needed to continue operations of both her rug-making business and their jeepney.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can slowly build up her very own jeepney fleet.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou G., 29, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Francisco G., a barber, and they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn an income so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own barber shop where her husband works as head barber.

Marilou has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her barber shop.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 17,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying equipment and expanding her barber shop. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buying equipment and expanding her barber shop

loans.name: Tiessiri  2 Group

texts.fr:
TIESSIRI 2  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de N’TION dans la préfecture de SAN, région de SEGOU (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 47  ans, 7 enfants et cultivent de l’arachide.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur  premier prêt de campagne.
FATOUMATA K. compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide   des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles, au grand marché de TENE. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de TENE, MOPTI et dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 30000 à 36000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri 2 group consists of married women from the village of N'tion in the prefecture of San, Segou region (Mali's Fourth Administrative District). They live in traditional families. On average, each is 47 and has seven children. They are peanut farmers. Hoping to make more profit from farming, the group decided to sign up with Soro Yiriwaso this year, and are receiving their first operational loan. Fatoumata K. plans to use her loan to buy seed peanuts, small tools, and fertilizer at the big market in Tene. After the rains end, the harvest is stored long enough to increase in value and be sold in the big market of Tene, Mopti and in nearby markets at retail (often, wholesale) to customers who mostly come from large towns. Each member of the group is counting on making a profit of between 30,000 and 36,000 CFA after their produce is sold. They will use the money to pay loan interest and day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, seed and small tools

loans.name: Valentín

texts.es:
El Sr. Valentin  tiene 65 años, está casado con Nimia Meza  de 63 años quien se dedica a la costura, ayudando económicamente para el sustento familiar.
Tienen 3 hijos, todos  mayores  de edad, dos de los cuales ya son profesionales y uno está en la facultad, viven en casa propia.
Valentin comenzó como ayudante de su padre de quien aprendió el oficio, desde muy joven trabaja por cuenta propia, actualmente está trabajando con él un sobrino a quien le remunera y a la vez le enseña el oficio.
Su gomería esta bien ubicado por lo que tiene muchos clientes.
Hoy día ha aumentado la cantidad de vehículos y motos en la zona que hace que tenga mucho trabajo, además es muy conocido por la calidad de sus servicios, motivo por el cual es muy concurrida su gomería.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de neumáticos.
texts.en:
Valentín is 65 years old. He is married to Nimia Meza, 63, who is a seamstress and helps support the family financially. They have three children, all adults. Two of the children are professionals, and one is at school. They live in their own house. Valentín began by helping his father, from whom he learned the job. For 40 years he has been working for himself. Currently, he is working with a nephew whom he pays while teaching him the job. His tire shop has a good location next to an international route and a service station. These days the number of vehicles and motorcycles in the area has increased, giving him a lot of work. He is also well-known for quality of service, and for this reason his tire shop is very busy. He needs the loan to buy tires.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of tires for retail sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Dol

texts.en: Dol S. is a longtime businessman who earns a living fishing as well as by providing a taxi service. Dol S. lives with other family members in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. He is married with nine children: three are married and live independently and the other six are single. Three of his children are employed and provide their little income for the family’s living expenses. His wife (in the photo) sells vegetables that she buys in bulk from a supplier, as well as growing them at home. Dol S. is taking out this loan to purchase a motorcycle to provide transportation for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to provide transportation for the family.

loans.name: Sharapat's Group

texts.en:
Sharapat S. is the leader of this group. She is 46 years-old and married. She has three daughters of 18, 11 and eight years-old.  Her elder daughter is a student and her youngest daughters also go to school. Her husband is a taxi driver. Sharapat breeds cattle and she started cattle breeding two years ago with the purchase of cattle for 8,000 soms.  At present,, she would like to increase the quantity of her cattle and she is applying for a loan in order to do so.   In the near future, she plans to widen the cattle shed.
 
Other group members:

Elnura K. is the treasurer of this group. She is 24 years-old and married. She has a daughter of five years-old and a son of three years-old.  Both of them are still at home. Her husband is the logistics manager at the local school.  Elnura is a teacher at the local school.  Their main source of income is their salaries. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase a refrigerator.  In the near future, they are planning to purchase their own house because for now, they rent a house. 

Zulfiia K. is 21 years-old and married.  Her husband is a bee keeper and she keeps bees together with her husband. From the profits from bee keeping, they have been able to purchase cattle for breeding. They started bee keeping two years ago with an initial investment of 40,000 soms.  Zulfiia has applied for a loan in order to purchase additional cattle for breeding.  For now, they plan to purchase furniture for their house on the profits from bee keeping. In the future, they are planning to purchase an automobile for their family. 

Iniiat S. is 60 years-old and married. She has two sons, 30 and 23 years-old and two daughters 39 and 17 years-old.  Her husband is a veterinarian. Iniiat breeds cattle and her husband helps her in his free time. She started cattle breeding five years ago with an initial investment of 16,000 soms. Her monthly income is 3,000 soms. She is applying for a loan in order to increase the quantity of cattle. In the near future,she is planning to pay for the marriage of her eldest son. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF).  MBF is a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa T. N. is 22 years old with two young children. She has had a shop that sells fish, shrimp, crabs, and snails in the local market since 2006 and makes 4,000,000 VND  interest income from this business per month. She has used her SEDA loans effectively and repaid on time. Now she wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to upgrade her store

loans.use: to upgrade her store

loans.name: Maria Juanita

texts.es:
María de 45 años, tiene una peluquería en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Ella trabajo en una peluquería cuando era joven poco a poco le fue gustando la actividad hasta que se caso y tubo que solventar algunos gastos de su familia. Compro algunos instrumento de belleza e inicio con su negocio. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 20h00pm haciendo cortes de cabello y peinados. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar  cemento, pinturas, piedras para construir mejor su peluquería y casa. En el futuro quiere irse a otro sector para tener mas ingresos con su negocio.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and owns a beauty salon in the space behind her house. She lives in the perimeter of Guayaquil (a suburban zone around the saltwater estuary).

She has worked in a salon since she was young. Gradually, she came to like this work since she married and had to help with her family's bills. She bought some beauty instruments and started her business. Currently, she works from 9AM until 8PM, cutting and styling hair.

With the loan, she wishes to buy cement, paint, and stone to improve her salon and house. In the future, she wishes to move to another area to have better income with her business.

loans.use: Cement, stone and sand.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret N. lives in the Kyebando neighborhood in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children who attend school.   Gorret is a poultry farmer.  She has been in this business for two years, and she works seven days a week. Gorret has requested for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of  poultry feed.   The main business challenges for Gorret include thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 2000 chickens.  Gorret owns her home; she doesn't have access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Муратова Назокат проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 32 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж на заработках в России. Сама Назокат имеет среднее образование. Работает на рынке "Дехкон". Арендует торговую точку, где продает лепешки (национальный хлеб). Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Nazokat M. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 32 years old, married and has 3 children.  Her husband works in Russia.  Nazokat has a secondary education.  She works at the "Dehkon" market, where she leases a retail stand and sell flat bread (national bread).  She has been involved in this business for over 10 years.  She is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Byambahuu

texts.en:
Byambahuu T. is 54 years old and lives with her husband and and daughter in their own house and fence in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her older two children both live on their own while her youngest daughter attends university. 

Byambahuu sells women’s handbags in the largest Ulaanbaatar market, Narantuul. She began her business in 1995 and since has built a stable and successful operation. Most of her siblings and relatives have also operated a variety of bag-selling business. She purchases bags from China. 

Today her working capital is 2,500,000 MNT and her daily average sales income is between 50,000 and 80,000 MNT. Byambahuu is a clever and hard-working businesswoman and says, " Now I am planning to buy a car for my daughter." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more quality and well designed leather handbags from Beijing, the capital city of China.

loans.use: To purchase more good quality and well designed leather handbags

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia R., 42 years old, is from the town of Trinidad. She is married and has three children aged 14, 7 and 6. Alicia's business, a sari-sari (general) store, sells various products including sardines, sugar and cigarettes. She has been running the store for more than two years now and earns approximately PHP 3000 every month. Alicia works hard to earn more and be better able to sustain her family's needs, especially her children's education.

Alicia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carminda

texts.es:
la señora Carminda García R. tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos.
Carminda se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado y accesorios para damas y caballeros.
Carminda se levanta muy temprano todos los dias de lunes a domingo para abrir su negocio y atender a sus clientes, les ofrece sandalias para hombre y mujer ropà para caballeros, damas, zapatos, gorras, adornos,
utencilios de cocina, ventiladores.
su negocio esta ubicado en la calle principal del mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para tener bien surtido su negocio.
su sueño es construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Carminda García R. is 45 years old.  She is a single mother and has three children.

Carminda sells clothes, footwear, and men's and women's accessories.

Carminda gets up very early every day, from Monday to Sunday, to open her business and serve her customers.  She offers them men's and women's sandals, men's and women's clothes, shoes, caps, decorations, cooking utensils and fans.  Her business is located in the main street of the 'Mercado Nuevo' (New Market) in San Lorenzo.

Carminda will use her loan to buy merchandise to better stock her business.  Her dream is to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, shoes, purses, glue, hooks, bracelets, talcum powder, deodorants, creams, lotions, and perfumes

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 58 years old and married with two children between the ages 17 and 26. Angelique runs a butcher business, where she sells beef to the local community. She has a shop where she employs three people to help her run the business.

Angelique will use the loan to purchase two cows, with the aim of expanding her business. With this loan, she hopes to earn more profits which will be used to continue paying school fees for her three relatives, as well as build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia belongs to Jaranwala, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family for 14 years. She has given birth to four daughters and a son. All of them are very young and stay at home. Razia is not in a position to enroll them in school due to financial constraints. 

Her husband’s name is M. S. and he operates a vegetable selling business.
 
To financially assist her husband, Razia weaves carpets on order. She is very good at her art and her carpets sell for a very good price. She also sells clothes to her neighboring clients to supplement the income of her family. Besides doing her businesses, she also manages her household work very well. 
 
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes selling business. With the loan, she will purchase clothes from the city of Lahore in bulk to minimize the cost of traveling and to increase her profits by offering more variety to her clients.
 
She has been operating this business for the past five years and is very confident about its growth as a result of a loan investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Serafín

texts.es:
El sr. Serafín  está casado con la sra. Amelia Bogado, tienen 6 hijas, 5 mayores y una en edad escolar, se dedica a la carpintería y fabricación de muebles rústicos, este oficio lo aprendió en una empresa grande que se dedica al mismo rubro, pero ahora tiene su negocio en su domicilio.
El crédito será de gran ayuda para la compra de más madera, ya que tiene mucha cantidad de pedidos.
Don S. desea comprar un vehículo y transportar en él su mercadería.
texts.en:
Serafín is married to Mrs. Amelia Bogado.  They have six daughters, five adults and one who is school age.   He is a carpenter and makes rustic furniture.  He leaned this skill while working at a large firm engaged in the same line of work.  Now, however, he has his business at home.

The loan will be of great help to buy more lumber because he has quite a few pending orders.

Mr. S. wants to buy a vehicle to transport his merchandise.

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: El señor José Francisco,  tiene la edad de 64 años , habita la comarca lomas del Gavilán ubicado en Masaya en lo que corresponde a la zona Rural; junto a su esposa que es ama de casa y  sus tres hijos ya todos independientes y laboran en diversas actividades lo cual le permite que le apoyen  los fines de semana en el cultivo de  yuca ,   don S. desde hace 45 años  trabaja en sus tierras como pequeño agricultor  trabajando  cultivo de yuca que es su fuerte demanda y granos básico . Por la situación económica, pérdidas de cosechas y otros factores que le afectan no ha logrado comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para tener una buena producción y poder vender a un mejor precio; pero para esto poder realizarse necesita de un financiamiento agrícola para poder inducir todas las plantas. El mayor sueño de don José es poder establecer barreras vivas en el perímetro de la finca.
texts.en: José Francisco is 64 years old.  He lives in the Lomas del Gavilán region, located in a rural area of Masaya department.  He lives with his wife, who is a housewife, and his three children, who are all already independent and work in various occupations which allow them to help him on the weekends growing yucca.  For the last 45 years, Mr. S. has worked on his land as a small farmer growing yucca, which is in high demand and is a basic staple.  Due to the economic situation, lost crops, and other factors affecting him, he has not been able to buy fertilizer and supplies necessary in order to have a good harvest and to be able to sell at a better price.  In order to do this, he needs an agricultural loan in order to be able to fertilize all his plants.  José's greatest dream is to be able to establish hedgerows around the perimeter of his farm.

loans.use: Fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Joseph Njoroge

texts.en:
Joseph Njoroge K. buys and sells firewood in Limuru town. He has been in this business for the last seven years, and earns an income of KES. 40,000 per month. He 27 years old, married to Ruth, and they have one child.  

He has never borrowed from any other MFI, and he learned about KADET from a member of a group registered with KADET. He is applying for a third loan from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to buy a power saw for cutting firewood.        

Joseph intends to save the anticipated profits to set up a business premise and provide the best living standard for his family.

loans.use: To buy a power saw for cutting firewood.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
El Señor Luciano es cliente recurrente de nuestra Institución, está casado con la señora Graciela Acosta, son padres de dos hijos, cuentan con casa propia ubicada en el Barrio Remansito de Ciudad del Este.
El Sr. Luciano es de profesión albañil, constructor de todo tipo de obras, mientras que la Sra. Graciela es ama de casa.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya la esperanza de obtener una ayuda crediticia, ya que se consideran personas honestas y con un espíritu de lucha en la labor diaria.
El desea invertir el crédito en gastos particulares, pues ahora mismo sólo con esta ayuda podrían obtener un nivel de vida digna, se compromete así mismo a pagar las cuotas de manera puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Luciano is a returning client of our institution.  He is married to Graciela Acosta, and they are the parents of 2 children.  They have their own home located in the Remansito neighborhood of Ciudad del Este.

Luciano works as a bricklayer and he does all types of construction, while Graciela is a housewife.

He appreciates the Fundación Paraguaya for the financial support that they provide, since they are considered to be honest people who have a fighting spirit in their daily work.

He wants to use this loan for private expenditures.   Now, only with this help, will he be able to obtain a decent standard of living.  He pledges to make his loan payments in a responsible and punctual manner.

loans.use: private expenses

loans.name: Yeson-Erdene

texts.en:
Yeson-Erdene is a married woman, age 39, who lives with her husband and two children in a house in Tuv province, Mongolia. Her husband is a herdsman with a total of 70 husbandry animals. Her two children, ages 4 and 6, both attend kindergarten. She operates a grocery store in her town. 

At first she used to rent a small booth where she sold a variety of grocery items. She started her grocery trading business in 2000. With 11 years of business experience, she has managed to expand her business into a medium-sized grocery store. Her business success is due to the good location of her store which is placed between residential apartments and schools. She is a diligent woman who wants to expand her grocery store into a supermarket. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery items for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items.

loans.name: Bernaliza

texts.en:
Bernaliza L. is 23 years old and married to Bryan, a contractual worker. She is a college graduate and decided to run a micro-enterprise. She is a resident of Bancal, Carmona, Cavite City, Philippines. 

Bernaliza has operated their own internet cafe for two years now.  She rents out computer units at a low charge per hour to all surfers, social networkers and even to students who would like to do their research on the Internet.  She also offers printing job, encoding, scanning and photo printing. With this business, Bernaliza earns an estimated net income of around 350 PHP a day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to pay for the cost of upgrading hardware and computer programs to compete with other neighboring Internet cafes. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for upgrading computer programs and hardware.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is from the village of Burgos, Oroquieta City, Philippines. He is 61 years old, married and has eight adult children. Felipe runs a fish selling business.

He has been engaged in his business for 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. Felipe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities.

Felipe is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP with which he will purchase more fish to sell. This will be his second loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene 25 años, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, Pablo de 50 años y Nieves de 49 años. Junto viven en la localidad de Alto Yapaz (selva central peruana). Cuidar adecuadamente sus chacras es su principal función, desde hace 12 años le gusta ver como se desarrollan las plantaciones de plátanos, café, frutas cítricas, entre otros productos oriundos de esta zona. Aunque le incomoda tener que limpiarlos a menudo pues no le gusta machetear ni retirar la maleza, ya que asegura que estando a diario con esta actividad sus brazos le duelen, por eso prefiere plantar, fertilizar y cosechar. Por otro lado, pone en práctica las técnicas agrícolas que le enseñó su padre. En adelante desea continuar plantando más café y plátano, productos muy solicitados por los mercados, además de construir su propia casa, para instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles, donde pueda atender su futura esposa. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los progresistas”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde comenta que desde un principio trabaja de manera activa en su banco comunal, junto a los integrantes. Juan, con el crédito, podrá comprar plantas de café y varios sacos de abono para fertilizar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan is 25 years old, single, and lives in his parents' home.  His parents are 50 year-old Pablo and 49 year-old Nieves.  They live together in the town of Alto Yapaz (in the central Peruvian jungle).  Juan's main job is to properly care for his plantations.  He has been in this business for 12 years and he enjoys watching his plantations of bananas, coffee, citrus fruit and other native products grow.  It is difficult having to weed his plantations often.  He doesn't like cutting or pulling weeds because he says that his arms ache from carrying out this work every day.  For this reason, he prefers planting, fertilizing and harvesting.  He puts into practice the techniques that his father taught him.

In the future, Juan would like to continue planting more coffee and bananas as these are products that are very much in demand in the market.  He would also like to build his own home and set up a grocery store where his future wife can work.

Juan is a member of the "Los Progresistas" community bank and this is his third loan from MFP.  He says that he has worked as an active member of his group since he joined.  Juan will use his loan to buy coffee plants and several sacks of fertilizer to fertilize his crops.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and sacks of organic fertilizer
